original: 'phags pa gzhi thams cad yod par smra ba'i 'dul ba'i sde snod 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'og tu 'phags pa 'od srungs chen po la sogs pa dgra bcom pa lnga brgya 'dus nas tshangs par spyod pa yun ring
analyzed: 'phags pa gzhi thams cad yod par smra ba'i 'dul ba'i sde snod 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'og tu 'phags pa 'od srungs chen po la sogs pa dgra bcom pa lnga brgya 'dus nas tshangs par spyod pa yun ring
translated: This Vinaya Piṭaka of the Ārya-Vaibhāṣika, after the Blessed Buddha's parinirvāṇa, was compiled by the assembly of five hundred arhats, including the noble Mahākāśyapa. The pure conduct

original: du gnas par bya ba'i phyir dang / skye bo mang po la phan gdags pa'i phyir 'dul ba 'dzin pa'i mchog 'phags pa nye ba 'khor la yang dag par bsdu bar gsol nas 'phags pa nye ba 'khor gyis yang dag par bsdus so //
analyzed: du gnas par bya ba'i phyir dang / skye bo mang po la phan gdags pa'i phyir 'dul ba 'dzin pa'i mchog 'phags pa nye ba 'khor la yang dag par bsdu bar gsol nas 'phags pa nye ba 'khor gyis yang dag par bsdus so //
translated: and in order to benefit many people, he requested the foremost of the Vinaya-holders, the noble Upali, to compile it, and the noble Upali compiled it.

original: gzhi thams cad yod par smra ba'i 'dul ba'i sde snod ni dum bu bzhi ste /
analyzed: gzhi thams cad yod par smra ba'i 'dul ba'i sde snod ni dum bu bzhi ste /
translated: The Vinaya-pitaka of the Mulasarvastivadins has four parts:

original: 'dul ba rnam par 'byed pa dang / 'dul ba gzhi dang / 'dul ba gzhung phyi ma dang / 'dul ba phran tshegs so //
analyzed: 'dul ba rnam par 'byed pa dang / 'dul ba gzhi dang / 'dul ba gzhung phyi ma dang / 'dul ba phran tshegs so //
translated: the Vinaya-vibhanga, the Vinaya-ksudraka-vastu, the Vinaya-uttara-grantha, and the Vinaya-prakirnaka.

original: de dag gi gnas pa'i snying dang snying po ni so sor thar pa'i mdo 'di yin no //
analyzed: de dag gi gnas pa'i snying dang snying po ni so sor thar pa'i mdo 'di yin no //
translated: The heart and essence of these is this Pratimoksha Sutra.

original: de dag yang dag par sdud pa yang ma 'ongs pa'i skye bo lung dang rtogs pa'i bdag nyid med pa ngag yan chad la sgro 'dogs pa dang skur ba 'debs pa'i mtha' spang bar bya ba dang / nyan pa po brjod pa nyung dus don gyi spyi rtogs par 'dod pa dag la phan gdags pa'i phyir sdom pa rnam pa gsum du bsdus te /
analyzed: de dag yang dag par sdud pa yang ma 'ongs pa'i skye bo lung dang rtogs pa'i bdag nyid med pa ngag yan chad la sgro 'dogs pa dang skur ba 'debs pa'i mtha' spang bar bya ba dang / nyan pa po brjod pa nyung dus don gyi spyi rtogs par 'dod pa dag la phan gdags pa'i phyir sdom pa rnam pa gsum du bsdus te /
translated: Also, in order to benefit those who wish to understand the general meaning through few words, the three summaries are composed:

original: spyi'i sdom dang / dngos kyi sdom dang / bar sdom mo //
analyzed: spyi'i sdom dang / dngos kyi sdom dang / bar sdom mo //
translated: the general summary, the actual summary, and the intermediate summary.

original: de la spyi'i sdom ni spyi'i don tshigs su bcad pas ba sdus pa'o //
analyzed: de la spyi'i sdom ni spyi'i don tshigs su bcad pas ba sdus pa'o //
translated: The general summary is the summary of the general meaning in verses.

original: dngos kyi sdom ni dngos kyi don tshigs su bcad pas bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: dngos kyi sdom ni dngos kyi don tshigs su bcad pas bsdus pa'o //
translated: The actual summary is the summary of the actual meaning in verses.

original: bar sdom ni yan lag gi don tshigs su bcad pas bsdus pa ste /
analyzed: bar sdom ni yan lag gi don tshigs su bcad pas bsdus pa ste /
translated: The intermediate summary is the summary of the branch meaning in verses.

original: de dag kyang lung gi skabs dang sbyar te ci rigs par gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: de dag kyang lung gi skabs dang sbyar te ci rigs par gzung bar bya'o //
translated: Those should be understood as appropriate in the context of the scriptures.

original: de la so sor thar pa'i mdo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de la so sor thar pa'i mdo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Regarding that, the so-called Pratimokṣa Sūtra is the summary of the general meaning.

original: don las bstan bcos kyi ming du btags pa ste /
analyzed: don las bstan bcos kyi ming du btags pa ste /
translated: The name of the treatise is derived from its subject matter.

original: so sor thar pa zhes bya ba ni dang por thar pa de /🔽dang po sdom pa yang dag par len pa'i tshe na gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba'i tshig bzlas nas sdom pa yang dag par blang pa'i tshig brjod pa gsum pa'i cha tha ma sdom pa thob @162a * //
analyzed: so sor thar pa zhes bya ba ni dang por thar pa de / dang po sdom pa yang dag par len pa'i tshe na gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba'i tshig bzlas nas sdom pa yang dag par blang pa'i tshig brjod pa gsum pa'i cha tha ma sdom pa thob @162a * //
translated: The term pratimoksa means “individual liberation.”🔽The first moment of the pratimoksa is the first moment of obtaining the vow.

original: pa ni thog mar sdom pa thob pa'i gnas skabs yin pas na dang po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: pa ni thog mar sdom pa thob pa'i gnas skabs yin pas na dang po zhes bya'o //
translated: The first moment of obtaining the vow is the initial occasion of obtaining the vow.

original: thar pa zhes bya ba ni grol ba ste /
analyzed: thar pa zhes bya ba ni grol ba ste /
translated: Liberation means freedom.

original: de ltar sdom pa dang po thob pa de nyid kyi tshe na sdom pa ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid las grol ba ste /
analyzed: de ltar sdom pa dang po thob pa de nyid kyi tshe na sdom pa ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid las grol ba ste /
translated: At the time of first obtaining the vow, one is freed from the characteristics of nonvows.

original: sdom pa'i mtshan nyid kyis bsdus pa'i rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i skabs thob pa'o //🔽de ltar dang po thar pa'i don de las bstan bcos 'di 'byung ba'am /
analyzed: sdom pa'i mtshan nyid kyis bsdus pa'i rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i skabs thob pa'o // de ltar dang po thar pa'i don de las bstan bcos 'di 'byung ba'am /
translated: One obtains the occasion of the nonindicative form that is subsumed by the characteristics of the vow.

original: don 'di bstan bcos 'dir bsdus pas /
analyzed: don 'di bstan bcos 'dir bsdus pas /
translated: This treatise is derived from the meaning of the first moment of liberation or this meaning is subsumed in this treatise.

original: bstan bcos 'di'i ming yang dang por thar pa zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: bstan bcos 'di'i ming yang dang por thar pa zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The treatise is also called the “Discourse on Liberation.

original: rnam grangs gzhan du so sor thar pa zhes bya bar bstan te /
analyzed: rnam grangs gzhan du so sor thar pa zhes bya bar bstan te /
translated: ” It is also called the “Discourse on Individual Liberation.

original: so sor zhes bya ba ni rgyud tha dad pa'o //🔽thar pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par grol ba ste gang zag rgyud tha dad pa gang zhig gis sdom pa yang dag par blangs te /
analyzed: so sor zhes bya ba ni rgyud tha dad pa'o // thar pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par grol ba ste gang zag rgyud tha dad pa gang zhig gis sdom pa yang dag par blangs te /
translated: ” “Individual” means different mind-streams.

original: bslab pa'i gzhi rjes su sgrub par byed pa de nyid ngan 'gro dang 'khor ba las rnam par grol bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: bslab pa'i gzhi rjes su sgrub par byed pa de nyid ngan 'gro dang 'khor ba las rnam par grol bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: “Liberation” means freedom. It is called “individual liberation” because those who have taken up the vow and are practicing the bases of training are liberated from unfortunate rebirths and cyclic existence.

original: gzhan gyi sdom pa yang dag par slangs te slob pa'i gzhi rjes su bsgrub pas gzhan rnam par grol bar mi 'gyur bas so sor thar pa zhes bya'i //🔽de ltar so sor thar pa'i don de las bstan bcos 'di 'byung ba'am /
analyzed: gzhan gyi sdom pa yang dag par slangs te slob pa'i gzhi rjes su bsgrub pas gzhan rnam par grol bar mi 'gyur bas so sor thar pa zhes bya'i // de ltar so sor thar pa'i don de las bstan bcos 'di 'byung ba'am /
translated: But others are not liberated by taking up the vow and practicing the bases of training.

original: don de bstan bcos 'dir bsdus pas bstan bcos 'di'i ming yang so sor thar pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: don de bstan bcos 'dir bsdus pas bstan bcos 'di'i ming yang so sor thar pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, this treatise is called “Discourse on Individual Liberation” because it is derived from the meaning of “individual liberation” or because that meaning is included in this treatise.

original: yang rnam grangs gzhan du thar pa'i skabs zhes bya bar bstan te /
analyzed: yang rnam grangs gzhan du thar pa'i skabs zhes bya bar bstan te /
translated: Another alternative: it is called the occasion of liberation.

original: so sor zhes bya bas ni phyir zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: so sor zhes bya bas ni phyir zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The word “each” means “individually.”

original: thabs kyi don to //
analyzed: thabs kyi don to //
translated: It is the meaning of the method.

original: thar pa zhes bya ba ni nges par 'byung ba ste mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: thar pa zhes bya ba ni nges par 'byung ba ste mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: Liberation is the emergence from suffering, i.e., nirvana.

original: des na so sor thar pa'i mdo 'di ni nges par 'byung ba'i thabs kyi phyir gsungs pa ste ;
analyzed: des na so sor thar pa'i mdo 'di ni nges par 'byung ba'i thabs kyi phyir gsungs pa ste ;
translated: Therefore, this Sutra of the Individual Liberation was taught as the method of emergence.

original: lhag pa'i tshul khrims la brten nas lhag pa'i sems skye la /
analyzed: lhag pa'i tshul khrims la brten nas lhag pa'i sems skye la /
translated: On the basis of the superior morality, the superior thought of mind arises.

original: lhag pa'i sems la brten nas lhag pa'i shes rab bskyed pa'i rim gyis nges par 'byung ba thob pa'i thabs su gyur pa'i phyir so sor thar pa'i mdo 'di ni nges par 'byung ba'i tshul khrims yin pas thar pa'i thabs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lhag pa'i sems la brten nas lhag pa'i shes rab bskyed pa'i rim gyis nges par 'byung ba thob pa'i thabs su gyur pa'i phyir so sor thar pa'i mdo 'di ni nges par 'byung ba'i tshul khrims yin pas thar pa'i thabs zhes bya'o //
translated: On the basis of the superior thought of mind, the superior wisdom arises. Through the process of generating these, one attains liberation. Since this Sutra of the Individual Liberation is the method of attaining liberation, it is called the method of liberation.

original: de ltar thar pa'i don de las bstan bcos 'di 'byung ba'am don de bstan bcos 'dir bsdus pas /
analyzed: de ltar thar pa'i don de las bstan bcos 'di 'byung ba'am don de bstan bcos 'dir bsdus pas /
translated: Since this treatise arises from that meaning of liberation or since that meaning is included in this treatise,

original: bstan bcos 'di'i ming yang thar pa'i thabs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bstan bcos 'di'i ming yang thar pa'i thabs zhes bya'o //
translated: This treatise is also called the “Method of Liberation.”

original: mdo zhes bya ba ni mdo'i don mdo tsam zhig ston pas mdo zhes bya ste /
analyzed: mdo zhes bya ba ni mdo'i don mdo tsam zhig ston pas mdo zhes bya ste /
translated: A sūtra is so called because it teaches the meaning of the sūtra in brief.

original: de ltar bstan bcos 'di ni @162b dang por thar pa'i mdo zhes bya ba dang / so sor thar pa'i mdo zhes bya ba dang / thar pa'i thabs kyi mdo zhes bya ba dag tu ston to //
analyzed: de ltar bstan bcos 'di ni @162b dang por thar pa'i mdo zhes bya ba dang / so sor thar pa'i mdo zhes bya ba dang / thar pa'i thabs kyi mdo zhes bya ba dag tu ston to //
translated: Thus, this treatise is taught as the “Sūtra of Liberation,” the “Sūtra of Individual Liberation,” and the “Sūtra of the Method of Liberation.”

original: de las so sor thar pa 'di'i bsdus pa'i don ni mtshan nyid rnam lngas bstan te /
analyzed: de las so sor thar pa 'di'i bsdus pa'i don ni mtshan nyid rnam lngas bstan te /
translated: The summarized meaning of this Individual Liberation is taught by five characteristics:

original: mchod pa dang gleng bslang pa dang / yang dag par brtsams pa dang / gzhung rgyas pa dang / bsdu pa'i mtshan nyid kyis so //
analyzed: mchod pa dang gleng bslang pa dang / yang dag par brtsams pa dang / gzhung rgyas pa dang / bsdu pa'i mtshan nyid kyis so //
translated: the characteristic of worship, the characteristic of introduction, the characteristic of correct composition, the characteristic of extensive text, and the characteristic of summary.

original: de la mchod pa'i mtshan nyid ni /
analyzed: de la mchod pa'i mtshan nyid ni /
translated: The characteristic of worship is taught by two verses beginning with:

original: snyan pa'i ba dan 'jig rten gsum du grags //
analyzed: snyan pa'i ba dan 'jig rten gsum du grags //
translated: The banner of fame resounds in the three worlds.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyis bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyis bstan to //
translated: The characteristic of introduction is taught by:

original: gleng bslang ba'i mtshan nyid ni sangs rgyas 'dul ba gang chan mtsho //
analyzed: gleng bslang ba'i mtshan nyid ni sangs rgyas 'dul ba gang chan mtsho //
translated: The Buddha, the ocean of discipline.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa bcu gcig gis bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa bcu gcig gis bstan to //
translated: This is explained in eleven verses.

original: yang dag par brtsams pa'i mtshan nyid ni /
analyzed: yang dag par brtsams pa'i mtshan nyid ni /
translated: The characteristic of proper undertaking is

original: bskal pa bye ba rnams su yang //
analyzed: bskal pa bye ba rnams su yang //
translated: Even in ten million eons

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa drug gis bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa drug gis bstan to //
translated: This is explained in six verses.

original: gzhung rgyas pa'i mtshan nyid ni tshe dang ldan pa dag so ga rnams kyi 'das pa dang / lhag ma ji tsam pa de tsam mo zhes bya ba nas dran pa dang bag yod pas rnal 'byor du bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyi gzhung thams cad kyis bstan to //
analyzed: gzhung rgyas pa'i mtshan nyid ni tshe dang ldan pa dag so ga rnams kyi 'das pa dang / lhag ma ji tsam pa de tsam mo zhes bya ba nas dran pa dang bag yod pas rnal 'byor du bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyi gzhung thams cad kyis bstan to //
translated: The characteristic of extensive scripture is explained in the entire text from Venerable ones, the spring season has passed and the summer season is approaching. Whatever remains of the summer season, that much remains of our lives.  up to One should practice with mindfulness and heedfulness.

original: bsdu ba'i mtshan nyid ni /
analyzed: bsdu ba'i mtshan nyid ni /
translated: The characteristic of compilation is

original: bzod pa dka' thub dam pa bzod pa ni //
analyzed: bzod pa dka' thub dam pa bzod pa ni //
translated: Patience is the highest austerity

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i gzhung lhag ma thams cad kyis bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i gzhung lhag ma thams cad kyis bstan to //
translated: This is explained in the entire remaining text.

original: de la re zhig mchod pa'i mtshan nyid bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de la re zhig mchod pa'i mtshan nyid bshad par bya ste /
translated: Now, the characteristic of worship should be explained.

original: mchod pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni so sor thar pa'i mdo yang dag par brtsams pa gleng bslang ba'i dang por ston pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la bstod pa dang phyag 'tshal ba'i sgo nas mchod pa bya'o //
analyzed: mchod pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni so sor thar pa'i mdo yang dag par brtsams pa gleng bslang ba'i dang por ston pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la bstod pa dang phyag 'tshal ba'i sgo nas mchod pa bya'o //
translated: The characteristic of worship is stated at the beginning of the composition of the Pratimoksha Sutra, in order to worship the Teacher, the Blessed Buddha, by praising and paying homage to him.

original: de yang dam pa rnams ni yang dag par rtsom pa thams cad la rang gi ston pa la bstong pa dang phyag 'tshal ba'i sgo nas mchod pa sngar byed pas de'i phyir yang dag par sdud par byed pas so sor thar pa'i mdo yang dag par sdud 'dod
analyzed: de yang dam pa rnams ni yang dag par rtsom pa thams cad la rang gi ston pa la bstong pa dang phyag 'tshal ba'i sgo nas mchod pa sngar byed pas de'i phyir yang dag par sdud par byed pas so sor thar pa'i mdo yang dag par sdud 'dod
translated: Moreover, the holy ones, in all their compositions, worship by praising and paying homage to their own teacher at the beginning. Therefore, the one who wishes to compose the Pratimoksha Sutra,

original: pas kyang 'gro ba mtha' dag gi gtso bo sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la bstod pa dang phyag 'tshal ba'i sgo nas mchod pa bya ba'i phyir dang por /
analyzed: pas kyang 'gro ba mtha' dag gi gtso bo sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la bstod pa dang phyag 'tshal ba'i sgo nas mchod pa bya ba'i phyir dang por /
translated: in order to collect it, also worships the Blessed Buddha, the foremost of all beings, by praising and paying homage to him at the beginning.

original: snyan pa'i ba dan 'jig rten gsum du grags //
analyzed: snyan pa'i ba dan 'jig rten gsum du grags //
translated: The banner of fame resounds in the three worlds.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gnyis gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gnyis gsungs so //
translated: Thus, he speaks two verses beginning with this.

original: de la re zhig dang po kho nar tshigs su bcad pa gnyis po 'di'i brjod par bya ba dang / dgos pa dang / 'brel @163a * //
analyzed: de la re zhig dang po kho nar tshigs su bcad pa gnyis po 'di'i brjod par bya ba dang / dgos pa dang / 'brel @163a * //
translated: First, the subject matter, purpose, and connection of these two verses should be understood.🔽

original: ba dang / dgos pa'i yang dgos pa brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: ba dang / dgos pa'i yang dgos pa brjod par bya ste /
translated: First of all, the subject matter, purpose, connection, and the purpose of the purpose of these two verses should be stated.

original: gzhan yang brjod par bya ba la sogs pa dang bral ba'i tshigs su bcad pa gnyis po 'di so sor thar pa 'don pa'i dang por smos pa don dang por smos pa don dang ldan pa ma yin pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang brjod par bya ba la sogs pa dang bral ba'i tshigs su bcad pa gnyis po 'di so sor thar pa 'don pa'i dang por smos pa don dang por smos pa don dang ldan pa ma yin pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, these two verses, which are devoid of subject matter, etc., are mentioned at the beginning of the recitation of the Prātimokṣa. If they are not connected with the subject matter, etc., they would be meaningless at the beginning.

original: gang gi phyir rtog pa dang ldan pa dag brjod par bya ba la sogs pa dang bral ba khas len par mi byed pa de'i phyir nyan pa'i skye bo spro bar bya ba'i don du brjod par bya ba la sogs pa nges par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rtog pa dang ldan pa dag brjod par bya ba la sogs pa dang bral ba khas len par mi byed pa de'i phyir nyan pa'i skye bo spro bar bya ba'i don du brjod par bya ba la sogs pa nges par brjod par bya'o //
translated: Since those who are intelligent do not accept that which is devoid of subject matter, etc., therefore, in order to encourage the audience, the subject matter, etc., should be stated.

original: de la brjod par bya ba ni tshigs su bcad pa gnyis so //
analyzed: de la brjod par bya ba ni tshigs su bcad pa gnyis so //
translated: The subject matter is the two verses.

original: 'di las tshigs su bcad pa phyed dang gnyis kyis bcom ldan 'das kyi yon tan gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa dang / bdag gi don phun sum tshogs pa mchog brjod pa'o //
analyzed: 'di las tshigs su bcad pa phyed dang gnyis kyis bcom ldan 'das kyi yon tan gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa dang / bdag gi don phun sum tshogs pa mchog brjod pa'o //
translated: In this verse, the first half praises the excellence of the Lord's benefit for others, and the second half praises the excellence of His benefit for self.

original: dgos pa ni der bstan te /
analyzed: dgos pa ni der bstan te /
translated: The purpose is shown in that.

original: de yang tshigs su bcad pa phyed dang gnyis kyis sgrub par byed pas tshigs su bcad pa'i thabs 'dis brjod par bya ba thabs las byung ba bstan pa ni dgos pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang tshigs su bcad pa phyed dang gnyis kyis sgrub par byed pas tshigs su bcad pa'i thabs 'dis brjod par bya ba thabs las byung ba bstan pa ni dgos pa yin no //
translated: And that is taught by the first half of the verse, which is the means of composition. The teaching of the subject matter arising from the means is the purpose.

original: 'brel pa ni tshigs su bcad pa phyed dang gnyis po'i thabs dang dgos pa thabs las byung ba'i mtshan nyid gnyis 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: 'brel pa ni tshigs su bcad pa phyed dang gnyis po'i thabs dang dgos pa thabs las byung ba'i mtshan nyid gnyis 'brel pa'o //
translated: The connection is between the two characteristics of the means and the purpose arising from the means, which are taught by the first half of the verse.

original: dgos pa'i dgos pa ni bstod pa 'di brtsams na bstan bcos yongs su rdzogs par bya ba la bgegs dang log 'dren bzlog pa'am ;
analyzed: dgos pa'i dgos pa ni bstod pa 'di brtsams na bstan bcos yongs su rdzogs par bya ba la bgegs dang log 'dren bzlog pa'am ;
translated: The ultimate purpose is that, when this praise is composed, the treatise is completed, and obstacles and misleaders are averted,

original: dam pa rnams kyi cho ga'i rjes su 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: dam pa rnams kyi cho ga'i rjes su 'jug pa'o //
translated: or one follows the rite of the holy ones.

original: tshigs su bcad pa 'og nas phyed kyis ni so sor thar pa brtsam pa dam bca' bar ston te /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa 'og nas phyed kyis ni so sor thar pa brtsam pa dam bca' bar ston te /
translated: The second half of the next verse shows the author's commitment to compose the Prātimokṣa.

original: de yang rtog pa sngon du gtang ba dag gis 'jug pa'i yan lag yin no //
analyzed: de yang rtog pa sngon du gtang ba dag gis 'jug pa'i yan lag yin no //
translated: And that is a limb of engagement for those who have previously reflected.

original: de la tshigs su bcad pa phyed dang gnyis po 'di'i bsdus pa'i don ni rnam pa gnyis ta /
analyzed: de la tshigs su bcad pa phyed dang gnyis po 'di'i bsdus pa'i don ni rnam pa gnyis ta /
translated: The condensed meaning of this verse and a half is twofold:

original: ston pa la bstod pa'i sgo nas mchod pa dang / phyag 'tshal ba'i sgo nas mchod pa'o //
analyzed: ston pa la bstod pa'i sgo nas mchod pa dang / phyag 'tshal ba'i sgo nas mchod pa'o //
translated: worship through praise and worship through homage.

original: de la bstod pa'i sgo nas mchod pa la yang gnyis te /
analyzed: de la bstod pa'i sgo nas mchod pa la yang gnyis te /
translated: And worship through praise is also twofold:

original: 'gro ba'i gtso bo yang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi yon tan gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa dang / bdag gi don phun tshogs pa'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i gtso bo yang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi yon tan gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa dang / bdag gi don phun tshogs pa'i sgo nas so //
translated: the chief of beings, the Lord Buddha, is praised through his perfection of the aims of others and through his perfection of his own aim.

original: de la gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa ni tshigs su bcad pa dang po gcig gis bstan to //
analyzed: de la gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa ni tshigs su bcad pa dang po gcig gis bstan to //
translated: Therein, the perfection of the aims of others is taught in the first verse.

original: des kyang 'gro ba'i gtso bo sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi yon tan gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'i thabs su gyur pa'i phun sum tshogs pa rnam pa lngas @163b bstan te /
analyzed: des kyang 'gro ba'i gtso bo sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi yon tan gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'i thabs su gyur pa'i phun sum tshogs pa rnam pa lngas @163b bstan te /
translated: The Lord Buddha, the foremost of beings, is shown by five perfections of excellence, which are the means for the perfection of the benefit of others.

original: rgyu phun sum tshogs pa dang / phan 'dogs pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / shes rab phun sum tshogs pa dang / thugs rje phun sum tshogs pa dang / 'bras bu'i khyad par phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu phun sum tshogs pa dang / phan 'dogs pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / shes rab phun sum tshogs pa dang / thugs rje phun sum tshogs pa dang / 'bras bu'i khyad par phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: The perfection of cause, the perfection of benefit, the perfection of wisdom, the perfection of compassion, and the perfection of the special result.

original: snyan pa'i ba dan 'jig rten gsum du grabs //
analyzed: snyan pa'i ba dan 'jig rten gsum du grabs //
translated: The banner of fame is unfurled in the three worlds.

original: zhes bya bas ni rgyu phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya bas ni rgyu phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
translated: This shows the perfection of cause.

original: dam pa'i chos sgra seng ge'i sgra bsgrags pa //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos sgra seng ge'i sgra bsgrags pa //
translated: The sound of the Dharma is proclaimed like the lion’s roar.

original: zhes bya bas ni phan 'dogs pa phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya bas ni phan 'dogs pa phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
translated: This shows the perfection of benefit.🔽The omniscient one.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya bas ni shes rab phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya bas ni shes rab phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
translated: This shows the perfection of wisdom.

original: dkon mchog mdzod brnyes pa zhes bya bas ni thugs rje phun sum tshogs pa bstan to ;🔽/ zhabs la tshangs dbang gtsug gi nor bus gtugs //
analyzed: dkon mchog mdzod brnyes pa zhes bya bas ni thugs rje phun sum tshogs pa bstan to ; / zhabs la tshangs dbang gtsug gi nor bus gtugs //
translated: The line, “He has attained the treasure of the Jewels,” teaches his perfection of compassion.

original: zhes bya bas ni 'bras bu'i khyad par phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya bas ni 'bras bu'i khyad par phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
translated: The line, “His feet are touched by the jeweled crowns of Brahma and Indra,” teaches the perfection of the excellence of his result.

original: bdag gi don phun tshogs pa ni tshigs su bcad pa 'og ma phyed pos bstan to //🔽des kyang 'gro ba'i gtso bo sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi yon tan dag gi don phun sum tshogs pa'i che ba nyid kyi khyad par phun sum tshogs pa rnam pa gnyis bstan te /
analyzed: bdag gi don phun tshogs pa ni tshigs su bcad pa 'og ma phyed pos bstan to // des kyang 'gro ba'i gtso bo sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi yon tan dag gi don phun sum tshogs pa'i che ba nyid kyi khyad par phun sum tshogs pa rnam pa gnyis bstan te /
translated: The perfection of his own aim is taught by the second half of the verse.

original: spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / ye shes phun sum tshogs pa'o //🔽de la / sdug bsngal rgya mtsho gting mtha' med brgal ba //
analyzed: spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / ye shes phun sum tshogs pa'o // de la / sdug bsngal rgya mtsho gting mtha' med brgal ba //
translated: It teaches the excellence of the two kinds of perfection of the Bhagavat Buddha, the chief of the world: the perfection of abandonment and the perfection of knowledge.

original: zhes bya bas ni spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya bas ni spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
translated: The line, “He has crossed the ocean of suffering, without bottom or shore,” teaches the perfection of abandonment.

original: 'gro ba'i gtso la zhes bya bas ni shes rab phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i gtso la zhes bya bas ni shes rab phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
translated: The line, “The chief of the world,” teaches the perfection of knowledge.

original: de ltar 'gro ba'i gtso bo sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi yon tan gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa dang / bdag gi don phun sum tshogs pa smos pa das ni ston pa la bstod pa'i sgo nas mchod pa bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar 'gro ba'i gtso bo sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi yon tan gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa dang / bdag gi don phun sum tshogs pa smos pa das ni ston pa la bstod pa'i sgo nas mchod pa bstan to //
translated: Thus, by mentioning the qualities of the Bhagavat Buddha, the chief of beings, which are the perfection of benefit for others and the perfection of benefit for self, he shows worship by way of praise of the Teacher.

original: phyag 'tshal ba'i sgo nas mchod pa ni lus dang ngag dang yid kyi sgo nas phyag 'tshal ba bstan te /
analyzed: phyag 'tshal ba'i sgo nas mchod pa ni lus dang ngag dang yid kyi sgo nas phyag 'tshal ba bstan te /
translated: Worship by way of prostration shows prostration by way of body, speech, and mind.

original: de ni spyi bos phyag 'tshal te /
analyzed: de ni spyi bos phyag 'tshal te /
translated: He shows that by the words, “I bow my head to him.”

original: zhes pas bstan to de ltar phyag 'tshal te ci zhig bya zhe na /
analyzed: zhes pas bstan to de ltar phyag 'tshal te ci zhig bya zhe na /
translated: If one asks, “Having thus prostrated, what will he do?”

original: so sor thar pa brtsam par dam bca' ba bstan te /
analyzed: so sor thar pa brtsam par dam bca' ba bstan te /
translated: He shows the vow to undertake the Pratimoksha.

original: de ni tshigs su bcad pa 'og ma'i phyed kyis bstan to //
analyzed: de ni tshigs su bcad pa 'og ma'i phyed kyis bstan to //
translated: He shows that with the second half of the verse.

original: des kyang gang gis bstan pa dang / ci zhig bstan pa dang / su la bstan pas so sor thar pa'i che ba'i che ba nyid brjod nas /
analyzed: des kyang gang gis bstan pa dang / ci zhig bstan pa dang / su la bstan pas so sor thar pa'i che ba'i che ba nyid brjod nas /
translated: By that, having expressed the greatness of the greatness of the Pratimoksha, by whom it was taught, what it teaches, and to whom it was taught,

original: gang gis ci zhig bstan pa de nyid su la bstan pa'i tshogs kyi dbus su dbye bar bya'o zhes pas bstan to //
analyzed: gang gis ci zhig bstan pa de nyid su la bstan pa'i tshogs kyi dbus su dbye bar bya'o zhes pas bstan to //
translated: By whom, what is taught? In the midst of the assembly to whom it is taught, it should be recited.

original: de la gang gis bstan zhe na /
analyzed: de la gang gis bstan zhe na /
translated: What is taught by whom?

original: ston pa ste de ni thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya @164a * //🔽bas bstan to //
analyzed: ston pa ste de ni thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya @164a * // bas bstan to //
translated: The teacher, who is called omniscient.

original: ci zhig bstan zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhig bstan zhe na /
translated: What is taught?

original: so sor thar pa ste de ni bslab gzhi dkon mchog snod ces bya bas bstan to //
analyzed: so sor thar pa ste de ni bslab gzhi dkon mchog snod ces bya bas bstan to //
translated: The Pratimoksha, which is called the basis of training and the vessel of the Three Jewels.

original: su la bstan ce na /
analyzed: su la bstan ce na /
translated: To whom is it taught?

original: nyan thos kyi dge 'dun la bya ste de ni 'phags pa'i tshogs zhes bya bas bstan to //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi dge 'dun la bya ste de ni 'phags pa'i tshogs zhes bya bas bstan to //
translated: To the Sangha of Shravakas, who are called the assembly of noble ones.

original: gang gis ci zhig bstan pa de nyid su la bstan pa'i tshogs kyi dbus su dbye bar bya ba ni ston pas so sor thar pa bstan pa de nyid nyan thos kyi dge 'dun gyi dbus su dbye bar bya zhes pas bstan te /
analyzed: gang gis ci zhig bstan pa de nyid su la bstan pa'i tshogs kyi dbus su dbye bar bya ba ni ston pas so sor thar pa bstan pa de nyid nyan thos kyi dge 'dun gyi dbus su dbye bar bya zhes pas bstan te /
translated: In the midst of the assembly to whom it is taught, by whom what is taught should be recited. The teacher's teaching of the Pratimoksha should be recited in the midst of the Sangha of Shravakas.

original: de ni re zhig spyi'i don yin no //
analyzed: de ni re zhig spyi'i don yin no //
translated: This is the general meaning for now.

original: da ni yan lag gi don brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni yan lag gi don brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now, the subsidiary meaning should be stated.

original: de la 'gro ba'i gtso bo sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi yon tan gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'i thabs su gyur pa rgyu phun sum tshogs pa'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: de la 'gro ba'i gtso bo sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi yon tan gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'i thabs su gyur pa rgyu phun sum tshogs pa'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: The qualities of the Bhagavan Buddha, chief of beings, which are the means for the perfect benefit of others, are the result of the perfection of the cause.

original: snyan pa'i ba dan 'jig rten gsum du grags //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /🔽snyan pa'i ba dan zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pas bskal ba grangs med pa nas bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs dpag tu med pa bsags pa'i rgyu phun sum tshogs pa las byung ba'i 'bras bu spangs pa dang ye shes bla na med pas bsdus
analyzed: snyan pa'i ba dan 'jig rten gsum du grags // zhes bya ba gsungs te / snyan pa'i ba dan zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pas bskal ba grangs med pa nas bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs dpag tu med pa bsags pa'i rgyu phun sum tshogs pa las byung ba'i 'bras bu spangs pa dang ye shes bla na med pas bsdus
translated: The banner of fame resounds in the three worlds.

original: pa'i yon tan dpag tu med pa'o //
analyzed: pa'i yon tan dpag tu med pa'o //
translated: The banner of fame is the result of the perfection of the cause, which is the accumulation of immeasurable collections of merit and knowledge by the Tathagata for countless eons. It is the immeasurable good qualities included in the unsurpassed abandonment and knowledge.

original: ba dan zhes bya ba ni snyan pa de nyid ba dan dang 'dra bas na ba dan zhes bya ste /
analyzed: ba dan zhes bya ba ni snyan pa de nyid ba dan dang 'dra bas na ba dan zhes bya ste /
translated: The banner is like that fame, so it is called the banner.

original: yon tan mngon par 'phags pas kun la gsal ba de la dmigs na mngon par mthong ba dang nges par legs pa'i lam mi nor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yon tan mngon par 'phags pas kun la gsal ba de la dmigs na mngon par mthong ba dang nges par legs pa'i lam mi nor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If one focuses on the Buddha, who is preeminent in terms of his excellent qualities, one will not err in the path of seeing and the path of definite excellence.

original: 'jig rten gsum du zhes bya ba ni 'jig tshogs kyi phung po 'jig pa tsam la brten pas bsdus pa'i khams gsum po 'dod pa dang / gzugs dang gzugs med pa dag go //
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum du zhes bya ba ni 'jig tshogs kyi phung po 'jig pa tsam la brten pas bsdus pa'i khams gsum po 'dod pa dang / gzugs dang gzugs med pa dag go //
translated: The three worlds refers to the three realms of desire, form, and the formless, which are subsumed in the mere destruction of the aggregates of the perishable collection.

original: grags zhes bya ba ni de dag tu snyan pa'i sgras khyab pa ste /
analyzed: grags zhes bya ba ni de dag tu snyan pa'i sgras khyab pa ste /
translated: Renown means that his fame pervades those realms.

original: bcom ldan 'das dang po mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i tshe dang por sa la grags de nas bar snang la grags de nas rgyal chen bzhi'i ris la grags so zhes bya ba nas 'og min gyi bar du grags so zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rim
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das dang po mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i tshe dang por sa la grags de nas bar snang la grags de nas rgyal chen bzhi'i ris la grags so zhes bya ba nas 'og min gyi bar du grags so zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rim
translated: The Bhagavat, when he first attained complete enlightenment, first became renowned on earth, then in the sky, then in the realm of the Caturmaharajakas, and so on, up to the Akanistha realm.

original: gyis so // gzugs med par ni ji ltar grags she na /
analyzed: gyis so // gzugs med par ni ji ltar grags she na /
translated: How is he renowned in the formless realm?

original: gzugs can gyi khams na gnas pa'i tshe grags pa'i bag chags rgyud la yod pas rgyu la 'bras bur btags te grags par brjod do //
analyzed: gzugs can gyi khams na gnas pa'i tshe grags pa'i bag chags rgyud la yod pas rgyu la 'bras bur btags te grags par brjod do //
translated: When he was in the form realm, he was called “the one who is renowned” because he had the habitual tendencies of renown in his continuum.

original: de sbyin pa la sogs pa'i rgyu phun sum tshogs pa las byung ba'i yon tan gzhan dag la ston par mdzad pa'i sgo @164b nas gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'i thabs su gyur pa rgyu phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: de sbyin pa la sogs pa'i rgyu phun sum tshogs pa las byung ba'i yon tan gzhan dag la ston par mdzad pa'i sgo @164b nas gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'i thabs su gyur pa rgyu phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
translated: He taught the other qualities that arise from the perfection of generosity and so forth to others as a method for the perfection of others’ aims.

original: phan 'dogs pa phun sum tshogs pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /🔽dam pa'i chos sgra seng ge'i sgra bsgrags pa //
analyzed: phan 'dogs pa phun sum tshogs pa'i dbang du mdzad nas / dam pa'i chos sgra seng ge'i sgra bsgrags pa //
translated: With regard to the perfection of benefit,

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: he proclaimed the lion’s roar of the excellent teaching.

original: dam pa zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das te /
analyzed: dam pa zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das te /
translated: The excellent one is the Bhagavat Buddha.

original: nyon mongs pa bag chags dang bcas pa ma lus par spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa bag chags dang bcas pa ma lus par spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He is excellent because he has abandoned all afflictions without exception, together with their imprints.

original: chos sgra zhes bya ba ni dam pa des gsungs pa'i chos te /
analyzed: chos sgra zhes bya ba ni dam pa des gsungs pa'i chos te /
translated: The teaching is the Dharma that he taught.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po dag dpal gyi mgur nas gsungs pa'i sgra'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po dag dpal gyi mgur nas gsungs pa'i sgra'o //
translated: The sound of the four noble truths is the sound of the glorious throat.

original: seng ge'i sgra zhes bya ba ni dam pa'i chos kyi sgra de nyid seng ge'i sgra dang 'dra ba'i phyir seng ge'i sgra zhes bya ste mu stegs can glang po che lta bu dag skrag par byed cing //
analyzed: seng ge'i sgra zhes bya ba ni dam pa'i chos kyi sgra de nyid seng ge'i sgra dang 'dra ba'i phyir seng ge'i sgra zhes bya ste mu stegs can glang po che lta bu dag skrag par byed cing //
translated: The lion's roar is the sound of the true Dharma, because it is like the lion's roar, terrifying the elephant-like heterodox believers,

original: rigs kyi bu'i ming seng ge'i phru gru lta bu dag sdud par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu'i ming seng ge'i phru gru lta bu dag sdud par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and because it attracts the lion-like sons of the Victor.

original: bsgrags pa zhes bya ba ni bstan pa ste /
analyzed: bsgrags pa zhes bya ba ni bstan pa ste /
translated: It is proclaimed is taught.

original: bden pa bzhi lan gsum du bzlas te chos kyi 'khor lo rnam pa bcu gnyis su bskor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bden pa bzhi lan gsum du bzlas te chos kyi 'khor lo rnam pa bcu gnyis su bskor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the wheel of the Dharma was turned twelve times, with three repetitions of the four noble truths.

original: des ni ston pa'i mdzad pa phun sum tshogs pa gzhan la chos ston pa'i sgo nas gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'i thabs su gyur pa phan 'dogs pa phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: des ni ston pa'i mdzad pa phun sum tshogs pa gzhan la chos ston pa'i sgo nas gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'i thabs su gyur pa phan 'dogs pa phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
translated: This shows the perfection of the benefit of others, which is the perfection of the means of the Master's activity for the sake of others, through the door of teaching the Dharma to others.

original: shes rab phun sum tshogs pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: shes rab phun sum tshogs pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: The perfection of wisdom is the perfection of the Master's activity for his own sake.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: The verse beginning “The Omniscient One” is stated.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das te /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das te /
translated: The Omniscient One is the Lord Buddha,

original: dang por dngos po'i ngo bo nyid ma lus pa dang / thun mong ma yin pa dang / tshad med pa dang / phyin ci ma log par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dang por dngos po'i ngo bo nyid ma lus pa dang / thun mong ma yin pa dang / tshad med pa dang / phyin ci ma log par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he first taught all things without exception, without error, and in an unequaled and immeasurable way.

original: des ni thams cad mkhyen pas lung shin tu rnam par dag pa gtan la phab pa'i sgo nas gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'i thabs su gyur pa shes rab phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: des ni thams cad mkhyen pas lung shin tu rnam par dag pa gtan la phab pa'i sgo nas gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'i thabs su gyur pa shes rab phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
translated: This shows the perfection of wisdom as the means to the fulfillment of the aims of others, by means of the establishment of the extremely pure scriptures of the Omniscient One.

original: thugs rje phun sum tshogs pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: thugs rje phun sum tshogs pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: With regard to the perfection of compassion,

original: dkon mchog mdzod brnyes pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: dkon mchog mdzod brnyes pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: the verse beginning “The treasure of the jewels” is stated.

original: dkon mchog ces bya ba ni bshad pa dang sgrub pa'i chos dkon mchog ste /
analyzed: dkon mchog ces bya ba ni bshad pa dang sgrub pa'i chos dkon mchog ste /
translated: The jewels are the jewels of the Dharma of explanation and practice.

original: rin po che dang 'dra bar dkon pa dang / rin che ba dang ; dga' bar byed pa dang / phan 'dogs pa dang / mi ma yin pa la sogs pa gnod par byed pa'i gnyen por gyur pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rin po che dang 'dra bar dkon pa dang / rin che ba dang ; dga' bar byed pa dang / phan 'dogs pa dang / mi ma yin pa la sogs pa gnod par byed pa'i gnyen por gyur pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is like a jewel because it is rare, valuable, delightful, beneficial, and the antidote to non-human beings, etc., that cause harm.

original: mdzod ces bya ba ni rin po che'i mdzad dang 'dra bar dkon mchog de'i mdzod 'phags pa'i dge 'dun te /🔽lung dang rtogs pa'i sgo nas de'i snod du gyur pa yin @165a * //
analyzed: mdzod ces bya ba ni rin po che'i mdzad dang 'dra bar dkon mchog de'i mdzod 'phags pa'i dge 'dun te / lung dang rtogs pa'i sgo nas de'i snod du gyur pa yin @165a * //
translated: The word “treasury” means that the noble Sangha is the treasury of that jewel,

original: pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the vessel of that jewel through scripture and insight.

original: brnyes pa zhes bya ba ni slob ma nyid du brnyes pa ste /
analyzed: brnyes pa zhes bya ba ni slob ma nyid du brnyes pa ste /
translated: The word “attained” means attained as a disciple,

original: ston pa'i lam gyi rjes su zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ston pa'i lam gyi rjes su zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the path that follows the Teacher.

original: des ni 'khor yongs su smin par mdzad pa'i gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'i thabs su gyur pa thugs rje phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: des ni 'khor yongs su smin par mdzad pa'i gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'i thabs su gyur pa thugs rje phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
translated: This shows the perfection of compassion, which is the means for the perfection of the benefit of others through the maturation of the assembly.

original: 'bras bu'i khyad par phun sum tshogs pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i khyad par phun sum tshogs pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: The perfection of the special result is shown in the next verse.

original: zhabs la tshangs dbang gtsug gi nor bus gtugs //
analyzed: zhabs la tshangs dbang gtsug gi nor bus gtugs //
translated: The crowns of Brahmā and Indra touch his feet.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: This is what is being said.

original: zhabs la zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i zhabs 'khor lo'i mtshan dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: zhabs la zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i zhabs 'khor lo'i mtshan dang ldan pa'o //
translated: His feet have the mark of a wheel.

original: tshangs dbang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: tshangs dbang zhes bya ba la /
translated: Brahmā and Indra.

original: tshangs pa zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan dang po'i bsam gtan khyad par can bsgrubs te tshangs pa'i rgyal po thob pa stong gi 'jig rten la dbang bsgyur ba'i tshangs pa chen po'o //
analyzed: tshangs pa zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan dang po'i bsam gtan khyad par can bsgrubs te tshangs pa'i rgyal po thob pa stong gi 'jig rten la dbang bsgyur ba'i tshangs pa chen po'o //
translated: Brahmā is the great Brahmā, the lord of a thousand world systems, who has attained the state of Brahmā king by accomplishing the special meditative concentration of the first meditative concentration.

original: dbang po zhes bya ba ni sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams kyi dbang po brgya byin te /
analyzed: dbang po zhes bya ba ni sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams kyi dbang po brgya byin te /
translated: Indra is Śakra, the lord of the gods of the Thirty-Three.

original: de gnyis ni sa bla'i gtso bo dang / stong gi khams na gtso bor grags pas 'dir smos par zad kyi gzhan yang de bzhin du gzung bar bya'o //🔽gtsug gi nor bus zhes bya ba ni spyi bo ste /
analyzed: de gnyis ni sa bla'i gtso bo dang / stong gi khams na gtso bor grags pas 'dir smos par zad kyi gzhan yang de bzhin du gzung bar bya'o // gtsug gi nor bus zhes bya ba ni spyi bo ste /
translated: Since these two are the chief ones on the earth and are renowned as the chief ones in a world system of a thousand worlds, they are mentioned here. But others should be understood in the same way.🔽The crowns of their heads.

original: nor bu gdags pa'i gnas yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nor bu gdags pa'i gnas yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The crown of the head is the place where a jewel is placed.

original: gtugs zhes bya ba ni des btud de phyag byas pa'o //
analyzed: gtugs zhes bya ba ni des btud de phyag byas pa'o //
translated: The word bowed means that he bowed down and paid homage.

original: des ni 'jig rten na 'bras bu thob pa'i mchog dag gi spyi bos gtugs pa'i sgo nas gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'i thabs su gyur pa 'bras bu'i khyad par phun sum tshogs pa bstan te /
analyzed: des ni 'jig rten na 'bras bu thob pa'i mchog dag gi spyi bos gtugs pa'i sgo nas gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'i thabs su gyur pa 'bras bu'i khyad par phun sum tshogs pa bstan te /
translated: This shows the excellence of the result, which is the means for accomplishing the welfare of others by bowing down with one's head to the feet of those who have attained the highest result in the world.

original: de ltar de dag gis ni 'gro ba'i gtso bo sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi yon tan gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'i sgo nas ston pa la bstod pa'i mchod pa bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar de dag gis ni 'gro ba'i gtso bo sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi yon tan gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'i sgo nas ston pa la bstod pa'i mchod pa bstan to //
translated: Thus, by these [verses], it is shown that the praise-worship of the Blessed Buddha, the foremost of beings, is through the excellence of accomplishing the welfare of others.

original: de'i 'og tu 'gro ba'i gtso bo sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi yon tan bdag gi don phun sum tshogs pa'i che ba nyid kyi khyad par spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa'i dbang du mdzad nas //🔽sdug bsngal rgya mtsho gting mtha' med brgyal ba //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu 'gro ba'i gtso bo sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi yon tan bdag gi don phun sum tshogs pa'i che ba nyid kyi khyad par spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa'i dbang du mdzad nas // sdug bsngal rgya mtsho gting mtha' med brgyal ba //
translated: After that, with regard to the excellence of the Blessed Buddha, the foremost of beings, the excellence of the greatness of accomplishing one's own welfare, from the perspective of the excellence of abandoning,🔽[the verse] says: Having fainted in the fathomless ocean of suffering,

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: [and so on].

original: sdug bsngal zhes bya ba ni skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi bas bsdus pa nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po dag go //
analyzed: sdug bsngal zhes bya ba ni skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi bas bsdus pa nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po dag go //
translated: Suffering is the five appropriated aggregates, which are included in birth, aging, sickness, and death.

original: rgya mtsho zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal de nyid rgya mtsho dang 'dra bas rgya mtsho zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rgya mtsho zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal de nyid rgya mtsho dang 'dra bas rgya mtsho zhes bya ste /
translated: The ocean is suffering itself, which is called an ocean because it is like an ocean.

original: shin tu rgya che ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shin tu rgya che ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is called an ocean because it is very vast.

original: gting med pa zhes bya ba ni gzhi'i gting med pa ste /
analyzed: gting med pa zhes bya ba ni gzhi'i gting med pa ste /
translated: It is bottomless because it has no bottom.

original: 'dis ni rgya mtsho bzhin du sdug bsngal mang ba nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni rgya mtsho bzhin du sdug bsngal mang ba nyid du bstan to //
translated: This shows that suffering is like an ocean in being very vast.

original: mtha' med pa @165b zhes bya ba ni pha rol gyi mtha' med pa ste /
analyzed: mtha' med pa @165b zhes bya ba ni pha rol gyi mtha' med pa ste /
translated: It is boundless because it has no end.

original: 'dis ni rgya mtsho bzhin du 'khor ba'i rgyun mi 'chad pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni rgya mtsho bzhin du 'khor ba'i rgyun mi 'chad pa bstan to //
translated: This shows that suffering is like an ocean in being an uninterrupted continuum.🔽It is difficult to cross because it is difficult to transcend.

original: brgal ba zhes bya ba ni 'das pa de las nyon mongs pa spangs pa sdug bsngal zad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brgal ba zhes bya ba ni 'das pa de las nyon mongs pa spangs pa sdug bsngal zad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is difficult to cross because it is difficult to transcend it by abandoning the afflictions and exhausting suffering.

original: des ni las dang nyon mongs pa dang skye ba'i mtshan nyid kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa spangs pa'i sgo nas bdag gi don phun sum tshogs pa'i che ba nyid kyi khyad par spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: des ni las dang nyon mongs pa dang skye ba'i mtshan nyid kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa spangs pa'i sgo nas bdag gi don phun sum tshogs pa'i che ba nyid kyi khyad par spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
translated: This shows the excellence of abandonment through the abandonment of the characteristics of karma, affliction, and birth, and thus the excellence of the perfection of one's own benefit.

original: ye shes phun sum tshogs pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: ye shes phun sum tshogs pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: With regard to the excellence of knowledge,

original: 'gro ba'i gtso la zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: 'gro ba'i gtso la zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: he says, to the chief of the world.

original: 'gro ba'i zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten de rtag tu 'khor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten de rtag tu 'khor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Of the world refers to the world of beings, because it is always revolving.

original: gtso la zhes bya ba ni zla med pa ste mchog yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gtso la zhes bya ba ni zla med pa ste mchog yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Chief means without a companion, because it is supreme.

original: la zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba'i gtso bo sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das te /
analyzed: la zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba'i gtso bo sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das te /
translated: To refers to the chief of the world, the Blessed Buddha,

original: shes bya thams cad la chags pa med dang / thogs pa med pa'i ye shes brnyes pas 'gro ba thams cad kyi gtso bor gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes bya thams cad la chags pa med dang / thogs pa med pa'i ye shes brnyes pas 'gro ba thams cad kyi gtso bor gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he has attained the knowledge that is unobstructed and unattached with regard to all objects of knowledge, and thus has become the chief of all beings.

original: 'dis ni dngos po ji snyed yod pa yid dang / ji lta ba bzhin du yod pa nyid thugs su chud pas 'gro ba'i gtso bor gyur pa'i sgo nas bdag gi don phun sum tshogs pa'i che ba nyid kyi khyad par ye shes phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni dngos po ji snyed yod pa yid dang / ji lta ba bzhin du yod pa nyid thugs su chud pas 'gro ba'i gtso bor gyur pa'i sgo nas bdag gi don phun sum tshogs pa'i che ba nyid kyi khyad par ye shes phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
translated: This shows the excellence of the perfection of knowledge, the special excellence of the perfection of the fulfillment of one's own aim, by means of becoming the chief of the world through the realization of the mind as it is and the existence of all things.

original: de ltar de dag gis ni 'gro ba'i gtso bo sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi yon tan gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa dang / bdag gi don phun sum tshogs pa'i sgo nas ston pa la bstod pa'i mchod pa ston to //
analyzed: de ltar de dag gis ni 'gro ba'i gtso bo sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi yon tan gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa dang / bdag gi don phun sum tshogs pa'i sgo nas ston pa la bstod pa'i mchod pa ston to //
translated: Thus, by these verses, he shows the worship of the Teacher by praising the Blessed One, the chief of the world, from the point of view of the perfection of the fulfillment of the aims of others and the perfection of the fulfillment of one's own aim.

original: de'i 'og tu phyag 'tshal ba'i sgo nas mchod pa bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu phyag 'tshal ba'i sgo nas mchod pa bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: After that, in order to show worship by means of salutation, he says:

original: spyi bos phyag 'tshal te zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: spyi bos phyag 'tshal te zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Having bowed my head to him...

original: spyi bos zhes bya ba ni lus kyis phyag 'tshal ba dngos su bstan la /
analyzed: spyi bos zhes bya ba ni lus kyis phyag 'tshal ba dngos su bstan la /
translated: Head shows the actual salutation with the body.

original: phyag 'tshal te zhes bya bas ni lus dang ngag dang yid gsum gyis phyag 'tshal bas bsdus par blta ba'o //
analyzed: phyag 'tshal te zhes bya bas ni lus dang ngag dang yid gsum gyis phyag 'tshal bas bsdus par blta ba'o //
translated: The phrase having paid homage indicates that the homage is made with body, speech, and mind.

original: 'dis ni lus dang ngag dang yid kyis phyag 'tshal ba'i sgo nas ston pa la mchod pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni lus dang ngag dang yid kyis phyag 'tshal ba'i sgo nas ston pa la mchod pa bstan to //
translated: This shows that the teacher is worshipped by means of the homage of body, speech, and mind.

original: de ltar phyag 'tshal te ci zhig bya zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar phyag 'tshal te ci zhig bya zhe na /
translated: Having paid homage in this way, what is to be done?

original: so sor thar pa brtsam par dam bca' bar bya ba bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: so sor thar pa brtsam par dam bca' bar bya ba bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: In order to show the commitment to undertake the Prātimokṣa, it is said:

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i bslab gzhi dkon mchog snod 'phags pa'i tshogs kyi dbus su dbye bar bya //🔽zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i bslab gzhi dkon mchog snod 'phags pa'i tshogs kyi dbus su dbye bar bya // zhes gsungs te /
translated: In the midst of the assembly of the noble ones, who are the vessels of the Three Jewels, I shall proclaim the basis of training of the Omniscient One.

original: 'dis ni gang gis bstan pa dang / ci zhig bstan pa dang / su la bstan pas so sor thar pa'i che ba nyid bstan nas /🔽gang gis chi zhig bstan pa de nyid su la bstan pa'i @166a * //
analyzed: 'dis ni gang gis bstan pa dang / ci zhig bstan pa dang / su la bstan pas so sor thar pa'i che ba nyid bstan nas / gang gis chi zhig bstan pa de nyid su la bstan pa'i @166a * //
translated: This shows the greatness of the Prātimokṣa by whom it is taught, what is taught, and to whom it is taught.

original: tshogs kyi dbus su dbye bar bya zhes bstan to //
analyzed: tshogs kyi dbus su dbye bar bya zhes bstan to //
translated: Then, it shows that what is taught by whom is to be proclaimed in the midst of the assembly.

original: de la gang gis bstan ce na ston pa de ni thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya bas ston te /
analyzed: de la gang gis bstan ce na ston pa de ni thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya bas ston te /
translated: What is taught by that? It is taught by the teacher called omniscient.

original: tshig gi don snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: tshig gi don snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The meaning of the words is the same as before.

original: ci zhig bstan ce na so sor thar pa ste /
analyzed: ci zhig bstan ce na so sor thar pa ste /
translated: What is taught? The Prātimokṣa.

original: de ni bslab gzhi dkon mchog snod ces bya bas bstan te /
analyzed: de ni bslab gzhi dkon mchog snod ces bya bas bstan te /
translated: That is taught by the words basis of training, vessel of the jewels.

original: bslab pa zhes bya ba ni srog gcod pa spong ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: bslab pa zhes bya ba ni srog gcod pa spong ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Training has the characteristic of abandoning taking life and so on.

original: gzhi zhes bya ba ni tshig ste cis de la don gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhi zhes bya ba ni tshig ste cis de la don gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Basis is a word that means object because it is the basis of meaning.

original: dkon mchog ces bya ba ni bslab pa'i gzhi de nyid de chen po rnams kyi rkyen yin pa'i phyir dang / dkon pa'i phyir rin po che dang 'dra bas dkon mchog go //
analyzed: dkon mchog ces bya ba ni bslab pa'i gzhi de nyid de chen po rnams kyi rkyen yin pa'i phyir dang / dkon pa'i phyir rin po che dang 'dra bas dkon mchog go //
translated: Jewel means that very basis of training is like a jewel because it is the condition of the great and because it is rare.

original: de yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: de yang gang zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: rnam par 'byed pa dang / gzhi dang / gzhung phyi ma dang / phran tshegs dag go //
analyzed: rnam par 'byed pa dang / gzhi dang / gzhung phyi ma dang / phran tshegs dag go //
translated: It is the Vinaya, the Kṣudrakapiṭaka, and the Uttaragrantha.

original: snod ces bya ba ni de dag gi snod de so sor thar pa'i mdo 'di nyid do //
analyzed: snod ces bya ba ni de dag gi snod de so sor thar pa'i mdo 'di nyid do //
translated: Vessel means the vessel of those, which is this very Prātimokṣa Sūtra.

original: de ni ston pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i bslab gzhi dkon mchog snod ces bya'o //
analyzed: de ni ston pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i bslab gzhi dkon mchog snod ces bya'o //
translated: This is the basis of training of the Omniscient One, called the “receptacle of the Three Jewels. ”

original: su la bstan ce na /
analyzed: su la bstan ce na /
translated: To whom is it taught?

original: nyan thos kyi dge 'dun la ste /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi dge 'dun la ste /
translated: To the Saṅgha of Hearers.

original: de ni 'phags pa'i tshogs zhes bya bas bstan te /
analyzed: de ni 'phags pa'i tshogs zhes bya bas bstan te /
translated: This is taught by “the assembly of Noble Ones. ”

original: 'phags pa zhes bya ba ni sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams las ring du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa zhes bya ba ni sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams las ring du gyur pa'o //
translated: “Noble” means having gone far from sinful, non-virtuous dharmas.

original: tshogs zhes bya ba ni bzhi yan chad do //
analyzed: tshogs zhes bya ba ni bzhi yan chad do //
translated: “Assembly” means four or more.

original: gang gis ci zhig bstan pa de nyid su la bstan pa'i tshogs kyi dbus su dbye bar bya ba ni ston pas so sor thar pa bstan pa de nyid nyan thos kyi dge 'dun gyi dbus su dbye bar bya ste /
analyzed: gang gis ci zhig bstan pa de nyid su la bstan pa'i tshogs kyi dbus su dbye bar bya ba ni ston pas so sor thar pa bstan pa de nyid nyan thos kyi dge 'dun gyi dbus su dbye bar bya ste /
translated: By whom and what is taught? That very one to whom it is taught, in the middle of the assembly, is to be divided by the teacher. That very teaching of the Pratimokṣa by the teacher is to be divided in the middle of the assembly of the Saṅgha of Hearers.

original: de ni dbus su dbye bar bya zhes bya bas bstan te /
analyzed: de ni dbus su dbye bar bya zhes bya bas bstan te /
translated: This is taught by “in the middle, it is to be divided. ”

original: dbus zhes bya ba ni nang du'o //
analyzed: dbus zhes bya ba ni nang du'o //
translated: “In the middle” means in the middle.

original: dbye bar bya ba ni gdon par bya ba'o //
analyzed: dbye bar bya ba ni gdon par bya ba'o //
translated: “To be divided” means to be recited.

original: sus gdon par bya zhing dbye zhe na /
analyzed: sus gdon par bya zhing dbye zhe na /
translated: By whom is it to be recited and divided?

original: 'phags pa'i tshogs kyis te /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i tshogs kyis te /
translated: By the assembly of Noble Ones.

original: dper na rin po che'i snod dbye bar yang rin po che rtog shes pa dag gis tshogs kyi dbus su dbye ba ste /
analyzed: dper na rin po che'i snod dbye bar yang rin po che rtog shes pa dag gis tshogs kyi dbus su dbye ba ste /
translated: For example, a precious vessel is opened in the midst of an assembly by those who know how to open a precious vessel.

original: de bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pa'i bslab gzhi dkon mchog snod 'di yang bslab pa'i gzhi rin po che lta bu rtog shes pas 'phags pa'i tshogs kyi dbus su dbye zhing gdon par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pa'i bslab gzhi dkon mchog snod 'di yang bslab pa'i gzhi rin po che lta bu rtog shes pas 'phags pa'i tshogs kyi dbus su dbye zhing gdon par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: In the same way, this vessel of the Three Jewels, the basis of training for omniscience, is opened and revealed in the midst of an assembly of noble beings by those who know how to open the precious basis of training. This is the meaning.

original: mchod pa'i mtshan nyid bshad zin to //
analyzed: mchod pa'i mtshan nyid bshad zin to //
translated: The characteristics of worship have been explained.

original: de nas de'i 'og tu gleng bslang ba'i mtshan nyid bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de nas de'i 'og tu gleng bslang ba'i mtshan nyid bshad par bya ste /
translated: Next, after that, the characteristics of introduction should be explained.

original: gleng bslang ba'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni so sor thar pa'i mdo yang dag par brtsams pa gleng bslang ba'o //
analyzed: gleng bslang ba'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni so sor thar pa'i mdo yang dag par brtsams pa gleng bslang ba'o //
translated: The characteristics of introduction are as follows: The introduction of the composition of the Pratimoksha Sutra is the introduction.

original: de yang so sor thar pa'i che ba nyid thos nas tshogs kyi lam 'bras bu dang bcas @166b par 'dod pas so sor thar pa bsgrub par bya'o zhes gleng ba slang dgos pas de'i phyir /
analyzed: de yang so sor thar pa'i che ba nyid thos nas tshogs kyi lam 'bras bu dang bcas @166b par 'dod pas so sor thar pa bsgrub par bya'o zhes gleng ba slang dgos pas de'i phyir /
translated: Moreover, having heard the greatness of the Pratimoksha, one should practice the Pratimoksha with the desire for the result of the path of accumulation. Therefore,

original: sangs rgyas 'dul ba gang chen mtsho //
analyzed: sangs rgyas 'dul ba gang chen mtsho //
translated: The Buddha's Vinaya is a great ocean.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa bcu gcig gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa bcu gcig gsungs so //
translated: Thus, eleven verses are spoken.

original: de la 'dir yang tshigs su bcad pa bcu gcig po de dag gis brjod par bya ba dang / dgos pa dang / 'brel pa dang / dgos pa'i dgos pa brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de la 'dir yang tshigs su bcad pa bcu gcig po de dag gis brjod par bya ba dang / dgos pa dang / 'brel pa dang / dgos pa'i dgos pa brjod par bya ste /
translated: Here, the eleven verses should express the subject matter, the purpose, the connection, and the purpose of the purpose.

original: de la brjod par bya ba ni so sor thar pa'i che ba nyid do //
analyzed: de la brjod par bya ba ni so sor thar pa'i che ba nyid do //
translated: Among them, the subject matter is the greatness of the Pratimoksha.

original: dgos pa ni rtog pa'o //
analyzed: dgos pa ni rtog pa'o //
translated: The purpose is understanding.

original: 'brel pa ni rtog pa de yang gleng bslang ba 'dis byed pas /
analyzed: 'brel pa ni rtog pa de yang gleng bslang ba 'dis byed pas /
translated: The connection is that understanding is produced by this introduction.

original: gleng bslang ba'i tshigs su bcad pa'i thabs 'di dang dgos pa thabs las byung ba'i mtshan nyid gnyis 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: gleng bslang ba'i tshigs su bcad pa'i thabs 'di dang dgos pa thabs las byung ba'i mtshan nyid gnyis 'brel pa'o //
translated: Thus, the method of the introductory verses and the purpose, which is characterized as arising from the method, are connected.

original: dgos pa'i dgos pa ni so sor thar pa'i che ba nyid thos nas tshogs kyi lam 'bras bu dang bcas par 'dong pas /
analyzed: dgos pa'i dgos pa ni so sor thar pa'i che ba nyid thos nas tshogs kyi lam 'bras bu dang bcas par 'dong pas /
translated: The purpose of the purpose is that, having heard the greatness of the Pratimoksha, one proceeds on the path of accumulation with its result.

original: so sor thar pa sgrub par byed pa'o //
analyzed: so sor thar pa sgrub par byed pa'o //
translated: Thus, one accomplishes the Pratimoksha.

original: de la tshigs su bcad pa bcu gcig po 'di dag gi bsdus pa'i don ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de la tshigs su bcad pa bcu gcig po 'di dag gi bsdus pa'i don ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The summarized meaning of these eleven verses is threefold:

original: so sor thar pa'i che ba nyid brjod pa dang / tshogs kyi lam 'bras bu dang bcas par bya ba dang / so sor thar pa bsgrub par bya ba'o //
analyzed: so sor thar pa'i che ba nyid brjod pa dang / tshogs kyi lam 'bras bu dang bcas par bya ba dang / so sor thar pa bsgrub par bya ba'o //
translated: the greatness of the pratimoksa, the path of accumulation together with its result, and the practice of the pratimoksa.

original: de la so sor thar pa'i che ba nyid ba rjod pa yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de la so sor thar pa'i che ba nyid ba rjod pa yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The greatness of the pratimoksa is also threefold:

original: tshe 'di'i 'bras bu dang / tshe phyi ma'i 'bras bu dang / so sor thar pa la ston pa dang 'dra bar bstod pa'o //🔽de la / sangs rgyas 'dul ba gang chen mtsho //
analyzed: tshe 'di'i 'bras bu dang / tshe phyi ma'i 'bras bu dang / so sor thar pa la ston pa dang 'dra bar bstod pa'o // de la / sangs rgyas 'dul ba gang chen mtsho //
translated: the result in this life, the result in the next life, and praise of the pratimoksa as being like the Teacher.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gsum gyis ni tshe 'di'i 'bras bu bstan to //🔽mtsho bas zab pa'i 'khor ba las //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gsum gyis ni tshe 'di'i 'bras bu bstan to // mtsho bas zab pa'i 'khor ba las //
translated: The three verses beginning with “The Buddha’s discipline is a great ocean” teach the result in this life.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyis ni tshe phyi ma'i 'bras bu bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyis ni tshe phyi ma'i 'bras bu bstan to //
translated: The two verses beginning with “From samsara, deeper than the ocean” teach the result in the next life.

original: nga ni mya ngan 'das gyur na //
analyzed: nga ni mya ngan 'das gyur na //
translated: “When I have passed into nirvana”

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gcig gis ni so sor thar pa la ston pa dang 'dra bar bstod pa bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gcig gis ni so sor thar pa la ston pa dang 'dra bar bstod pa bstan to //
translated: One verse on the praise of the Pratimoksa as the teacher:

original: tshogs kyi lam 'bras bu dang bcas par bya ba yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: tshogs kyi lam 'bras bu dang bcas par bya ba yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The path of accumulation is threefold:

original: tshogs kyi lam dkon pa dang / tshogs kyi lam rnyed pa dang / tshogs kyi lam rnyed pas nan tan du bya ba'o //
analyzed: tshogs kyi lam dkon pa dang / tshogs kyi lam rnyed pa dang / tshogs kyi lam rnyed pas nan tan du bya ba'o //
translated: the path of accumulation that is rare, the path of accumulation that is attained, and the path of accumulation that is attained and is to be practiced.🔽The two verses beginning with

original: de la / sangs rgyas zhes bya'i sgra 'di yang //
analyzed: de la / sangs rgyas zhes bya'i sgra 'di yang //
translated: the sound of the word Buddha🔽show the path of accumulation that is rare.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyis ni tshogs kyi lam dkon pa bstan to //🔽'jig rten sangs rgyas 'byung ba dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gcig gis ni tshogs kyi lam rnyed @167a * //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyis ni tshogs kyi lam dkon pa bstan to // 'jig rten sangs rgyas 'byung ba dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gcig gis ni tshogs kyi lam rnyed @167a * //
translated: The one verse beginning with🔽the appearance of a Buddha in the world🔽shows the path of accumulation that is attained.

original: pa bstan to //
analyzed: pa bstan to //
translated: The one verse beginning with

original: mkhas pa dag la legs 'dod cing //
analyzed: mkhas pa dag la legs 'dod cing //
translated: the desire to do good to the wise

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gcig gis ni tshogs kyi lam rnyed pas nan tan du bya ba bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gcig gis ni tshogs kyi lam rnyed pas nan tan du bya ba bstan to //
translated: shows the path of accumulation that is attained and is to be practiced.

original: so sor thar pa bsgrub par bya ba ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: so sor thar pa bsgrub par bya ba ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The accomplishment of the pratimoksa has four aspects:

original: bdag gi dbang du byas pa dang / gzhan gyi dbang du byas pa dang / chos kyi dbang du byas pa dang / bsgrub pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: bdag gi dbang du byas pa dang / gzhan gyi dbang du byas pa dang / chos kyi dbang du byas pa dang / bsgrub pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: 1. based on oneself, 2. based on others, 3. based on the Dharma, and 4. the nature of accomplishment.

original: de la / dge slong dbang dul kun dga' bo //
analyzed: de la / dge slong dbang dul kun dga' bo //
translated: Among them, the monk who has self-control and is joyful

original: zhes bya ba ni bdag gi dbang du byas pa bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bdag gi dbang du byas pa bstan to //
translated: teaches the aspect based on oneself.

original: sangs rgyas mi 'gyur rab byung ba //
analyzed: sangs rgyas mi 'gyur rab byung ba //
translated: The one who has gone forth in the Buddha's teachings

original: zhes bya bas ni gzhan gyi dbang du byas pa bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya bas ni gzhan gyi dbang du byas pa bstan to //
translated: teaches the aspect based on others.

original: nges par thar pa 'dod rnams kyis //
analyzed: nges par thar pa 'dod rnams kyis //
translated: Those who desire liberation

original: zhes bya bas ni chos kyi dbang du byas pa bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya bas ni chos kyi dbang du byas pa bstan to //
translated: teach the aspect based on the Dharma.

original: so sor thar pa rtag tu srungs //
analyzed: so sor thar pa rtag tu srungs //
translated: Always protect the pratimoksa

original: zhes bya bas ni bsgrub pa'i mtshan nyid bstan te /
analyzed: zhes bya bas ni bsgrub pa'i mtshan nyid bstan te /
translated: teaches the nature of accomplishment.

original: de ni re zhig spyi'i don yin no //
analyzed: de ni re zhig spyi'i don yin no //
translated: This is the general meaning for now.

original: da ni yan lag gi don bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni yan lag gi don bshad par bya ste /
translated: Now, the branch meanings will be explained.

original: de la tshe 'di'i 'bras bu'i sgo nas so sor thar pa'i che ba nyid brjod pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: de la tshe 'di'i 'bras bu'i sgo nas so sor thar pa'i che ba nyid brjod pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: In this regard, in terms of the greatness of the pratimoksa in terms of its result in this life, the following verse was spoken:

original: sangs rgyas 'dul ba gang chen mtsho //🔽gting mtha' med pa thams cad kyis //
analyzed: sangs rgyas 'dul ba gang chen mtsho // gting mtha' med pa thams cad kyis //
translated: The ocean of the Buddha’s discipline🔽is without bottom or end.

original: gnas pa'i snying dang snying po ni //
analyzed: gnas pa'i snying dang snying po ni //
translated: The heart and essence of all

original: so sor thar pa 'di yin no //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gsungs te /
analyzed: so sor thar pa 'di yin no // zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gsungs te /
translated: is this pratimoksa.

original: sangs rgyas 'dul ba zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa'i 'dul ba'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas 'dul ba zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa'i 'dul ba'o //
translated: The Buddha’s discipline is the discipline taught by the Buddha.

original: sangs rgyas zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das te /🔽don thams cad nges par thugs su chud pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: sangs rgyas zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das te / don thams cad nges par thugs su chud pa'i phyir ram /
translated: The Buddha is the Bhagavan Buddha.

original: nyon mongs pa bag chags dang bcas pa'i gnyid thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa bag chags dang bcas pa'i gnyid thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he has ascertained all meanings or because he is free from all sleep of affliction together with its imprints.

original: 'dul ba zhes bya ba ni 'dul ba'i sde snod de /
analyzed: 'dul ba zhes bya ba ni 'dul ba'i sde snod de /
translated: Discipline is the scriptural collection of discipline.

original: 'dul ba rnam par 'byed pa dang / 'dul ba gzhi dang / 'dul ba phran tshogs dang / 'dul ba gzhung bla ma ste /🔽slob ma rnams dngos po thams cad kyi mchog mya ngan las 'das par khrid par byed pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: 'dul ba rnam par 'byed pa dang / 'dul ba gzhi dang / 'dul ba phran tshogs dang / 'dul ba gzhung bla ma ste / slob ma rnams dngos po thams cad kyi mchog mya ngan las 'das par khrid par byed pa'i phyir ram /
translated: Vinaya-vibhanga, Vinaya-ksudraka-vastu, and Vinaya-uttara-grantha.

original: rgyud la kun du spyod pa'i dri ma dang / rnam par smin pa'i dri mas skyon chags par byed pa'i nyes pa thams cad rnam par 'dul bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyud la kun du spyod pa'i dri ma dang / rnam par smin pa'i dri mas skyon chags par byed pa'i nyes pa thams cad rnam par 'dul bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they lead their students to the nirvana, which is the supreme of all things, or because they completely discipline all the faults that defile the mindstream, such as the stains of conduct and the stains of full ripening.

original: gang chen mtsho zhes bya ba ni rgya mtsho ste /
analyzed: gang chen mtsho zhes bya ba ni rgya mtsho ste /
translated: The great ocean is the ocean.

original: sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa'i 'dul ba de nyid rgya mtsho dang 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa'i 'dul ba de nyid rgya mtsho dang 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the Vinaya taught by the Buddha is like the ocean.

original: ji ltar 'dra zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar 'dra zhe na /
translated: How is it like the ocean?

original: gting mtha' med pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: gting mtha' med pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: It is said to be bottomless and boundless.

original: rgya mtsho gzhi gting dpag tu med pa de bzhin du 'dul ba @167b la yang kun nas slong ba'i gting dpag tu med pa'i phyir dang / rgya mtsho la pha rol gyi mtha' dpag tu med pa bzhin du /
analyzed: rgya mtsho gzhi gting dpag tu med pa de bzhin du 'dul ba @167b la yang kun nas slong ba'i gting dpag tu med pa'i phyir dang / rgya mtsho la pha rol gyi mtha' dpag tu med pa bzhin du /
translated: Just as the depth of the ocean is immeasurable, so too the depth of the basis for training is immeasurable because the basis for training is immeasurable.

original: 'dul ba la yang 'bras bu'i mtha' dpag tu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dul ba la yang 'bras bu'i mtha' dpag tu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Just as the ocean has immeasurable limits, so too the limits of the result of training are immeasurable.

original: 'dul ba de dag thams cad kyi gnas pa'i snying po dang snying po ni so sor thar pa 'di yin no zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: 'dul ba de dag thams cad kyi gnas pa'i snying po dang snying po ni so sor thar pa 'di yin no zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: The essence and heart of all those trainings is this pratimoksa.

original: gnas pa zhes bya ba ni ltung ba sde lnga dang / lo nyi shu ma lon par bsnyen par rdzogs pa'i thad ka las rab tu 'byung ba'i gzhi 'phros /
analyzed: gnas pa zhes bya ba ni ltung ba sde lnga dang / lo nyi shu ma lon par bsnyen par rdzogs pa'i thad ka las rab tu 'byung ba'i gzhi 'phros /
translated: The basis of going forth is the five classes of downfalls and the basis of full ordination is the ordination of one who has not reached twenty years of age.

original: gso sbyong gi gsol ba gleng gzhi gdon pa las gso sbyong gi gzhi 'phros /
