translated: The phrase who have found the good friend who is difficult to find indicates the spiritual teacher, the listening to and reflecting upon the true Dharma, the absence of obstacles, the increase of generosity, and the attainment of the ornaments of a spiritual practitioner.

original: de ltar tshigs su bcad pa gcig po des ni tshogs kyi la ma rnyed pas de 'bras bu dang bcas par bya dgos pa'i sgo nas tshogs kyi lam 'bras bu dang bcas par bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar tshigs su bcad pa gcig po des ni tshogs kyi la ma rnyed pas de 'bras bu dang bcas par bya dgos pa'i sgo nas tshogs kyi lam 'bras bu dang bcas par bstan to //
translated: Thus, by this single verse, the path of accumulation is taught together with its result, from the perspective of the necessity of making it fruitful by attaining the path of accumulation.

original: tshogs kyi @173b lam rnyed nas nan tan du bya ba'i sgo nas tshogs kyi lam 'bras bu dang bcas par bya ba'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: tshogs kyi @173b lam rnyed nas nan tan du bya ba'i sgo nas tshogs kyi lam 'bras bu dang bcas par bya ba'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: From the perspective of making the path of accumulation fruitful by practicing it after attaining it,

original: mkhas pa bdag la legs 'dod cing //
analyzed: mkhas pa bdag la legs 'dod cing //
translated: the wise who wish to benefit themselves

original: de dag 'bras bcas byed 'dod pas //🔽sdom brtson rnams kyis so sor thar //
analyzed: de dag 'bras bcas byed 'dod pas // sdom brtson rnams kyis so sor thar //
translated: and to make that fruitful🔽should strive to listen to the pratimokṣa

original: mnyan pa'i phyir ni 'bad par bya //
analyzed: mnyan pa'i phyir ni 'bad par bya //
translated: in order to be diligent in the vows.

original: zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa gcig gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa gcig gsungs te /
translated: This is the single verse.

original: mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni mkhas pa'i rtags dang ldan pa de /
analyzed: mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni mkhas pa'i rtags dang ldan pa de /
translated: The wise are those who possess the signs of wisdom.

original: lus kyis legs par byed pa dang ngag gis legs par smra bar brjod pa dang / yid kyis legs par bsams pa sems pa'o //
analyzed: lus kyis legs par byed pa dang ngag gis legs par smra bar brjod pa dang / yid kyis legs par bsams pa sems pa'o //
translated: They are those who act well with the body, speak well with speech, and think well with the mind.

original: bdag la legs 'dod cing zhes bya bas ni bdag nyid shes pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go ;🔽/ de dag 'bras bcas byed 'dod pas //
analyzed: bdag la legs 'dod cing zhes bya bas ni bdag nyid shes pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go ; / de dag 'bras bcas byed 'dod pas //
translated: The phrase who desire what is good for themselves means who are self-aware.

original: zhes bya bas ni tshogs kyi lam de dag 'bras bu dang bcas par byed 'dod pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya bas ni tshogs kyi lam de dag 'bras bu dang bcas par byed 'dod pa ste /
translated: The phrase who desire to make them fruitful means who desire to make the path of accumulation fruitful.

original: sbyor ba'i lam dang rnam par dag pa'i lam thob par 'dod pas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i lam dang rnam par dag pa'i lam thob par 'dod pas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means who desire to attain the path of preparation and the path of pure universal responsibility.

original: sdom brtson rnams kyis zhes bya bas ni rab tu byung ba rnams kyis so //
analyzed: sdom brtson rnams kyis zhes bya bas ni rab tu byung ba rnams kyis so //
translated: The phrase those who are diligent in the vows means those who are ordained.

original: de rnams kyis so sor thar pa mnyan pa'i phyir ni 'bad par bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: de rnams kyis so sor thar pa mnyan pa'i phyir ni 'bad par bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: They should strive to listen to the prātimokṣa. The phrase they should strive is supplied.

original: thos pa dang / gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa dang / sgrub pa la 'bad par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: thos pa dang / gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa dang / sgrub pa la 'bad par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means they should strive to hear, to retain, to hold, and to practice.

original: de ltar tshigs su bcad pa gcig po des ni tshogs kyi lam rnyed pas nan tan du bya ba'i sgo nas tshogs kyi lam 'bras bu dang bcas par bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar tshigs su bcad pa gcig po des ni tshogs kyi lam rnyed pas nan tan du bya ba'i sgo nas tshogs kyi lam 'bras bu dang bcas par bstan to //
translated: Thus, in this single verse, the path of accumulation is taught as being fruitful from the point of view of practice, since it is attained.

original: bdag gi dbang du byas nas so sor thar pa bsgrub par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bdag gi dbang du byas nas so sor thar pa bsgrub par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that one should practice the Prātimokṣa vows in dependence on oneself, he says:🔽The monk who has controlled the senses and is in control of his faculties

original: dge slong dbang dul kun dbang po //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: dge slong dbang dul kun dbang po // zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: The monk is self-controlled, his senses restrained.🔽Thus it is said.🔽

original: dbang dul zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa dbang po lnga po dag bsrungs pa ste /🔽mig gis gzugs mthong na mtshan mar mi 'dzin mngon rtags su mi 'dzin cing /
analyzed: dbang dul zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa dbang po lnga po dag bsrungs pa ste / mig gis gzugs mthong na mtshan mar mi 'dzin mngon rtags su mi 'dzin cing /
translated: The phrase who has controlled the senses means that he has protected the five faculties such as the eyes.🔽 When he sees forms with his eyes, he does not grasp at their signs or grasp at their secondary characteristics, and he does not become attached or hostile.

original: rjes su chags pa dang / khong khro bar mi 'gyur ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su chags pa dang / khong khro bar mi 'gyur ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: And so on.

original: kun dbang po zhes bya ba ni gnas skabs mnyam pa la 'jog pa ste /
analyzed: kun dbang po zhes bya ba ni gnas skabs mnyam pa la 'jog pa ste /
translated: The phrase in control of his faculties means that he is in a state of equanimity.

original: dbang po dang / dmigs pa dang / yul dang / dus dang / gang zag la sogs pa'i gnas skabs thams cad la dbang po dul bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: dbang po dang / dmigs pa dang / yul dang / dus dang / gang zag la sogs pa'i gnas skabs thams cad la dbang po dul bar byed pa'o //
translated: He controls his faculties in all situations, such as with regard to the faculties, the objects, the objects of the senses, time, and persons.

original: des bdag nyid kyi bsam pa shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir dge slong gi tshul khrims rnams las bslab pa nyams par byed pa na bdag nyid la brten te ngo tsha shes pa skye ba'i sgo nas bdag gi dbang du byas te so sor thar pa bsgrub
analyzed: des bdag nyid kyi bsam pa shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir dge slong gi tshul khrims rnams las bslab pa nyams par byed pa na bdag nyid la brten te ngo tsha shes pa skye ba'i sgo nas bdag gi dbang du byas te so sor thar pa bsgrub
translated: Since he has extremely pure intention, he teaches the practice of individual liberation from the perspective of shame, which is based on oneself, when one violates the precepts of a fully ordained monk.

original: par bya ba bstan to //🔽gzhan gyi dbang du byas @174a * //
analyzed: par bya ba bstan to // gzhan gyi dbang du byas @174a * //
translated: He teaches the practice of individual liberation from the perspective of others.

original: nas so sor thar pa bsgrub pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: nas so sor thar pa bsgrub pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To teach the practice of individual liberation from the perspective of others, he says:

original: sangs rgyas mi 'gyur rab byung ba //
analyzed: sangs rgyas mi 'gyur rab byung ba //
translated: One does not become a Buddha by going forth🔽for the sake of avoiding debt,🔽fear of livelihood,

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: fear of the king, and so on.

original: sangs rgyas zhes smos pas ni sangs rgyas las sam sangs rgyas kyi phyir rab tu byung zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas zhes smos pas ni sangs rgyas las sam sangs rgyas kyi phyir rab tu byung zhes sbyar ro //
translated: By saying “Buddha,” one should connect “for the sake of the Buddha” or “for the sake of Buddhahood.”

original: mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni nges shing 'khrul pa med pa ste /🔽bu lon gyis 'jigs pa dang / 'tsho ba med pas 'jigs pa'am /
analyzed: mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni nges shing 'khrul pa med pa ste / bu lon gyis 'jigs pa dang / 'tsho ba med pas 'jigs pa'am /
translated: “Not” means definite and without error.🔽One does not go forth for the sake of avoiding debt, fear of livelihood,

original: rgyal po'i 'jigs pa la sogs pas rab tu byung ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: rgyal po'i 'jigs pa la sogs pas rab tu byung ba ma yin gyi /
translated: fear of the king, and so on.

original: tshul khrims dang po nyid nas yang dag par blangs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang po nyid nas yang dag par blangs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa'o //
translated: He is endowed with the virtue of having taken up morality from the very beginning.

original: rab byung ba zhes bya ba ni pha rol las legs par yang dag par blangs pa ste /
analyzed: rab byung ba zhes bya ba ni pha rol las legs par yang dag par blangs pa ste /
translated: The term ordained means that he has taken up the life of a monk from another person.

original: mgo bregs pa'o //
analyzed: mgo bregs pa'o //
translated: He has shaved his head.

original: des pha rol las legs par yang dag par blangs pa'i phyir dang / dge slong tshul khrims blangs pa rnams nyams par byed na pha rol la brten te khrel yod pa skye bar bya ba'i sgo nas gzhan gyi dbang du byas te /
analyzed: des pha rol las legs par yang dag par blangs pa'i phyir dang / dge slong tshul khrims blangs pa rnams nyams par byed na pha rol la brten te khrel yod pa skye bar bya ba'i sgo nas gzhan gyi dbang du byas te /
translated: Since he has taken up the life of a monk from another person, if he should violate the morality of a monk, he should rely on another person in order to generate a sense of shame, and thus he should be dependent on another.

original: so sor thar pa bsgrub par bya ba bstan to //
analyzed: so sor thar pa bsgrub par bya ba bstan to //
translated: This teaches the practice of the vow of individual liberation.

original: chos kyi dbang du byas nas so sor thar pa bsgrub pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: chos kyi dbang du byas nas so sor thar pa bsgrub pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the practice of the vow of individual liberation from the point of view of the Dharma, he says:

original: nges par tha par 'dod rnams kyis //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: nges par tha par 'dod rnams kyis // zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Those who desire liberation

original: nges par thar pa zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa ste sdug bsngal gtan spang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nges par thar pa zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa ste sdug bsngal gtan spang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The term liberation means nirvana, because it is the complete abandonment of suffering.

original: 'dod rnams kyis zhes bya ba ni don du gnyer ba rnams kyis so //🔽des ni nyams par gyur na phyir gso bar byed pa'i phyir dge slong gi tshul khrims rnams las bslab pa nyams pa na 'gyod pa med pa'i sgo nas chos kyi dbang du byas te /
analyzed: 'dod rnams kyis zhes bya ba ni don du gnyer ba rnams kyis so // des ni nyams par gyur na phyir gso bar byed pa'i phyir dge slong gi tshul khrims rnams las bslab pa nyams pa na 'gyod pa med pa'i sgo nas chos kyi dbang du byas te /
translated: Those who desire means those who seek.🔽Since it restores one when it degenerates, it is the training in the ethics of a monk.

original: so sor thar pa bsgrub par bya ba bstan to //
analyzed: so sor thar pa bsgrub par bya ba bstan to //
translated: The practice of the individual liberation is taught in terms of the Dharma, from the perspective of being without regret when the training degenerates.

original: bsgrub pa'i mtshan nyid kyis so sor thar pa bstan pa'i phyir /🔽so sor thar pa rtag tu srungs //
analyzed: bsgrub pa'i mtshan nyid kyis so sor thar pa bstan pa'i phyir / so sor thar pa rtag tu srungs //
translated: In order to teach the individual liberation by way of the definition of practice,

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: it says, “Always protect the individual liberation.”

original: rtag tu srungs zhes bya ba ni thog ma nyid nas nyams par mi 'gyur bar gus pa skyed cig ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rtag tu srungs zhes bya ba ni thog ma nyid nas nyams par mi 'gyur bar gus pa skyed cig ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Always protect means generate respect so that it does not degenerate from the beginning.

original: des ni nyams par mi bya ba'i phyir gus pa bskyed nas dran pa nye bar gnas pa'i phyir dge slong tshul khrims yang dag par blangs pa srung ba'i sgo nas bsgrub pa'i mtshan nyid kyis so sor thar pa bsgrub par bstan to //
analyzed: des ni nyams par mi bya ba'i phyir gus pa bskyed nas dran pa nye bar gnas pa'i phyir dge slong tshul khrims yang dag par blangs pa srung ba'i sgo nas bsgrub pa'i mtshan nyid kyis so sor thar pa bsgrub par bstan to //
translated: Since it is not to be violated, it is taught that one should practice the Prātimokṣa through the characteristic of accomplishment by means of guarding the morality that a bhikṣu has taken up, because mindfulness is well-established through generating respect.

original: gleng bslang ba'i mtshan nyid bshad zin to //
analyzed: gleng bslang ba'i mtshan nyid bshad zin to //
translated: The characteristic of introduction has been explained.

original: de'i 'og tu yang dag par brtsams pa'i mtshan nyid bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu yang dag par brtsams pa'i mtshan nyid bshad par bya ste /
translated: After that, the characteristic of correct composition should be explained.

original: yang dag par brtsams pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni so sor thar pa'i gzhung rgyas pa yang dag par brtsams pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par brtsams pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni so sor thar pa'i gzhung rgyas pa yang dag par brtsams pa'o //
translated: The characteristic of correct composition is the correct composition of the extensive text of the Prātimokṣa.

original: de yang so sor thar pa rnyed par dka' ba dang / @174b dkon mchog gsum 'byung ba bde ba la sogs pa'i sgo nas yang dag par brtsams par dgongs nas de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de yang so sor thar pa rnyed par dka' ba dang / @174b dkon mchog gsum 'byung ba bde ba la sogs pa'i sgo nas yang dag par brtsams par dgongs nas de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: And that is the correct composition with the thought of the difficulty of obtaining the Prātimokṣa and the happiness of the arising of the Three Jewels, and so on.🔽For that very reason, six verses beginning with

original: bskal pa bye ba rnams su yang //
analyzed: bskal pa bye ba rnams su yang //
translated: Even in millions of eons

original: zhes bya ba la sogs tshigs su bcad pa drug gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs tshigs su bcad pa drug gsungs so //
translated: and so on are stated.

original: 'dir yang tshigs su bcad pa drug po de dag gi brjod par bya ba dang / dgos pa dang / 'brel ba dang / dgos pa'i dgos pa brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang tshigs su bcad pa drug po de dag gi brjod par bya ba dang / dgos pa dang / 'brel ba dang / dgos pa'i dgos pa brjod par bya'o //
translated: Here, one should state the subject matter, the purpose, the connection, and the ultimate purpose of these six verses.

original: de la brjod par bya ba ni so sor thar pa la gus par bya ba'o //
analyzed: de la brjod par bya ba ni so sor thar pa la gus par bya ba'o //
translated: The subject matter is the respect for the Pratimoksha.

original: dgos pa ni sgrub par byed pa'o //
analyzed: dgos pa ni sgrub par byed pa'o //
translated: The purpose is the accomplishment of that subject matter.

original: 'brel pa ni yang dag par brtsams pa'i tshigs su bcad pa'i thabs 'di yang /
analyzed: 'brel pa ni yang dag par brtsams pa'i tshigs su bcad pa'i thabs 'di yang /
translated: The connection is the method of the verses that are properly composed.

original: dgos pa thabs las byung ba'i mtshan nyid gnyis 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: dgos pa thabs las byung ba'i mtshan nyid gnyis 'brel pa'o //
translated: The ultimate purpose is the characteristic of the purpose arising from the method.

original: dgos pa'i dgos pa ni so sor thar pa la gus par gyur nas so sor thar pa yang dag par brtsam par 'dod pas so sor thar pa gzhung rgyas pa nyan pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dgos pa'i dgos pa ni so sor thar pa la gus par gyur nas so sor thar pa yang dag par brtsam par 'dod pas so sor thar pa gzhung rgyas pa nyan pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The ultimate purpose is that, having become respectful of the Pratimoksha, one who wishes to properly undertake the Pratimoksha will listen to the extensive text of the Pratimoksha, and so forth.

original: de la tshigs su bcad pa drug po dag gis bsdus pa'i don ni rnam pa bdun te /
analyzed: de la tshigs su bcad pa drug po dag gis bsdus pa'i don ni rnam pa bdun te /
translated: The meaning of the six verses is summarized in seven points.

original: so sor thar pa rnyed par dka' ba dang / dkon mchog gsum 'byung ba bde ba dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten pa bde ba dang / sdig pa'i grogs po spangs pa bde ba dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi khyad par la brten pa bde ba dang /
analyzed: so sor thar pa rnyed par dka' ba dang / dkon mchog gsum 'byung ba bde ba dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten pa bde ba dang / sdig pa'i grogs po spangs pa bde ba dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi khyad par la brten pa bde ba dang /
translated: The happiness of obtaining the pratimoksa, the happiness of the appearance of the Three Jewels, the happiness of relying on a spiritual teacher, the happiness of abandoning evil friends, the happiness of relying on the special spiritual teacher,

original: thob par bya ba dang de bsgrub pa bde ba dang / sgrub par byed pa sbyangs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa bde ba'o //🔽de la / bskal pa bye ba rnams su yang //
analyzed: thob par bya ba dang de bsgrub pa bde ba dang / sgrub par byed pa sbyangs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa bde ba'o // de la / bskal pa bye ba rnams su yang //
translated: the happiness of obtaining and accomplishing that, and the happiness of the one who accomplishes it being endowed with the virtues of purification.🔽In this regard, one verse on the difficulty of obtaining the pratimoksa:

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gcig gis ni so sor thar pa rnyed par dka' ba bstan to //🔽sangs rgyas rnams ni 'byung ba bde //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gcig gis ni so sor thar pa rnyed par dka' ba bstan to // sangs rgyas rnams ni 'byung ba bde //
translated: The difficulty of obtaining the pratimoksa is taught by this verse and the following one.🔽One verse on the happiness of the appearance of the Three Jewels:

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gcig gi ni dkon mchog gsum 'byung ba bde ba bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gcig gi ni dkon mchog gsum 'byung ba bde ba bstan to //
translated: The happiness of the appearance of the Three Jewels is taught by this verse and the following one.

original: 'phags pa rnams ni mthong ba bde //
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams ni mthong ba bde //
translated: One verse on the happiness of seeing the noble ones:

original: dam pa dag dang 'grogs pa bde //
analyzed: dam pa dag dang 'grogs pa bde //
translated: The happiness of associating with the holy is taught by this verse and the following one.

original: zhes bya bas ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten pa bde ba bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya bas ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten pa bde ba bstan to //
translated: This shows the happiness of relying on a spiritual teacher.

original: byis pa rnams ni ma mthong na //
analyzed: byis pa rnams ni ma mthong na //
translated: The childish are not seen

original: rtag tu bde ba nyid du 'gyur //
analyzed: rtag tu bde ba nyid du 'gyur //
translated: to be happy at any time.

original: zhes bya bas ni sdig pa'i grogs po spangs pa bde ba bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya bas ni sdig pa'i grogs po spangs pa bde ba bstan to //
translated: This shows the happiness of avoiding bad friends.🔽The verse beginning

original: tshul khrims ldan pas mthong ba bde //
analyzed: tshul khrims ldan pas mthong ba bde //
translated: “It is good to see those who are moral”🔽shows the happiness of relying on the specific qualities of a spiritual teacher.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gcig gis ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi khyad par la brten pa bde ba bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gcig gis ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi khyad par la brten pa bde ba bstan to //
translated: The verse beginning

original: 'jug ngogs bde ba'i chu klung bde //
analyzed: 'jug ngogs bde ba'i chu klung bde //
translated: “A river is good when it has a ford”🔽shows the happiness of the goal and its attainment.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gcig gis ni thob par bya ba dang de sgrub pa bde ba bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gcig gis ni thob par bya ba dang de sgrub pa bde ba bstan to //
translated: The verse beginning

original: nges par byas shing dbang po thul ba dag / ces bya ba la sogs pa tshigs @175a * //
analyzed: nges par byas shing dbang po thul ba dag / ces bya ba la sogs pa tshigs @175a * //
translated: “Those who are restrained and have subdued the senses”

original: su bcad pa gcig gis ni sgrub par byed pa sbyangs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa bde ba bstan to //
analyzed: su bcad pa gcig gis ni sgrub par byed pa sbyangs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa bde ba bstan to //
translated: shows the happiness of the means of attainment, which is endowed with the virtues of purification.

original: de ni re zhig spyi'i don to //
analyzed: de ni re zhig spyi'i don to //
translated: This is the general meaning.

original: da ni yan lag gi don bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni yan lag gi don bshad par bya ste /
translated: Now, the subsidiary topics will be explained.

original: de la so sor thar pa rnyed par dka' ba'i sgo nas so sor thar pa yang dag par brtsams pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: de la so sor thar pa rnyed par dka' ba'i sgo nas so sor thar pa yang dag par brtsams pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: In this regard, with regard to the perfect composition of the pratimoksa from the perspective of the difficulty of obtaining it,🔽one verse is stated:

original: bskal pa bye ba rnams su yang //
analyzed: bskal pa bye ba rnams su yang //
translated: Even in ten million eons,

original: so sor thar pa thob pa dang / gzung dang 'dzin pa rnyed dka' ste //
analyzed: so sor thar pa thob pa dang / gzung dang 'dzin pa rnyed dka' ste //
translated: it is difficult to obtain the pratimoksa, the apprehended and apprehender,

original: sgrub pa'ang shin tu rnyed par dka' //🔽zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa gcig gsungs te /
analyzed: sgrub pa'ang shin tu rnyed par dka' // zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa gcig gsungs te /
translated: and even the practice is very difficult to obtain.

original: bskal pa zhes bya ba ni dus kyi bye brag bskal pa chen po'o //🔽bskal pa bye bas bskal pa'o //
analyzed: bskal pa zhes bya ba ni dus kyi bye brag bskal pa chen po'o // bskal pa bye bas bskal pa'o //
translated: Eon refers to a specific period of time, a great eon.🔽Ten million eons is an eon.

original: bye ba zhes bya ba ni grangs kyi bya brag ste /
analyzed: bye ba zhes bya ba ni grangs kyi bya brag ste /
translated: Ten million refers to a specific number.

original: gnas brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: gnas brgyad pa'o //
translated: This is the eighth chapter.

original: rnams su yang zhes bya ba ni bye ba phrag grangs med pa dag gis kyang brgya la rnyed par dka' bas mang po'i tshigs su bstan to //
analyzed: rnams su yang zhes bya ba ni bye ba phrag grangs med pa dag gis kyang brgya la rnyed par dka' bas mang po'i tshigs su bstan to //
translated: Even in countless tens of millions indicates the difficulty of obtaining it even in many hundreds of eons.

original: so sor thar pa zhes bya bas ni lung dang rtogs pa'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: so sor thar pa zhes bya bas ni lung dang rtogs pa'i bdag nyid do //
translated: Pratimoksa refers to the nature of scripture and realization.

original: thos pa zhes bya ba ni rna ba'i rnam par shes pas tshig gi bdag nyid thos pa'o //
analyzed: thos pa zhes bya ba ni rna ba'i rnam par shes pas tshig gi bdag nyid thos pa'o //
translated: Hearing is the ear consciousness hearing the words.

original: gzung zhes bya ba ni de'i rjes la thob pa'i yid kyis rnam par shes pa'i tshig gi bdag nyid dang don gya bdag nyid yongs su dpyod pa'o //
analyzed: gzung zhes bya ba ni de'i rjes la thob pa'i yid kyis rnam par shes pa'i tshig gi bdag nyid dang don gya bdag nyid yongs su dpyod pa'o //
translated: Grasping is the mental consciousness that arises subsequently to that, which analyzes the words and their meanings.

original: 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni tshig dang don gyi bdag nyid gzung ba ste mi brjod pa'o //
analyzed: 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni tshig dang don gyi bdag nyid gzung ba ste mi brjod pa'o //
translated: Retention is the retention of the words and their meanings, which is not forgetful.

original: rnyed dka' ste zhes bya ba ni nge gsum char yang rnyed par dka' ste ;
analyzed: rnyed dka' ste zhes bya ba ni nge gsum char yang rnyed par dka' ste ;
translated: Difficult to find means that all three are difficult to find,

original: rgya mtsho chen por gnya' shing gi mig tu ru sbal zhar ba mgrin pa chud pa'i tshul gyis gzhan gyi 'byor pa dang / bdag gi 'byor pa la sogs pa rnyed par dka' bas bskal pa chen po bye ba phrag grang bar 'das pas kyang de dag rnyed par dka' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgya mtsho chen por gnya' shing gi mig tu ru sbal zhar ba mgrin pa chud pa'i tshul gyis gzhan gyi 'byor pa dang / bdag gi 'byor pa la sogs pa rnyed par dka' bas bskal pa chen po bye ba phrag grang bar 'das pas kyang de dag rnyed par dka' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: like a blind turtle putting its neck through the hole of a yoke tossed about on the great ocean, because the opportunity for the three is difficult to find even in a hundred eons.

original: sgrub pa zhes bya ba ni sor thar pa'i rtogs pa'i don lus dang ngag dang yid kyis yang dag par sgrub cing nan tan du bya ba'o //
analyzed: sgrub pa zhes bya ba ni sor thar pa'i rtogs pa'i don lus dang ngag dang yid kyis yang dag par sgrub cing nan tan du bya ba'o //
translated: Practice means to practice and cultivate the meaning of the Pratimoksha vows with body, speech, and mind.

original: de snga ma gsum pas kyang shin tu rnyed par dka' ste /
analyzed: de snga ma gsum pas kyang shin tu rnyed par dka' ste /
translated: It is even more difficult to obtain than the previous three.

original: yang dag par bsgrub pa ni mngon par brtson pa la rag las pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag par bsgrub pa ni mngon par brtson pa la rag las pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because correct practice depends on striving.

original: de lta bas na so sor thar pa brjod par byas gus par nyon cig dang drang srong chen pos ji skad gsungs pa de bzhin du rjes su bsgrub cing nan tan du bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de lta bas na so sor thar pa brjod par byas gus par nyon cig dang drang srong chen pos ji skad gsungs pa de bzhin du rjes su bsgrub cing nan tan du bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Therefore, it means that the Pratimoksha should be recited, listened to respectfully, and practiced and cultivated just as it was taught by the Great Sage.

original: de ltar tshigs su bcad pa des ni lung dang rtogs pa'i sgo nas so sor thar pa rnyed par dka' bas so sor thar pa yang dag par brtsam par bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar tshigs su bcad pa des ni lung dang rtogs pa'i sgo nas so sor thar pa rnyed par dka' bas so sor thar pa yang dag par brtsam par bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: Thus, by that verse, it is taught that the Pratimoksha should be correctly undertaken because it is difficult to obtain through scripture and realization.

original: thos pa dang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa rnyed par dka' ba @175b dag ni lung gi sgo nas rnyed dka' ba yin la /
analyzed: thos pa dang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa rnyed par dka' ba @175b dag ni lung gi sgo nas rnyed dka' ba yin la /
translated: The difficulty of obtaining hearing, retention, and the teacher is the difficulty of obtaining the scriptures.

original: sgrub pa yang shin tu rnyed dka' ba ni rtogs pa'i sgo nas rnyed dka' ba yin no //
analyzed: sgrub pa yang shin tu rnyed dka' ba ni rtogs pa'i sgo nas rnyed dka' ba yin no //
translated: The difficulty of practice is the difficulty of obtaining the realizations.

original: dkon mchog gsum 'byung ba bde ba'i sgo nas so sor thar pa yang dag par brtsams pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum 'byung ba bde ba'i sgo nas so sor thar pa yang dag par brtsams pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: From the point of view of the happiness of the appearance of the Three Jewels, the verse on the difficulty of obtaining the opportunity to practice refers to the happiness of the appearance of the Buddha.

original: sangs rgyas rnams ni 'byung ba bde //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams ni 'byung ba bde //
translated: The appearance of the buddhas is happiness.

original: chos bstan pa yang bde ba yin //🔽dge 'dun mthun pa bde ba ste //
analyzed: chos bstan pa yang bde ba yin // dge 'dun mthun pa bde ba ste //
translated: The teaching of the Dharma is happiness.🔽The harmony of the Sangha is happiness.

original: mthun pa rnams kyi dka' thub bde //
analyzed: mthun pa rnams kyi dka' thub bde //
translated: The austerity of the harmonious is happiness.

original: zhes bya ba'i tshig su bcad pa gcig gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshig su bcad pa gcig gsungs te /
translated: This is the one verse.

original: sangs rgyas rnams ni 'byung ba bde //🔽zhes bya ba la sangs rgyas 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni rdzogs pa'i byang chub pa'i tshe'am /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams ni 'byung ba bde // zhes bya ba la sangs rgyas 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni rdzogs pa'i byang chub pa'i tshe'am /
translated: The appearance of the buddhas is happiness.

original: phyis 'byung ba'i tshul gyis bltams pa'i tshe'o ;
analyzed: phyis 'byung ba'i tshul gyis bltams pa'i tshe'o ;
translated: The appearance of the buddhas refers to the time of perfect enlightenment or the time of birth, which is the appearance of the Buddha.

original: / de bde zhes bya ba ni rnam par grol ba'i bde ba thob pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir dang / 'bras bu bde bar 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: / de bde zhes bya ba ni rnam par grol ba'i bde ba thob pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir dang / 'bras bu bde bar 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
translated: The phrase it is happiness means that it is the cause of attaining the happiness of liberation and it is the result of happiness.

original: dper na mi bde ba'o zhes bya ba 'dra bar sangs rgyas rnams 'byung ba bde ba yin no //
analyzed: dper na mi bde ba'o zhes bya ba 'dra bar sangs rgyas rnams 'byung ba bde ba yin no //
translated: For example, the phrase it is suffering is similar to the statement the appearance of the buddhas is happiness.

original: chos bstan pa yang bde ba yin //
analyzed: chos bstan pa yang bde ba yin //
translated: The teaching of the Dharma is happiness.

original: zhes bya ba ni mdo sde la sogs pa gsung rab tu gtogs pa'i yan lag bcu gnyis po dag bstan pa yang bde ba'i rgyu yin pa dang / 'bras bu bde bar 'gyur bas bde ba yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mdo sde la sogs pa gsung rab tu gtogs pa'i yan lag bcu gnyis po dag bstan pa yang bde ba'i rgyu yin pa dang / 'bras bu bde bar 'gyur bas bde ba yin no //
translated: The phrase the teaching of the Dharma is happiness means that the teaching of the twelve branches of the scriptures, such as the sutras, is happiness because it is the cause of happiness and it is the result of happiness.

original: dge 'dun mthun pa bde ba ste //
analyzed: dge 'dun mthun pa bde ba ste //
translated: The harmony of the Sangha is happiness.

original: zhes bya ba ni skyes bu gang zag brgyad kyi bdag nyid kyi dge 'dun tshul khrims dang / lta ba dang / cho ga dang / 'tsho ba mthun pas ro gcig cing bya ba gcig tu gyur pa yang bde ba'i rgyu yin pa yang /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni skyes bu gang zag brgyad kyi bdag nyid kyi dge 'dun tshul khrims dang / lta ba dang / cho ga dang / 'tsho ba mthun pas ro gcig cing bya ba gcig tu gyur pa yang bde ba'i rgyu yin pa yang /
translated: The phrase the harmony of the Sangha is happiness means that the Sangha, which consists of the eight types of noble individuals, is happiness because it is the cause of happiness and it is the result of happiness.

original: 'bras bu bde bar 'gyur bas bde ba yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu bde bar 'gyur bas bde ba yin no //
translated: The harmony of the Sangha is happiness because it is the cause of happiness and it is the result of happiness.

original: mthun pa rnams kyi dka' thub ba bde //
analyzed: mthun pa rnams kyi dka' thub ba bde //
translated: The austerity of the virtuous is happiness.

original: zhes bya ba ni lhag pa'i tshul khrims la sogs pa bslab pa gsum po dag la rjes su bsgrub pa'i dka' thub /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni lhag pa'i tshul khrims la sogs pa bslab pa gsum po dag la rjes su bsgrub pa'i dka' thub /
translated: This shows that the austerity of the three trainings in superior morality, etc.

original: nyon mongs pa dang nyes par spyod pa gdung bar byed pa yang bde ba'i rgyu yin pa dang / 'bras bu bde ba'i rgyur gyur pas bde ba yin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang nyes par spyod pa gdung bar byed pa yang bde ba'i rgyu yin pa dang / 'bras bu bde ba'i rgyur gyur pas bde ba yin no //
translated: is the cause of happiness, because it is the cause of the happiness of the result, and because it is the cause of the happiness of the present life, since it is the antidote to the distress of the passions and bad behavior.

original: de ltar tshigs su bcad pa des ni dkon mchog gsum 'byung ba dang / de dag gi 'bras bu bde ba de nyid yin pas so sor thar pa yang dag par brtsam par bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar tshigs su bcad pa des ni dkon mchog gsum 'byung ba dang / de dag gi 'bras bu bde ba de nyid yin pas so sor thar pa yang dag par brtsam par bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: Thus, this verse shows that one should undertake the Prātimokṣa vows because the appearance of the Three Jewels and the happiness that is their result are due to them.

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten pa bde ba'i sgo nas so sor thar pa yang dag par brtsams pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten pa bde ba'i sgo nas so sor thar pa yang dag par brtsams pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: In order to undertake the Prātimokṣa vows by means of the happiness of relying on a spiritual teacher, he says:

original: 'phags pa rnams ni mthong ba bde //
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams ni mthong ba bde //
translated: It is happiness to see the noble ones.

original: dam pa dag dang 'grogs pa bde //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: dam pa dag dang 'grogs pa bde //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: It is happiness to associate with the good.

original: 'phags pa rnams zhes bya ba ni dgra bcom pa la sogs pa bdag ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams zhes bya ba ni dgra bcom pa la sogs pa bdag ste /
translated: The noble ones are the arhats and so on, who are masters of themselves.

original: sdig pa dag las ring du song ba'i phyir 'phags pa zhes @176a * //
analyzed: sdig pa dag las ring du song ba'i phyir 'phags pa zhes @176a * //
translated: They are called noble because they have gone far from evil.

original: bya'o ; / mthong ba zhes bya ba ni de dag dge ba'i bshes gnyen gnyis su mthong na bde ba'i rgyur 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: bya'o ; / mthong ba zhes bya ba ni de dag dge ba'i bshes gnyen gnyis su mthong na bde ba'i rgyur 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Seeing them is seeing the two spiritual teachers, which becomes the cause of happiness.

original: dam pa dag dang zhes bya ba ni so so'i skye bo'i nang nas skyes bu dam pa byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa dag ste /
analyzed: dam pa dag dang zhes bya ba ni so so'i skye bo'i nang nas skyes bu dam pa byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa dag ste /
translated: The holy ones are the holy beings, such as the bodhisattvas, among ordinary beings.

original: gzhan la phan 'dogs shing nges pa'i phyir dam pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan la phan 'dogs shing nges pa'i phyir dam pa zhes bya'o //
translated: They are called holy because they are dedicated to helping others.

original: 'grogs pa bde zhes bya ba ni lhan cig mtshungs par gnas na bde ba'i rgyur 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'grogs pa bde zhes bya ba ni lhan cig mtshungs par gnas na bde ba'i rgyur 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Associating with them is associating with those who are the cause of happiness when one lives with them.

original: de ltar tshigs su bcad pa phyed po des ni 'phags pa mthong ba dang / dam pa dag dang 'grogs pa ni tshe 'di dang phyi ma'i bde ba phun sum tshogs pa'i sngon du 'gro ba yin pas dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten pa bde ba'i sgo nas so sor thar pa yang dag par brtsam par bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar tshigs su bcad pa phyed po des ni 'phags pa mthong ba dang / dam pa dag dang 'grogs pa ni tshe 'di dang phyi ma'i bde ba phun sum tshogs pa'i sngon du 'gro ba yin pas dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten pa bde ba'i sgo nas so sor thar pa yang dag par brtsam par bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: Thus, by this half-verse, it is shown that seeing the noble ones and associating with the holy ones is the prerequisite for the perfect happiness of this life and the next. Therefore, one should undertake the Prātimokṣa through relying on a spiritual friend with a happy mind.

original: sdig pa'i grogs po spangs pa bde ba'i sgo nas so sor thar pa yang dag par brtsams pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: sdig pa'i grogs po spangs pa bde ba'i sgo nas so sor thar pa yang dag par brtsams pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: With regard to undertaking the Prātimokṣa with a happy mind through abandoning evil friends,🔽it is said:

original: byis pa rnams ni ma mthong na //
analyzed: byis pa rnams ni ma mthong na //
translated: Not seeing fools,

original: rtag tu bde ba nyid du 'gyur //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: rtag tu bde ba nyid du 'gyur // zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: one always becomes happy.

original: byis pa rnams ni zhes bya ba ni shes rab 'chal pa log par sgrub pa rnams te /
analyzed: byis pa rnams ni zhes bya ba ni shes rab 'chal pa log par sgrub pa rnams te /
translated: Here, fools refers to those with bad wisdom and wrong practice,

original: byis pa'i rtags dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byis pa'i rtags dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they possess the characteristics of fools.

original: ma mthong na /
analyzed: ma mthong na /
translated: Not seeing

original: rtag tu bde ba nyid du 'gyur //
analyzed: rtag tu bde ba nyid du 'gyur //
translated: one always becomes happy.

original: zhes bya ba ni sdig pa'i grogs po dang ma 'grogs na rnam pa thams cad du bde bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sdig pa'i grogs po dang ma 'grogs na rnam pa thams cad du bde bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, if one does not associate with evil companions, one will be happy in every way.

original: de ltar tshigs su bcad pa phyed po des ni sdig pa'i grogs po spangs pa bde ba'i sgo nas so sor thar pa yang dag par brtsam par bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar tshigs su bcad pa phyed po des ni sdig pa'i grogs po spangs pa bde ba'i sgo nas so sor thar pa yang dag par brtsam par bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: Thus, in this first half-verse, it is shown that one should undertake the practice of the vow of individual liberation by means of happiness, by avoiding evil companions.

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi khyad par la brten pa bde ba'i sgo nas so sor thar pa yang dag par brtsams pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi khyad par la brten pa bde ba'i sgo nas so sor thar pa yang dag par brtsams pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: In the second half-verse, the Blessed One teaches the undertaking of the practice of the vow of individual liberation by means of happiness, in dependence on the special qualities of a spiritual teacher.

original: tshul khrims ldan pa mthong ba bde //
analyzed: tshul khrims ldan pa mthong ba bde //
translated: It is happiness to see one who is moral.🔽It is happiness to see one who is learned.

original: mang du thos pa mthong ba bde //
analyzed: mang du thos pa mthong ba bde //
translated: It is happiness to see an arhat

original: yang srid rnam par grol ba yi //🔽dgra bcom pa dag mthong ba bde //
analyzed: yang srid rnam par grol ba yi // dgra bcom pa dag mthong ba bde //
translated: who is liberated from all future rebirth.

original: zhes bya ba ni tshigs su bcad pa gcig gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni tshigs su bcad pa gcig gsungs te /
translated: This is the one verse.

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi khyad par ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi khyad par ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The special qualities of a spiritual teacher are of two kinds:

original: nye bar brtags pa dang / don dam pa'o //
analyzed: nye bar brtags pa dang / don dam pa'o //
translated: conventional and ultimate.

original: nye bar brtags pa la yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: nye bar brtags pa la yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The conventional is of two kinds:

original: zhi gnas kyi yan lag la gnas pa dang / lhag mthong gi yan lag la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: zhi gnas kyi yan lag la gnas pa dang / lhag mthong gi yan lag la gnas pa'o //
translated: He is established in the branches of serenity and in the branches of insight.

original: de la zhi gnas kyi yan lag la gnas pa ni /
analyzed: de la zhi gnas kyi yan lag la gnas pa ni /
translated: He is established in the branches of serenity.

original: tshul khrims ldan pa zhes bya bas bstan te /
analyzed: tshul khrims ldan pa zhes bya bas bstan te /
translated: He is established in morality.

original: tshul khrims la gnas na sems mnyam par 'jog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshul khrims la gnas na sems mnyam par 'jog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the mind becomes concentrated when one is established in morality.

original: des mthong ba bde ba ni tshul khrims dang ldan pa ni gzhan la gnod pa'i bsam pa @176b las log pas bde ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des mthong ba bde ba ni tshul khrims dang ldan pa ni gzhan la gnod pa'i bsam pa @176b las log pas bde ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He is happy in his view. Because one who is established in morality is turned away from the intention to harm others, he is a cause of happiness.🔽He is established in the branches of insight.

original: lhag mthong gi yan lag la gnas pa ni mang du thos pa zhes bya bas bstan te /
analyzed: lhag mthong gi yan lag la gnas pa ni mang du thos pa zhes bya bas bstan te /
translated: He is learned.

original: mang du thos na shes rab skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mang du thos na shes rab skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because wisdom arises when one is learned.

original: de mthong ba bde ba ni thos pa dang ldan pa ni thos pa'i stobs kyis lta ba dang / 'gyod pa dang / the tshom sel bas bde ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de mthong ba bde ba ni thos pa dang ldan pa ni thos pa'i stobs kyis lta ba dang / 'gyod pa dang / the tshom sel bas bde ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He is happy in his view. Because one who is learned is a cause of happiness by dispelling wrong views, regret, and doubt through the power of his learning.

original: don dam pa ni /
analyzed: don dam pa ni /
translated: The ultimate is

original: yang srid rnam par grol ba yi //
analyzed: yang srid rnam par grol ba yi //
translated: liberation from rebirth.

original: dgra bcom pa zhes bya bas bstan te /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa zhes bya bas bstan te /
translated: The term “worthy one” is explained.

original: yang srid rnam par grol ba yi //
analyzed: yang srid rnam par grol ba yi //
translated: Liberated from future existence

original: zhes bya bas ni 'khor bar yang mi skye ba'i chos nyid kyis rnam par grol ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya bas ni 'khor bar yang mi skye ba'i chos nyid kyis rnam par grol ba'o //
translated: means that he is liberated by the reality of not being born again in cyclic existence.

original: dgra bcom pa zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i dgra rnams bcom pa bstan to //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i dgra rnams bcom pa bstan to //
translated: The term “worthy one” indicates that he has destroyed the enemies, the afflictions.

original: dgra bcom pa zhes bya ba'i sgra 'ongs pa la sogs pa don gzhan du yang 'dren pas dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu dang ldan pa nyid kyi bye brag bstan pa'i phyir yang srid rnam par grol ba zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa zhes bya ba'i sgra 'ongs pa la sogs pa don gzhan du yang 'dren pas dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu dang ldan pa nyid kyi bye brag bstan pa'i phyir yang srid rnam par grol ba zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Since the term “worthy one” can be interpreted to mean other things, such as “come here,” in order to indicate the specific quality of possessing the fruit of a worthy one, the text says “liberated from future existence.”

original: de mthong ba bde ba de ni dgra bcom pa thob pa ni dge legs kyi bsam pa mchog dang ldan pa yin pas bde ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir mtshan nyid bshad zin to /
analyzed: de mthong ba bde ba de ni dgra bcom pa thob pa ni dge legs kyi bsam pa mchog dang ldan pa yin pas bde ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir mtshan nyid bshad zin to /
translated: That happiness of seeing is the happiness of one who has attained the state of a worthy one, who possesses the highest thought of virtue and goodness, and is therefore a cause of happiness.🔽The definition has been explained.

original: // / de'i 'og tu gzhung rgyas pa'i mtshan nyid bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: // / de'i 'og tu gzhung rgyas pa'i mtshan nyid bshad par bya ste /
translated: Now, the definition of the extensive text will be explained.

original: gzhung rgyas pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni so sor thar pa'i gzhung rgyas pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gzhung rgyas pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni so sor thar pa'i gzhung rgyas pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa'o //
translated: The so-called “extensive text” is the teaching of the characteristics of the extensive text of the Pratimoksha.

original: de yang dus dang por bya ba dang / mdo gdon pa bstan dgos pa de'i phyir tshe dang ldan pa dag so ga rnams kyi 'das pa dang lhag ma ci tsam mo zhes bya ba nas dran pa dang bag yod pas rnal 'byor du bya'o zhes bya ba'i gzhung thams cad gsungs so //
analyzed: de yang dus dang por bya ba dang / mdo gdon pa bstan dgos pa de'i phyir tshe dang ldan pa dag so ga rnams kyi 'das pa dang lhag ma ci tsam mo zhes bya ba nas dran pa dang bag yod pas rnal 'byor du bya'o zhes bya ba'i gzhung thams cad gsungs so //
translated: Moreover, it is necessary to teach the first time period and the recitation of the sutra. Therefore, the entire text from “Venerable ones, the hot season has passed and the remaining time is small” up to “one should practice with mindfulness and heedfulness” is stated.

original: de la 'dir yang gzhung rgyas pa de dag gi brjod par bya ba dang / dgos pa dang / 'brel pa dang / dgos pa'i dgos pa brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de la 'dir yang gzhung rgyas pa de dag gi brjod par bya ba dang / dgos pa dang / 'brel pa dang / dgos pa'i dgos pa brjod par bya ste /
translated: Here, the subject matter, purpose, connection, and the purpose of the purpose should be stated regarding those extensive texts.

original: de la brjod par bya ba ni gzhung rgyas pa'i mtshan nyid dag go //
analyzed: de la brjod par bya ba ni gzhung rgyas pa'i mtshan nyid dag go //
translated: Among them, the subject matter is the characteristics of the extensive texts.

original: dgos pa ni de dag rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: dgos pa ni de dag rtogs pa'o //
translated: The purpose is understanding them.

original: 'brel pa ni rtogs pa de yang 'dis byed pas gzhung rgyas pa'i thabs 'di yang dgos pa thabs las byung ba'i mtshan nyid gnyis 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: 'brel pa ni rtogs pa de yang 'dis byed pas gzhung rgyas pa'i thabs 'di yang dgos pa thabs las byung ba'i mtshan nyid gnyis 'brel pa'o //
translated: The connection is that this also causes the realization, and so this extensive treatise is the method, and the extensive treatise on the Vinaya is the characteristic arising from the method.

original: dgos pa'i dgos pa ni so sor thar pa'i gzhung rgyas pa'i mtshan nyid de yongs su shes pas tshul khrims rnam par dag pa na 'phags pa'i lam bsgoms pas mya ngan las pa thob pa'o //
analyzed: dgos pa'i dgos pa ni so sor thar pa'i gzhung rgyas pa'i mtshan nyid de yongs su shes pas tshul khrims rnam par dag pa na 'phags pa'i lam bsgoms pas mya ngan las pa thob pa'o //
translated: The ultimate purpose is the characteristic of the extensive treatise on the Pratimoksha, and by fully understanding that, when morality is purified, one attains nirvana by cultivating the noble path.

original: de la gzhung rgyas pa 'di'i bsdus pa'i don ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la gzhung rgyas pa 'di'i bsdus pa'i don ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Here, the summarized meaning of this extensive treatise is twofold:

original: dus dang por bya ba dang / mdo gdon pa'o //🔽de la du sa dang por bya ba ni mdo gdon pa'i snga rol du @177a * //
analyzed: dus dang por bya ba dang / mdo gdon pa'o // de la du sa dang por bya ba ni mdo gdon pa'i snga rol du @177a * //
translated: the preliminary duties and the recitation of the sutra.

original: bya ba ste cho ga'o //
analyzed: bya ba ste cho ga'o //
translated: Here, the preliminary duties are the duties performed prior to the recitation of the sutra, which is the ritual.

original: de la bsdus pa'i don ni rnam pa drug ste /
analyzed: de la bsdus pa'i don ni rnam pa drug ste /
translated: There, the summarized meaning is sixfold:

original: so sor thar pa nyan pa la rna mi gtod pa'i nyes dmigs dang / mi 'du ba dgag pa dang / mchod cing lung dbog pa dang / yang dag par sgrub tu gzhug pa dang / de'i phan yon dang / yang dag par mi sgrub pa'i nyes dmigs bstan pa'o //
analyzed: so sor thar pa nyan pa la rna mi gtod pa'i nyes dmigs dang / mi 'du ba dgag pa dang / mchod cing lung dbog pa dang / yang dag par sgrub tu gzhug pa dang / de'i phan yon dang / yang dag par mi sgrub pa'i nyes dmigs bstan pa'o //
translated: The benefits of listening to the Pratimoksha, the disadvantages of not listening, the prohibition against not assembling, the worship and oral transmission, the correct practice, the benefits of that, and the disadvantages of not practicing correctly.

original: mdo gdon pa ni gsol ba byas nas so sor thar pa'i mdo gdon pa rnam pa lnga po dag gdon pa ste las so //
analyzed: mdo gdon pa ni gsol ba byas nas so sor thar pa'i mdo gdon pa rnam pa lnga po dag gdon pa ste las so //
translated: The recitation of the sutra is the recitation of the five types of Pratimoksha sutra recitations after making a request.

original: de'i bsdus pa'i don kyang rnam pa drug ste /
analyzed: de'i bsdus pa'i don kyang rnam pa drug ste /
translated: Its summarized meaning is also sixfold:

original: gsol ba gdon pa dang / gleng gzhi gdon pa dang / pham par 'gyur ba gdon pa dang / dge 'dun lhag ma gdon pa dang / ma nges pa gdon pa dang / ril gyis gdon pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gsol ba gdon pa dang / gleng gzhi gdon pa dang / pham par 'gyur ba gdon pa dang / dge 'dun lhag ma gdon pa dang / ma nges pa gdon pa dang / ril gyis gdon pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa'o //
translated: The request, the introduction, the recitation of the defeats, the recitation of the residual faults, the recitation of the undetermined, and the explanation of the characteristics of the complete recitation.

original: de la tshe dang ldan pa dag so ga rnams kyi 'das pa dang lhag ma ji tsam pa de tsam mo zhes bya ba nas bag yod pas 'thob po zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni so sor thar pa nyan pa la rna mi gtod pa'i nyes dmigs bstan
analyzed: de la tshe dang ldan pa dag so ga rnams kyi 'das pa dang lhag ma ji tsam pa de tsam mo zhes bya ba nas bag yod pas 'thob po zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni so sor thar pa nyan pa la rna mi gtod pa'i nyes dmigs bstan
translated: The passage from Venerable ones, it is only so much of the hot season that has passed and so much remains up to it is obtained through heedfulness teaches the disadvantage of not paying attention to listening to the Pratimoksha.

original: to // bcom ldan 'das kyi nyan thos kyi dge 'dun ni don nyung ba bya ba nyung ba yin pas zhes bya ba nas dris nas kyang brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni mi 'du ba dgag pa bstan to //🔽sh'akya seng ge de la ni //
analyzed: to // bcom ldan 'das kyi nyan thos kyi dge 'dun ni don nyung ba bya ba nyung ba yin pas zhes bya ba nas dris nas kyang brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni mi 'du ba dgag pa bstan to // sh'akya seng ge de la ni //
translated: The passage from The Sangha of the Blessed One's disciples has little business and few affairs up to having asked, one should speak teaches the prohibition against not assembling.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gcig gis ni mchod cing lung dbog pa bstan to //🔽thos nas drang srong chen po yis //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gcig gis ni mchod cing lung dbog pa bstan to // thos nas drang srong chen po yis //
translated: The passage from To that Shakya Lion up to I will go to the forest teaches the worship and transmission.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyis ni yang dag par sgrub tu gzhug pa bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyis ni yang dag par sgrub tu gzhug pa bstan to //
translated: The passage from Having heard up to I will go to the forest teaches the establishment in correct practice.

original: che ba gang dag ngag tsam gyis //
analyzed: che ba gang dag ngag tsam gyis //
translated: The passage from Those who are great up to I will go to the forest teaches the establishment in correct practice.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gcig gis ni de'i phan yon bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gcig gis ni de'i phan yon bstan to //
translated: One verse on the benefits of the rite.

original: su la srab 'di med pa dang ; / zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gcig gis ni yang dag par mi sgrub pa'i nyes dmigs bstan to //
analyzed: su la srab 'di med pa dang ; / zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gcig gis ni yang dag par mi sgrub pa'i nyes dmigs bstan to //
translated: One verse on the disadvantage of not practicing the rite.

original: dge 'dun btsun pa rnams gsan du gsol zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol ba 'ba' zhig gi las kyis ni gsol ba bstan to //
analyzed: dge 'dun btsun pa rnams gsan du gsol zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol ba 'ba' zhig gi las kyis ni gsol ba bstan to //
translated: The announcement of the rite is shown by the statement, “Venerable monks, please listen!” and so on.

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag bdag cag gso sbyong bya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gzhung lhag ma rnams kyis ni gleng gzhi gdon pa la sogs pa rim bzhin du bstan to //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag bdag cag gso sbyong bya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gzhung lhag ma rnams kyis ni gleng gzhi gdon pa la sogs pa rim bzhin du bstan to //
translated: The announcement of the basis and so on is shown by the remainder of the text, “Venerable monks, today is the purification ceremony.

original: de ni re zhig spyi'i don yin no //
analyzed: de ni re zhig spyi'i don yin no //
translated: This is the general meaning.

original: da ni yan lag gi don bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni yan lag gi don bshad par bya ste /
translated: Now the branch meanings will be explained.

original: so sor thar pa nyan pa la rna mi gtod pa'i nyes dmigs bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: so sor thar pa nyan pa la rna mi gtod pa'i nyes dmigs bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: With regard to the disadvantage of not paying attention to the recitation of the Pratimoksha,

original: tshe dang ldan pa @177b dag so ga ba rnams kyi 'das pa dang lhag ma ji tsam pa de tsam mo zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa @177b dag so ga ba rnams kyi 'das pa dang lhag ma ji tsam pa de tsam mo zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The Blessed One said, Venerable ones, it is just as much as the remaining days of the hot season.

original: tshe dang ldan pa bdag ces bya ba ni rgan pa dang gzhon pa dag la snyan pa'i tshig gis bod pa'o //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa bdag ces bya ba ni rgan pa dang gzhon pa dag la snyan pa'i tshig gis bod pa'o //
translated: Venerable ones is a polite expression to the elders and the young.

original: so ga rnams kyi zhes bya ba ni gso sbyong 'don pa'i dus tshigs mtshon pa ste /
analyzed: so ga rnams kyi zhes bya ba ni gso sbyong 'don pa'i dus tshigs mtshon pa ste /
translated: The hot season indicates the time for reciting the poṣadha.

original: so ga dang / dbyar dang ; ston dang / dgun dang / dgun smad dang / dpyid kyi dus tshigs drug po gang gi che so sor thar pa'i dus tshigs de nyid kyi ming smos par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: so ga dang / dbyar dang ; ston dang / dgun dang / dgun smad dang / dpyid kyi dus tshigs drug po gang gi che so sor thar pa'i dus tshigs de nyid kyi ming smos par bya ba yin no //
translated: The six seasons are the hot season, the rainy season, the autumn, the winter, the late winter, and the spring. The name of the season in which the poṣadha is recited should be used.

original: de la dus tshigs drug po re re la zla ba gnyis gnyis yod pas mang po'i tshig tu bya ste /
analyzed: de la dus tshigs drug po re re la zla ba gnyis gnyis yod pas mang po'i tshig tu bya ste /
translated: Since each of the six seasons has two months, the plural is used.

original: so ga'i dus tshigs ni dpyid zla tha chungs nya nas dbyar zla ra ba nya'i bar dang / dbyar zla ra ba nya nas dbyar zla 'bring po'i nya'i bar gyi zla ba gnyis so //🔽dbyar gyi dus tshigs ni dbyar zla 'bring po'i nya nas dbyar zla tha chungs kyi nya'i bar dang / dbyar zla tha chungs nya nas ston zla ra ba nya'i bar gyi zla ba gnyis so //🔽ston gyi dus tshigs ni ston zla ra ba nya nas ston zla 'bring po'i nya'i bar dang / ston zla 'bring po'i nya nas ston zla tha chungs nya'i bar gyi zla ba gnyis so //
analyzed: so ga'i dus tshigs ni dpyid zla tha chungs nya nas dbyar zla ra ba nya'i bar dang / dbyar zla ra ba nya nas dbyar zla 'bring po'i nya'i bar gyi zla ba gnyis so // dbyar gyi dus tshigs ni dbyar zla 'bring po'i nya nas dbyar zla tha chungs kyi nya'i bar dang / dbyar zla tha chungs nya nas ston zla ra ba nya'i bar gyi zla ba gnyis so // ston gyi dus tshigs ni ston zla ra ba nya nas ston zla 'bring po'i nya'i bar dang / ston zla 'bring po'i nya nas ston zla tha chungs nya'i bar gyi zla ba gnyis so //
translated: The spring season is the two months from the full moon of the last spring month to the full moon of the first summer month.🔽The summer season is the two months from the full moon of the first summer month to the full moon of the middle summer month.🔽The autumn season is the two months from the full moon of the middle summer month to the full moon of the last autumn month.

original: dgun gyi dus tshigs ni ston zla tha chungs nya nas dgun zla ra ba nya'i bar dang / dgun zla ra ba nya nas dgun zla 'bring po'i nya'i bar gyi zla ba gnyis so //
analyzed: dgun gyi dus tshigs ni ston zla tha chungs nya nas dgun zla ra ba nya'i bar dang / dgun zla ra ba nya nas dgun zla 'bring po'i nya'i bar gyi zla ba gnyis so //
translated: The winter season is the two months from the full moon of the last autumn month to the full moon of the first winter month and from the full moon of the first winter month to the full moon of the middle winter month.

original: dgun smad kyi dus tshigs ni dgun zla 'bring po'i nya nas dgun zla tha chungs nya'i bar dang / dgun zla tha chungs nya nas dpyid zla ra ba nya'i bar gyi zla ba gnyis so //
analyzed: dgun smad kyi dus tshigs ni dgun zla 'bring po'i nya nas dgun zla tha chungs nya'i bar dang / dgun zla tha chungs nya nas dpyid zla ra ba nya'i bar gyi zla ba gnyis so //
translated: The winter season is the two months from the full moon of the middle winter month up to the full moon of the last winter month, and from the full moon of the last winter month up to the full moon of the first spring month.

original: dpyid kyi dus tshigs ni dpyid zla ra ba nya nas dpyid zla 'bring po'i nya'i bar dang / dpyid zla 'bring po nya nas dpyid zla tha chungs nya'i bar gyi zla ba gnyis so //
analyzed: dpyid kyi dus tshigs ni dpyid zla ra ba nya nas dpyid zla 'bring po'i nya'i bar dang / dpyid zla 'bring po nya nas dpyid zla tha chungs nya'i bar gyi zla ba gnyis so //
translated: The spring season is the two months from the full moon of the first spring month up to the full moon of the middle spring month, and from the full moon of the middle spring month up to the full moon of the last spring month.

original: de la so ga'i dus tshigs la so sor thar pa 'don na ni so ga rnams kyi zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de la so ga'i dus tshigs la so sor thar pa 'don na ni so ga rnams kyi zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: If the Pratimoksha is recited in the spring season, one should say “of the springs.”

original: de bzhin du dbyar dang / ston dang / dgun dang / dgun snad dang / dpyid kyi dus tshigs la so sor thar pa 'don na yang dbyar rnams kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du dbyar dang / ston dang / dgun dang / dgun snad dang / dpyid kyi dus tshigs la so sor thar pa 'don na yang dbyar rnams kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa brjod par bya'o //
translated: Similarly, if the Pratimoksha is recited in the summer, autumn, winter, last winter, or spring seasons, one should say “of the summers,” and so on.

original: 'das pa dang lhag ma ji tsam pa de tsam mo zhes bya ba ni zla ba brjod par bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: 'das pa dang lhag ma ji tsam pa de tsam mo zhes bya ba ni zla ba brjod par bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: The remainder is the same as the past.

original: 'das pa ci tsam pa de tsam mo zhes brjod par bya ba dang / lhag ma ji tsam pa de tsam mo brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'das pa ci tsam pa de tsam mo zhes brjod par bya ba dang / lhag ma ji tsam pa de tsam mo brjod par bya'o //
translated: The remainder is the same as the past.

original: de la so ga'i dus tshigs la ni gso sbyong 'don pa'i dus bzhi yod de /🔽dpyid zla tha chungs gnam stod dang / dbyar zla ra ba nya dang / dbyar zla ra ba @178a * //
analyzed: de la so ga'i dus tshigs la ni gso sbyong 'don pa'i dus bzhi yod de / dpyid zla tha chungs gnam stod dang / dbyar zla ra ba nya dang / dbyar zla ra ba @178a * //
translated: In the spring season, there are four times for reciting the poṣadha.🔽The last day of the month of Caitra, the full moon of Vaiśākha,

original: gnam stong dang / dbyar zla ba 'bring po'i nya'o //🔽de la dpyid zla tha chungs gnam stong la 'don na ni 'di skad ces tshe dang ldan pa dag so ga rnams kyi zla ba phyed ni 'das so //
analyzed: gnam stong dang / dbyar zla ba 'bring po'i nya'o // de la dpyid zla tha chungs gnam stong la 'don na ni 'di skad ces tshe dang ldan pa dag so ga rnams kyi zla ba phyed ni 'das so //
translated: the last day of the month of Jyeṣṭha, and the full moon of Āṣāḍha.🔽If it is recited on the last day of the month of Caitra, it should be said, “Venerable ones, half of the spring season has passed.

original: zla ba phyed dang gnyis ni shul du lus so zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: zla ba phyed dang gnyis ni shul du lus so zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: One and a half months remain.”

original: dbyar zla ra ba nya la 'don na ni 'di skad ces tshe dang ldan pa dag so ga rnams kyi zla ba gcig ni 'das so //
analyzed: dbyar zla ra ba nya la 'don na ni 'di skad ces tshe dang ldan pa dag so ga rnams kyi zla ba gcig ni 'das so //
translated: If the Poṣadha is performed in the first summer month on the full moon day, one should say: “Venerable ones, one month of the hot season has passed.

original: zla ba gcig ni lus so zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: zla ba gcig ni lus so zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: One month remains.”

original: dbyar zla ra ba gnam stong la 'don na ni 'di skad ces tshe dang ldan pa dag so ga rnams kyi zla ba phyed dang gnyis ni 'das so //
analyzed: dbyar zla ra ba gnam stong la 'don na ni 'di skad ces tshe dang ldan pa dag so ga rnams kyi zla ba phyed dang gnyis ni 'das so //
translated: If the Poṣadha is performed in the first summer month on the thirtieth day, one should say: “Venerable ones, one month and a half of the hot season has passed.

original: zla ba phyed ni lus so zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: zla ba phyed ni lus so zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: Half a month remains.”

original: dbyar zla 'bring po'i nya la 'don na ni 'di skad ces tshe dang ldan pa dag so ga rnams kyi zla ba gnyis ni 'das te /
analyzed: dbyar zla 'bring po'i nya la 'don na ni 'di skad ces tshe dang ldan pa dag so ga rnams kyi zla ba gnyis ni 'das te /
translated: If the Poṣadha is performed in the middle summer month on the full moon day, one should say: “Venerable ones, two months of the hot season have passed.

original: lhag ma ma lus so zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ma lus so zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: There is no remainder.”

original: de bzhin du dbyar gyi dus tshigs la yang gso sbyong 'don pa'i dus bzhi yod do //
analyzed: de bzhin du dbyar gyi dus tshigs la yang gso sbyong 'don pa'i dus bzhi yod do //
translated: In the same way, there are four times for performing the Poṣadha in the rainy season.

original: dbyar zla 'bring po'i gnam stong dang / dbyar zla tha chungs nya dang / dbyar zla tha chungs gnam stong dang / ston zla ra ba nya'o //
analyzed: dbyar zla 'bring po'i gnam stong dang / dbyar zla tha chungs nya dang / dbyar zla tha chungs gnam stong dang / ston zla ra ba nya'o //
translated: The first day of the middle summer month, the full moon of the last summer month, the first day of the last summer month, and the full moon of the first autumn month.

original: de la dbyar zla 'bring po'i gnam stong la 'don ni 'di skad ces tshe dang ldan pa dag dbyar rnams kyi zla ba phyed ni 'das so //
analyzed: de la dbyar zla 'bring po'i gnam stong la 'don ni 'di skad ces tshe dang ldan pa dag dbyar rnams kyi zla ba phyed ni 'das so //
translated: If the recitation is done on the first day of the middle summer month, it should be said like this: “Venerable ones, half of the rainy season has passed.

original: zla ba phye dang gnyis ni lus so zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: zla ba phye dang gnyis ni lus so zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: Two months remain.”

original: dbyar zla tha chungs nya la 'don na ni 'di skad ces tshe dang ldan pa dag dbyar rnams kyi zla ba gcig ni 'das so //
analyzed: dbyar zla tha chungs nya la 'don na ni 'di skad ces tshe dang ldan pa dag dbyar rnams kyi zla ba gcig ni 'das so //
translated: If the recitation is done on the full moon of the last summer month, it should be said like this: “Venerable ones, one month of the rainy season has passed.

translated: If one does not perform the poṣadha ceremony at the proper time, such as when there is danger, then one should recite the above mantras and add the number of days that have passed in the first or second month, whether it is the waxing or waning phase.🔽For example, one should say, “Venerables, one day of the waning phase of the first month of spring has passed.
