analyzed: de dag brjod par bya ba ni 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad la mkhas par bya ba dang / tshe'i dus las 'das pa sems la gzhag par bya ba dang / 'khor ba la skyo bar bya zhing dge ba la brtson par bya ba dang / gso sbyong gi nyi ma yongs su shes par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The purpose of counting the days is to be skilled in worldly conventions, to set one's mind on the time of death, to be disenchanted with cyclic existence and to strive for virtue, and to understand the purification day.

original: de dag brtsi ba ni dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan gyis zla ba ngo re zhing smyig ma'i thur ma bco lnga skud pa la brgyus pa nyin re bgrangs pas bgrang zhing /
analyzed: de dag brtsi ba ni dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan gyis zla ba ngo re zhing smyig ma'i thur ma bco lnga skud pa la brgyus pa nyin re bgrangs pas bgrang zhing /
translated: The counting is done by the elder of the saṅgha, who counts each day with a rosary of fifteen bamboo beads.

original: dge skos kyis gnas brtan la brtags la dge 'dun la nyi ma re re zhing brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: dge skos kyis gnas brtan la brtags la dge 'dun la nyi ma re re zhing brjod par bya'o //
translated: The duties officer should check the elder and inform the saṅgha each day.

original: zla ba shol dor ba ni rgyal po'i rjes su 'brang bas dor ro //
analyzed: zla ba shol dor ba ni rgyal po'i rjes su 'brang bas dor ro //
translated: The intercalary month is dropped in accordance with the king.

original: rgyu skar ni skar mkhan gyi rjes su 'brang bas shes par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu skar ni skar mkhan gyi rjes su 'brang bas shes par bya'o //
translated: The lunar mansions are to be understood in accordance with the astrologers.

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag rga ba dang 'chi ba dang mngon par 'ong zhing ston pa'i bstan pa yang 'jig par 'gyur bas tshe dang ldan dag gis bag yod @179b par rnal 'byor du bya'o zhes bya ba 'dis kyang 'khor bas skyo bar bya zhing dge ba la🔽brtson par bya ste /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag rga ba dang 'chi ba dang mngon par 'ong zhing ston pa'i bstan pa yang 'jig par 'gyur bas tshe dang ldan dag gis bag yod @179b par rnal 'byor du bya'o zhes bya ba 'dis kyang 'khor bas skyo bar bya zhing dge ba la brtson par bya ste /
translated: This passage also shows that you should be disenchanted with cyclic existence and strive in virtue.

original: de la 'dir 'khor bas skyo bar bya zhing dge ba la brtson par bya'i /
analyzed: de la 'dir 'khor bas skyo bar bya zhing dge ba la brtson par bya'i /
translated: Here, you should be disenchanted with cyclic existence and strive in virtue.

original: rgyu ci'i phyir rga ba dang 'chi ba mngon par 'ong ba dang ston pa'i bstan pa yang 'jig par 'gyur ba smos she na /
analyzed: rgyu ci'i phyir rga ba dang 'chi ba mngon par 'ong ba dang ston pa'i bstan pa yang 'jig par 'gyur ba smos she na /
translated: Why does the passage say, “Aging and death are coming and the teachings of the Teacher will be destroyed”?

original: tshangs par spyod pa'i rgyu'i gtso bo yongs su nyams par bstan pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: tshangs par spyod pa'i rgyu'i gtso bo yongs su nyams par bstan pa'i phyir te /
translated: It is taught in order to show the primary cause for the degeneration of pure conduct.

original: 'di ltar tshangs par spyod pa ni rnam pa gnyis kyis bsgrubs te /
analyzed: 'di ltar tshangs par spyod pa ni rnam pa gnyis kyis bsgrubs te /
translated: Pure conduct is accomplished in two ways:

original: lus dang / gnas kyis so //
analyzed: lus dang / gnas kyis so //
translated: through the body and through the mind.

original: de la lus kyis ni lus sbyor bzod pa dang / rgyun ma chad par tshangs par spyod pa bsgrubs te /
analyzed: de la lus kyis ni lus sbyor bzod pa dang / rgyun ma chad par tshangs par spyod pa bsgrubs te /
translated: Through the body, pure conduct is accomplished by being patient with physical hardship and by continuously practicing pure conduct.

original: de yongs su nyams par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de yongs su nyams par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate its complete degeneration, he says:

original: rga ba dang / 'chi ba mngon par 'ong zhing zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: rga ba dang / 'chi ba mngon par 'ong zhing zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: aging and death will manifest.

original: lus sbyor mi bzod pa dang / rgyun chad pas tshangs par spyod pa yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: lus sbyor mi bzod pa dang / rgyun chad pas tshangs par spyod pa yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba go rims bzhin no //
translated: The degeneration of pure conduct is due to the body becoming unfit for practice and the interruption of life, respectively.

original: srid pa'i yan lag gzhan dag dang mya ngan la sogs pa'i nyes dmigs dag ci'i phyir ma smos par rga shi nyi tshe smos she na //
analyzed: srid pa'i yan lag gzhan dag dang mya ngan la sogs pa'i nyes dmigs dag ci'i phyir ma smos par rga shi nyi tshe smos she na //
translated: Why is only aging and death mentioned, and not the other members of existence and the faults of sorrow, etc.?

original: lang tsho dang gson pas tshangs par spyod pa bsgrub cing /
analyzed: lang tsho dang gson pas tshangs par spyod pa bsgrub cing /
translated: Because youth and life are the causes for the practice of pure conduct,

original: rga ba dang 'chi bas de yongs su nyams pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba'i phyir rgyu'i gtso bo smos pas gzhan yang zhar la rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rga ba dang 'chi bas de yongs su nyams pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba'i phyir rgyu'i gtso bo smos pas gzhan yang zhar la rig par bya'o //
translated: and aging and death are the causes for its degeneration. Since the principal causes are mentioned, the others are understood by implication.

original: gnas kyi ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: gnas kyi ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is it the basis?

original: gnas zhes bya ba ni tshangs par spyod pa skye ba'i gnas su gyur pa sangs rgyas kyis bstan to //
analyzed: gnas zhes bya ba ni tshangs par spyod pa skye ba'i gnas su gyur pa sangs rgyas kyis bstan to //
translated: The basis is the basis for the arising of pure conduct, taught by the Buddha.

original: de yongs su nyams par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de yongs su nyams par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate its complete degeneration, he says:

original: ston pa'i bstan pa yang 'jig par 'gyur bas zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: ston pa'i bstan pa yang 'jig par 'gyur bas zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: The teaching of the Master will also perish means

original: ston pa'i bstan pa zhig na tshangs par spyod pa skye ba'i gnas med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ston pa'i bstan pa zhig na tshangs par spyod pa skye ba'i gnas med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: that when the teaching of the Master perishes, there is no basis for the arising of pure conduct.

original: ston pa zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das te /
analyzed: ston pa zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das te /
translated: The Master is the Blessed Buddha,

original: phyin ci ma log par ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyin ci ma log par ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he teaches without error.

original: de'i bstan pa zhes bya ba ni gsung rab tu gtogs pa yan lag bcu gnyis te /
analyzed: de'i bstan pa zhes bya ba ni gsung rab tu gtogs pa yan lag bcu gnyis te /
translated: The teaching of him is the twelve branches of the scriptures,

original: des slob ma rnams la ston par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des slob ma rnams la ston par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they teach disciples.

original: de 'jig par zhes bya ba ni sgrub pa yongs su nyams pas so //
analyzed: de 'jig par zhes bya ba ni sgrub pa yongs su nyams pas so //
translated: The perishing of it is the complete degeneration of practice.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar yin pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar yin pa de'i phyir /
translated: Because it is so, therefore,

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag gis bag yod pas rnal 'byor du bya'o zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag gis bag yod pas rnal 'byor du bya'o zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: the venerable ones should practice with heedfulness.

original: bag yod pa zhes smos pa ni rgyu'i dngos pos dge ba'i chos thams cad sdud par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bag yod pa zhes smos pa ni rgyu'i dngos pos dge ba'i chos thams cad sdud par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The mention of heedfulness is because it includes all virtuous dharmas by the principle of cause.

original: rnal 'byor du bya'o zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyis brtson par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rnal 'byor du bya'o zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyis brtson par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: One should practice means that one should strive by oneself.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to teach just that, he says:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi byang chub dang gzhan @180a * //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi byang chub dang gzhan @180a * //
translated: The enlightenment of the Tathagatas, the Arhats, the Perfectly Awakened Ones,

original: yang gang dag de lta bu dang mthun pa dge ba'i chos byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa rnams kyang bag yod pas 'thob bo zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: yang gang dag de lta bu dang mthun pa dge ba'i chos byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa rnams kyang bag yod pas 'thob bo zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: and also those other wholesome states that are conducive to enlightenment, are attained through heedfulness.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba ni don ji lta ba bzhin du thugs su chud pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba ni don ji lta ba bzhin du thugs su chud pa'o //
translated: Tathagatas means that they have understood the meaning just as it is.

original: dgra bcom pa zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i dgra rnams bcom pa'am mchod par 'os pa'o //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i dgra rnams bcom pa'am mchod par 'os pa'o //
translated: Arhats means that they have destroyed the enemy of the afflictions, or that they are worthy of worship.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dag la yang de yod pas de las khyad par du bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dag la yang de yod pas de las khyad par du bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Since that also exists for the Sravakas and Pratyekabuddhas, in order to teach their distinction, he says:

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Perfectly Awakened Ones.

original: ye shes phyin ci ma log par yang dag pa'i shes bya ma lus par rdzogs pa thugs su chud cing sangs rgyas pa gang la yod pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes phyin ci ma log par yang dag pa'i shes bya ma lus par rdzogs pa thugs su chud cing sangs rgyas pa gang la yod pa'o //
translated: It is that which has the perfect, unerring intuition of all objects of knowledge, and the enlightenment that is the realization of that.

original: de rnams kyi byang chub ces bya ba ni thugs su chud pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi byang chub ces bya ba ni thugs su chud pa'o //
translated: The word “enlightenment” here means realization.

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gzhan du brtags pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gzhan du brtags pa'o //
translated: “Moreover” means in another way.

original: gang dag ces bya ba ni dge ba'i chos zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: gang dag ces bya ba ni dge ba'i chos zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: “Those” refers to the wholesome dharmas.

original: de lta bu dang mthun pa zhes bya ba ni byang chub dang mthun pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bu dang mthun pa zhes bya ba ni byang chub dang mthun pa'o //
translated: “Such as these” means those that are conducive to enlightenment.

original: dge ba'i chos byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa rnams kyang zhes bya ba ni zad pa dang / mi skye ba shes pa'i mtshan nyid kyis byang chub skyed par byed pa'i chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa dag ste /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa rnams kyang zhes bya ba ni zad pa dang / mi skye ba shes pa'i mtshan nyid kyis byang chub skyed par byed pa'i chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa dag ste /
translated: “The wholesome dharmas that are conducive to enlightenment” are the dharmas that produce enlightenment, such as the applications of mindfulness, etc., which are characterized by the knowledge of destruction and the knowledge of non-arising.

original: de dag kyang bag yod pas 'thob po zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de dag kyang bag yod pas 'thob po zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “They are attained through heedfulness” means that they are attained through heedfulness.

original: de ltar skabs de dag gis ni so sor thar pa nyan pa la rna mi gtod na tshe'i dus 'das pa dang / rga shi mngon par 'ong ba dang / ston pa'i bstan pa 'jig par 'gyur ba'i nyes dmigs yod pas so sor thar pa nyan pa la rna gtod cing bag yod pas dge ba'i chos la brtson par bya'o zhes bya ba'i sgo nas so sor thar pa la rna mi gtod pa'i nyes dmigs bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar skabs de dag gis ni so sor thar pa nyan pa la rna mi gtod na tshe'i dus 'das pa dang / rga shi mngon par 'ong ba dang / ston pa'i bstan pa 'jig par 'gyur ba'i nyes dmigs yod pas so sor thar pa nyan pa la rna gtod cing bag yod pas dge ba'i chos la brtson par bya'o zhes bya ba'i sgo nas so sor thar pa la rna mi gtod pa'i nyes dmigs bstan to //
translated: Thus, these passages teach the fault of not paying attention to listening to the pratimoksha, because there is the danger of dying, of old age and death manifesting, and of the Teacher's doctrine being destroyed. Therefore, one should pay attention to listening to the pratimoksha and strive for virtuous dharmas with heedfulness.

original: mi 'du ba dgag pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: mi 'du ba dgag pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: With regard to preventing non-gathering,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi nyan thos kyi dge 'dun ni don nyung ba bya ba nyung ba yin pas dge 'dun gyi thog mar bya ba ci yod ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi nyan thos kyi dge 'dun ni don nyung ba bya ba nyung ba yin pas dge 'dun gyi thog mar bya ba ci yod ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: the Blessed One said, The Sangha of the Blessed One's Hearers has little purpose and few activities, so what is the Sangha's first activity? and so on.

original: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba ni bdud bzhi bcom pa dang legs pa'i yon tan drug dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba ni bdud bzhi bcom pa dang legs pa'i yon tan drug dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Blessed One means one who has conquered the four maras and possesses the six excellent qualities.

original: nyan thos zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu ji ltar thob pa sgrogs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: nyan thos zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu ji ltar thob pa sgrogs par byed pa'o //
translated: The term “disciple” refers to one who proclaims the result that has been attained.

original: dge 'dun zhes bya ba ni de dag gi tshogs te /
analyzed: dge 'dun zhes bya ba ni de dag gi tshogs te /
translated: The term “saṅgha” refers to the collection of those disciples.

original: mi phyed pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: mi phyed pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: It is called a “saṅgha” because it is not divided.

original: don nyung ba zhes bya ba ni yid kyis so //
analyzed: don nyung ba zhes bya ba ni yid kyis so //
translated: The phrase “with few concerns” refers to the mind.

original: bya ba nyung ba zhes bya ba ni lus dang ngag gnyis so //
analyzed: bya ba nyung ba zhes bya ba ni lus dang ngag gnyis so //
translated: The phrase “with few activities” refers to the body and speech.

original: dge 'dun gyi thog mar bya ba ci yod ces bya ba ni dgag pa ste /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi thog mar bya ba ci yod ces bya ba ni dgag pa ste /
translated: The phrase “what business does the saṅgha have at the beginning of the poṣadha ceremony?” is a prohibition.

original: gang gi phyir bcom ldan @180b 'das kyi nyan thos kyi dge 'dun don nyung ba bya ba nyung ba de yin pas de'i phyir dge 'dun la gso sbyong gi dus su 'du zhing 'dun pa dang yongs su dag par brjod par bya ba las gzhan pa'i thog mar
analyzed: gang gi phyir bcom ldan @180b 'das kyi nyan thos kyi dge 'dun don nyung ba bya ba nyung ba de yin pas de'i phyir dge 'dun la gso sbyong gi dus su 'du zhing 'dun pa dang yongs su dag par brjod par bya ba las gzhan pa'i thog mar
translated: Since the saṅgha of disciples of the Blessed One has few concerns and few activities, therefore, at the time of the poṣadha ceremony, the saṅgha should gather together and declare its purity.

original: bya ba ci yod de /
analyzed: bya ba ci yod de /
translated: What business does it have at the beginning of the poṣadha ceremony?

original: ci yang med kyis thams cad du 'dus shig ces bya ba med par dgag pa'i sgo nas mi 'du ba dgag pa bstan to //
analyzed: ci yang med kyis thams cad du 'dus shig ces bya ba med par dgag pa'i sgo nas mi 'du ba dgag pa bstan to //
translated: None at all. Therefore, the prohibition against not gathering together is taught by means of a negative statement: “Gather together in every way!”

original: yang na dge 'dun gyi thog mar bya ba ci yod ces bya ba ni dri ba ste /
analyzed: yang na dge 'dun gyi thog mar bya ba ci yod ces bya ba ni dri ba ste /
translated: Or else, what is the first business of the Saṅgha?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi nyan thos kyi dge 'dun don nyung ba bya ba nyung ba yin pas de'i phyir /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi nyan thos kyi dge 'dun don nyung ba bya ba nyung ba yin pas de'i phyir /
translated: This is a question, because the Bhagavān’s śrāvaka Saṅgha has little purpose and little business.

original: dge 'dun la gso sbyong gi dus su 'du ba'i tshe /
analyzed: dge 'dun la gso sbyong gi dus su 'du ba'i tshe /
translated: Therefore, when the Saṅgha gathers at the time of the poṣadha purification,

original: gang byas nas mi mthun pa nyid kyis 'du bar mi 'gyur ba'i thog mar bya ba ci yod ces dris pa'o //
analyzed: gang byas nas mi mthun pa nyid kyis 'du bar mi 'gyur ba'i thog mar bya ba ci yod ces dris pa'o //
translated: what is the first business that should be done so that they do not gather due to disagreement?

original: de'i lan gdab pa'i tshig tu /
analyzed: de'i lan gdab pa'i tshig tu /
translated: The answer to that is stated:

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag ma lhags pa rnams la 'dun pa dang yongs su dag pa dris shig dris nas kyang brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag ma lhags pa rnams la 'dun pa dang yongs su dag pa dris shig dris nas kyang brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: “Venerable ones, ask those who have not come about their intention and purity. Having asked, you should announce it.”

original: ma lhags pa rnams la zhes bya ba ni mthun pa'i gso sbyong rnams pa lnga po bcu bzhi pa dang / bco lnga pa dang / bkra shis kyi gso sbyong dang / gnod pa byung ba'i gso sbyong dang / bsdum pa'i gso sbyong dag las gang byed kyang rung ste /🔽de'i dus su mtshams kyi nang na dpe /
analyzed: ma lhags pa rnams la zhes bya ba ni mthun pa'i gso sbyong rnams pa lnga po bcu bzhi pa dang / bco lnga pa dang / bkra shis kyi gso sbyong dang / gnod pa byung ba'i gso sbyong dang / bsdum pa'i gso sbyong dag las gang byed kyang rung ste / de'i dus su mtshams kyi nang na dpe /
translated: Those who are not present refers to the five types of compatible poṣadhas: the fourteenth, the fifteenth, the auspicious poṣadha, the poṣadha of those who have been harmed and the poṣadha of reconciliation.🔽At the time of any of these, all those who are present within the boundaries of the monastery who are worthy of being counted in the saṅgha’s quorum for the poṣadha should gather in the place of the poṣadha.

original: slong gi dge 'dun gyi kha bskang bar 'os pa ji snyed 'khod pa thams cad gso sbyong gi gnas su 'du bar bya ba yin pa las de dag gi nang nas mi 'du bar gnang ba dang / dbang med pa dang / srog gi bar chad dang /
analyzed: slong gi dge 'dun gyi kha bskang bar 'os pa ji snyed 'khod pa thams cad gso sbyong gi gnas su 'du bar bya ba yin pa las de dag gi nang nas mi 'du bar gnang ba dang / dbang med pa dang / srog gi bar chad dang /
translated: Those who are not present are those who have been granted permission not to attend, those who are powerless, those who are in danger of dying,

original: tshangs par spyod pa'i bar chad kyis 'jigs pa gang gi so sbyong gi gnas su ma lhags pa rnams so //
analyzed: tshangs par spyod pa'i bar chad kyis 'jigs pa gang gi so sbyong gi gnas su ma lhags pa rnams so //
translated: and those who are in danger of losing their celibacy.

original: mi 'du bar gnang ba de dag las ma gtogs pa gzhan ni mtshams kyi nang na 'dug na gso sbyong gi gnas su mi 'dur mi rung ste /
analyzed: mi 'du bar gnang ba de dag las ma gtogs pa gzhan ni mtshams kyi nang na 'dug na gso sbyong gi gnas su mi 'dur mi rung ste /
translated: Except for those who are permitted not to attend, it is improper for others who are within the boundaries of the monastery not to attend the confession ceremony.

original: mi 'du na thams cad du rang la nyes byas dang / dge 'dun gyi las mi 'chags par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi 'du na thams cad du rang la nyes byas dang / dge 'dun gyi las mi 'chags par 'gyur ro //
translated: If they do not attend, they commit an offense and the saṅgha’s activities will not be accomplished.

original: 'dun pa dang yongs su dag pa dris shig ces bya ba la /
analyzed: 'dun pa dang yongs su dag pa dris shig ces bya ba la /
translated: The expression “ask about consent and purity” means

original: 'dun pa dri ba ni las mi mthun pa dag mi bya ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'dun pa dri ba ni las mi mthun pa dag mi bya ba'i phyir te /
translated: to ask about consent in order to prevent those who are not in agreement from acting.

original: mi mthun pa rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: mi mthun pa rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two types of disagreement:

original: 'dus pa rjes su ma zhugs pa nyid dang / phyir zlog par byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'dus pa rjes su ma zhugs pa nyid dang / phyir zlog par byed pa'o //
translated: not participating in the assembly and opposing the assembly.

original: de la 'dus pa rjes su zhugs pa ni dge slong las de'i mtshams kyi khongs su gtogs pa tshogs kyi kha skong bar 'os pa lus sam 'dun pas dge 'dun 'dus pa'i nang du rjes su ma zhugs pas /
analyzed: de la 'dus pa rjes su zhugs pa ni dge slong las de'i mtshams kyi khongs su gtogs pa tshogs kyi kha skong bar 'os pa lus sam 'dun pas dge 'dun 'dus pa'i nang du rjes su ma zhugs pas /
translated: Not participating in the assembly means that a monk who is included within the boundaries of the monastery and who is suitable to be counted in the assembly does not participate in the assembly either physically or by expressing his consent.

original: mi mthun pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: mi mthun pa nyid yin no //
translated: This is disagreement.

original: phyir zlog par byed pa ni dge slong las de'i mtshams khongs su gtogs pa rang bzhin @181a * //🔽du gnas pa /🔽spyod lam las ma nyams pa /🔽ngag yang dag par sdom pa /🔽'dul ba'i bya ba mngon par shes la /
analyzed: phyir zlog par byed pa ni dge slong las de'i mtshams khongs su gtogs pa rang bzhin @181a * // du gnas pa / spyod lam las ma nyams pa / ngag yang dag par sdom pa / 'dul ba'i bya ba mngon par shes la /
translated: One who turns back is a fully ordained monk who is within the boundary of that action, who naturally🔽remains,🔽who has not lost his deportment,🔽who is restrained in speech,🔽and who is skilled in the activities of the Vinaya.🔽

original: zhe 'gras pa med pas las gzhan byed pa chos dang mi ldan pa'i phyir zlog par byed na mi mthun pa nyid yin pa'o //
analyzed: zhe 'gras pa med pas las gzhan byed pa chos dang mi ldan pa'i phyir zlog par byed na mi mthun pa nyid yin pa'o //
translated: If one who is not a monk, or one who is a monk but not in the same monastic boundary, or one who is in the same boundary but not present, or one who is present but not in good standing, or one who is in good standing but not in the proper posture, or one who is in the proper posture but has not restrained speech, or one who has restrained speech but does not understand the procedures of the monastic code, or one who understands the procedures of the monastic code but is hostile, reverses the action of a monk, then it is not in accord with the Dharma.

original: de bas na mi mthun pa de gnyis bsal ba'i phyir ni ma lhag pa rnams ni 'dun pa dri bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na mi mthun pa de gnyis bsal ba'i phyir ni ma lhag pa rnams ni 'dun pa dri bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, in order to eliminate these two disagreements, the absent monks should be asked about their consent.

original: yongs su dag pa dri ba ni ma lhags pa gang dag gi 'dun pa phul bde dag snod du 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yongs su dag pa dri ba ni ma lhags pa gang dag gi 'dun pa phul bde dag snod du 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The question about purity is for the absent monks who have offered their consent to become suitable recipients.

original: de la cho ga ni dge skos kyis gso sbyong gi tshe tshul shing brims pas dge slong rnams bgrang zhing ma lhags pa dngos su yod dam ;
analyzed: de la cho ga ni dge skos kyis gso sbyong gi tshe tshul shing brims pas dge slong rnams bgrang zhing ma lhags pa dngos su yod dam ;
translated: In this case, the procedure is that the duties of the purification ceremony are performed by the senior monk. The voting sticks are distributed and the monks count. If there are any absent monks, they are counted as present.

original: glo bur du 'ongs pa la sogs pa yod par 'phrigs na gso sbyong de nyid la dge 'dun thams cad las kyi gnas su tshogs pas 'dun pa dang / yongs su dag pa lan pa'i dge slong chos lnga dang ldan pa gcig gam gnyis sam gsum tshig gis bsko bar bya zhing /
analyzed: glo bur du 'ongs pa la sogs pa yod par 'phrigs na gso sbyong de nyid la dge 'dun thams cad las kyi gnas su tshogs pas 'dun pa dang / yongs su dag pa lan pa'i dge slong chos lnga dang ldan pa gcig gam gnyis sam gsum tshig gis bsko bar bya zhing /
translated: One, two, or three fully ordained monks who are pure and possess the five qualities are appointed by the saṃgha.

original: des btsal ba dang / bod pa dang ; mthon por 'dug ste phyogs su blta ba la sogs pa dag gis bsam pa thag pa nas mtshams kyi nang btsal te /
analyzed: des btsal ba dang / bod pa dang ; mthon por 'dug ste phyogs su blta ba la sogs pa dag gis bsam pa thag pa nas mtshams kyi nang btsal te /
translated: They search for those who have not arrived, ask about those who have arrived, and look in the directions from a high place and so on.

original: ma lhags pa rnams la deng dge 'dun gso sbyong mdzad nas /
analyzed: ma lhags pa rnams la deng dge 'dun gso sbyong mdzad nas /
translated: They search within the boundaries with a sincere mind.

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag 'dun pa 'bul lam bar chad kyi chos rnams yongs su dag gam zhes dri bar bya'o //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag 'dun pa 'bul lam bar chad kyi chos rnams yongs su dag gam zhes dri bar bya'o //
translated: They ask, “Venerables, have you offered your consent? Are you pure with regard to the conditions that are obstacles?”

original: ma lhags pa rnams kyis de la 'dun pa dang yongs su dag pa dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: ma lhags pa rnams kyis de la 'dun pa dang yongs su dag pa dbul bar bya'o //
translated: Those who have not arrived offer their consent and purity to them.

original: dge slong 'dun pa dang yongs su dag pa 'bul bar byed pa'i kun du spyad pa'i chos 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dge slong 'dun pa dang yongs su dag pa 'bul bar byed pa'i kun du spyad pa'i chos 'di lta ste /
translated: The monk who is offering his consent and purity should perform the following acts of service:

original: dge slong 'dun pa dang yongs su dag pa 'bul bar byed pas mchil lham gnyis phud nas bla gos phrag pa gcig tu byas te rgan pa la phyag btsal nas /
analyzed: dge slong 'dun pa dang yongs su dag pa 'bul bar byed pas mchil lham gnyis phud nas bla gos phrag pa gcig tu byas te rgan pa la phyag btsal nas /
translated: He should remove his two sandals, put his upper robe over one shoulder, bow down to the elder,

original: tsog tsog por 'dug ste thal mo sbyar nas 'di skad ces brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: tsog tsog por 'dug ste thal mo sbyar nas 'di skad ces brjod par bya'o //
translated: sit in the kneeling position with palms together, and say the following:

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag dgongs su gsol /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag dgongs su gsol /
translated: “Venerables, please listen!

original: deng dge 'dun gyi gso sbyong bco lnga pa lags pas bdag dge slong bro 'tshal ba sdug bsngal ba bro tshabs che ba ming 'di zhes bgyi ba'i gso sbyong yang bco lnga pa lags te /
analyzed: deng dge 'dun gyi gso sbyong bco lnga pa lags pas bdag dge slong bro 'tshal ba sdug bsngal ba bro tshabs che ba ming 'di zhes bgyi ba'i gso sbyong yang bco lnga pa lags te /
translated: Today is the fifteenth poṣadha of the saṅgha, and it is also the fifteenth poṣadha of the monk so-and-so, who is sick, suffering, and very ill.

original: bdag dge slong bro 'tshal ba sdug bsngal ba bro tshabs che ba ming 'di zhes bya ba'i bar chad kyi chos rnams yongs su dag go zhes bdag mchi /
analyzed: bdag dge slong bro 'tshal ba sdug bsngal ba bro tshabs che ba ming 'di zhes bya ba'i bar chad kyi chos rnams yongs su dag go zhes bdag mchi /
translated: I declare that the monk so-and-so, who is sick, suffering, and very ill, is pure with regard to the matters that create obstacles.”

original: dge 'dun chos bzhin du mdzad pa la 'dun pa 'bul lo //
analyzed: dge 'dun chos bzhin du mdzad pa la 'dun pa 'bul lo //
translated: I offer my assent to the Saṅgha acting in accordance with the Dharma.

original: bdag gi gso sbyong yongs su dag go //
analyzed: bdag gi gso sbyong yongs su dag go //
translated: I am purified by the Poṣadha.

original: 'dun pa dang yongs su @181b dag pa yang bco lnga'o //
analyzed: 'dun pa dang yongs su @181b dag pa yang bco lnga'o //
translated: The offering of assent and the purification are the fifteenth.

original: brjod pa yang rig par bgyid do zhes lan gsum bzlas shing de'i rjes la len pa pos thabs yin no zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: brjod pa yang rig par bgyid do zhes lan gsum bzlas shing de'i rjes la len pa pos thabs yin no zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: The one who is offering the Poṣadha should say, ‘I announce it,’ three times. After that, the one who is receiving it should say, ‘It is suitable.’

original: 'bul bas ni legs so zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'bul bas ni legs so zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: The one who is offering it should say, ‘It is good.’

original: 'dun pa dang yongs su dag pa snga phyir blang zhing snga phyir 'bul du yang rung ste /
analyzed: 'dun pa dang yongs su dag pa snga phyir blang zhing snga phyir 'bul du yang rung ste /
translated: It is suitable to offer the assent and the purification either before or after.

original: sngags kyi bye brag ni 'dun pa dang yongs su dag pa gang 'bul ba de nyi tshe'i ming smos te lan gsum bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: sngags kyi bye brag ni 'dun pa dang yongs su dag pa gang 'bul ba de nyi tshe'i ming smos te lan gsum bzlas par bya'o //
translated: The difference in the mantra is that the name of the one who is offering the assent and the purification should be mentioned three times.

original: dge slong 'dun pa dang yongs su dag par 'bul bar byed pas gal te brjod mi nus na lus sam ngag gam lus dang ngag rnam par rig byed kyis 'dun pa dang yongs su dag pa phul bar brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong 'dun pa dang yongs su dag par 'bul bar byed pas gal te brjod mi nus na lus sam ngag gam lus dang ngag rnam par rig byed kyis 'dun pa dang yongs su dag pa phul bar brjod par bya'o //
translated: The bhikṣu who is offering the assent and the purification should, if he is unable to speak, offer the assent and the purification by means of his body, his speech, or his body and speech.

original: lus sam dag gam lus dang ngag gi rnam par rig byed kyis 'dun pa 'bul bar byed pa mi nus na /
analyzed: lus sam dag gam lus dang ngag gi rnam par rig byed kyis 'dun pa 'bul bar byed pa mi nus na /
translated: If he is unable to make his declaration of purity by body, speech, or the intimation of a physical action,

original: dge 'dun thams cad der dong zhing gso sbyong bya ba'am /
analyzed: dge 'dun thams cad der dong zhing gso sbyong bya ba'am /
translated: then the entire saṅgha should go to him and perform the poṣadha ceremony.

original: yang na dge slong de dge 'dun gyi nang du blangs te gso sbyong bya'o //
analyzed: yang na dge slong de dge 'dun gyi nang du blangs te gso sbyong bya'o //
translated: Or that bhikṣu should be brought into the midst of the saṅgha and the poṣadha ceremony performed.

original: dge slong 'dun pa dang yongs su dag pa lan pa'i kun du spyod pa'i chos ni 'di ltar bya ste /
analyzed: dge slong 'dun pa dang yongs su dag pa lan pa'i kun du spyod pa'i chos ni 'di ltar bya ste /
translated: “The regular duties of the bhikṣus who are the proclaimers and the purifiers are as follows:

original: dge slong 'dun pa dang yongs su dag pa legs pas yongs su dag pa blangs nas rgyug par mi bya /
analyzed: dge slong 'dun pa dang yongs su dag pa legs pas yongs su dag pa blangs nas rgyug par mi bya /
translated: ‘The bhikṣus who are the proclaimers and the purifiers, having accepted the purity, should not run,

original: mgyogs par mi bya /
analyzed: mgyogs par mi bya /
translated: should not be hasty,

original: mchong bar mi bya /🔽phyi rol la mchod bar mi bya /🔽'obs la mchod par mi bya /
analyzed: mchong bar mi bya / phyi rol la mchod bar mi bya / 'obs la mchod par mi bya /
translated: should not jump,🔽should not jump over an enclosure,🔽should not jump over a moat,

original: bang rim la mchong bar mi bya ;
analyzed: bang rim la mchong bar mi bya ;
translated: should not jump over a terrace,

original: steng gi nam mkha' la 'dug par mi bya /
analyzed: steng gi nam mkha' la 'dug par mi bya /
translated: should not sit in the sky above,

original: mtshams kyi phyi rol du 'gro bar mi bya /
analyzed: mtshams kyi phyi rol du 'gro bar mi bya /
translated: should not go outside the boundary,

original: gom pa gcig gis skas kyi rim pa gnyis thod rgal du 'dzeg par mi bya /
analyzed: gom pa gcig gis skas kyi rim pa gnyis thod rgal du 'dzeg par mi bya /
translated: and should not ascend two steps of a staircase in one step.

original: gom pa gcig gis them skas gnyis la thod rgal du 'dzeg par mi bya /
analyzed: gom pa gcig gis them skas gnyis la thod rgal du 'dzeg par mi bya /
translated: Do not skip two steps at a time.

original: chu lkog ma nu btsam la 'bogs par mi bya /
analyzed: chu lkog ma nu btsam la 'bogs par mi bya /
translated: Do not drink water up to the throat.

original: gnyid log par mi bya /
analyzed: gnyid log par mi bya /
translated: Do not fall asleep.

original: snyoms par 'jug par mi bya bar dge 'dun gyi nang du 'jug par bya'o //
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug par mi bya bar dge 'dun gyi nang du 'jug par bya'o //
translated: Do not enter into meditative absorption.🔽Having asked, one should announce.

original: dris nas kyang brjod par bya'o zhes bya bas ni de ltar 'dun pa dang yongs su dag pa len pa des de blangs te gso sbyong gi gnas su phyin nas dge slong ngam dge 'dun la brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: dris nas kyang brjod par bya'o zhes bya bas ni de ltar 'dun pa dang yongs su dag pa len pa des de blangs te gso sbyong gi gnas su phyin nas dge slong ngam dge 'dun la brjod par bya'o //
translated: Having taken up the intention and the purity in that way, having taken it up, having gone to the place of purification, one should announce it to the monk or the Saṅgha.🔽The rite and the mantra for announcing it is as follows.

original: de brjod pa'i cho ga dang sngags ni so sor thar pa'i mdo 'don pas seng ge'i khri la ma 'dug pa'i mdun rol du dge 'dun thams cad gso sbyong gi gnas su stan lam 'dug pa na gang gi tshe dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan gyis tshe dang ldan
analyzed: de brjod pa'i cho ga dang sngags ni so sor thar pa'i mdo 'don pas seng ge'i khri la ma 'dug pa'i mdun rol du dge 'dun thams cad gso sbyong gi gnas su stan lam 'dug pa na gang gi tshe dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan gyis tshe dang ldan
translated: When the elder of the Saṅgha, having sat down on the lion throne in front of the recitation of the Prātimokṣa Sūtra, all the Saṅgha having sat down on the path of the place of purification, at that time the elder of the Saṅgha says, “Venerable

original: pa dag ma lhags pa rnams kyi 'dun pa dang yongs su dag pa brjod cig /
analyzed: pa dag ma lhags pa rnams kyi 'dun pa dang yongs su dag pa brjod cig /
translated: ones, please announce the intention and the purity of those who have not come.

original: brjod pa yang rig par gyis shig @182a * //
analyzed: brjod pa yang rig par gyis shig @182a * //
translated: And you should also know the announcement.

original: ces smras pa'i tshe des dge slong ngam yang na dge 'dun la de'i 'dun pa dang yongs su dag pa cig car du dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: ces smras pa'i tshe des dge slong ngam yang na dge 'dun la de'i 'dun pa dang yongs su dag pa cig car du dbul bar bya'o //
translated: When he says this, he should offer his intention and his purification to the monk or to the Saṅgha all at once.

original: dge slong la dbul na ni des dge slong drung na 'dug pa'i mdun du 'dug ste 'di skad ces brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong la dbul na ni des dge slong drung na 'dug pa'i mdun du 'dug ste 'di skad ces brjod par bya'o //
translated: If he is offering to the monk, he should sit in the presence of the monk and say this:

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag dgongs su gsol /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag dgongs su gsol /

original: deng dge 'dun gyi gso sbyong bco lnga pa lags la /
analyzed: deng dge 'dun gyi gso sbyong bco lnga pa lags la /
translated: Today is the fifteenth day of the confession ceremony for the Saṅgha.

original: gnas ga ge mo zhig na dge slong bro 'tshal ba sdug bsngal ba bro tshabs che ba ming 'di zhes bgyi ba'i gso sbyong yang bco lnga pa lags te /
analyzed: gnas ga ge mo zhig na dge slong bro 'tshal ba sdug bsngal ba bro tshabs che ba ming 'di zhes bgyi ba'i gso sbyong yang bco lnga pa lags te /
translated: In such-and-such a place, the monk so-and-so, who is sick, suffering, and very ill, also has the fifteenth day of the confession ceremony.

original: gnas ga ge mo zhig na dge slong bro 'tshal ba sdug bsngal ba bro tshabs che ba ming 'di zhes bgyi bde bar chad kyi chos rnams yongs su dag go zhes kho na nyid mchi'o //
analyzed: gnas ga ge mo zhig na dge slong bro 'tshal ba sdug bsngal ba bro tshabs che ba ming 'di zhes bgyi bde bar chad kyi chos rnams yongs su dag go zhes kho na nyid mchi'o //
translated: In such-and-such a place, the monk so-and-so, who is sick, suffering, and very ill, says that he is pure with regard to offenses that require rehabilitation.”

original: dge 'dun chos bzhin du mdzad pa la 'dun pa 'bul lo //
analyzed: dge 'dun chos bzhin du mdzad pa la 'dun pa 'bul lo //
translated: I offer my assent to the Saṅgha’s observance of the purification ritual in accordance with the Dharma.

original: de'i gso sbyong yang yongs su dag go //🔽'dun pa dang yongs su dag pa yang brjod do //
analyzed: de'i gso sbyong yang yongs su dag go // 'dun pa dang yongs su dag pa yang brjod do //
translated: His observance of the purification ritual is pure.🔽I have announced his assent and purity.

original: brjod pa yang rig par bgyid do zhes lan gsum du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: brjod pa yang rig par bgyid do zhes lan gsum du brjod par bya'o //
translated: I have made it known.”

analyzed: dge 'dun la 'dun pa 'bul na ni des dge 'dun gyi dbus su rgan pa'i mthar 'greng ste /
translated: If he is offering his assent to the Saṅgha, he should stand in the midst of the Saṅgha, in the presence of the most senior monk,

original: 'dud pa dang bcas pas 'di skad ces brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dud pa dang bcas pas 'di skad ces brjod par bya'o //
translated: and say this, with humility:

original: dge 'dun btsun pa rnams gsan du gsol /
analyzed: dge 'dun btsun pa rnams gsan du gsol /
translated: “Venerable Saṅgha, please listen!

original: deng dge 'dun gyi gso sbyong bco lnga pa lags la /
analyzed: deng dge 'dun gyi gso sbyong bco lnga pa lags la /
translated: Today is the fifteenth observance day for the Saṅgha.

original: gnas ga ge mo zhig na dge slong bro 'tshal ba sdug bsngal ba bro tshabs che ba ming 'di zhes bgyi ba'i gso sbyong yang bco lnga pa lags te /
analyzed: gnas ga ge mo zhig na dge slong bro 'tshal ba sdug bsngal ba bro tshabs che ba ming 'di zhes bgyi ba'i gso sbyong yang bco lnga pa lags te /
translated: In such-and-such a place, the monk named so-and-so, who is sick, suffering, and gravely ill, also has the fifteenth observance day.

original: gnas ga ge mo zhig na dge slong bro 'tshal ba /
analyzed: gnas ga ge mo zhig na dge slong bro 'tshal ba /
translated: In such-and-such a place, the monk named so-and-so, who is sick,

original: sdug bsngal ba /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba /
translated: suffering,🔽and gravely ill,

original: bro tshabs che ba ming 'di zhes bgyi ba de'i bar chad kyi chos rnams yongs su dag go zhes kho na nyid mchi'o //
analyzed: bro tshabs che ba ming 'di zhes bgyi ba de'i bar chad kyi chos rnams yongs su dag go zhes kho na nyid mchi'o //
translated: The one named so-and-so, who is sick, says, I am completely purified of the dharma of obstacles.

original: dge 'dun chos bzhin du mdzad pa la 'dun pa 'bul lo //
analyzed: dge 'dun chos bzhin du mdzad pa la 'dun pa 'bul lo //
translated: I offer my assent to the Saṅgha acting in accordance with the dharma.

original: de'i gso sbyong yang yongs su dag go //🔽'dun pa dang yongs su dag pa yang brjod do //
analyzed: de'i gso sbyong yang yongs su dag go // 'dun pa dang yongs su dag pa yang brjod do //
translated: His Poṣadha is also completely purified.🔽 I announce the assent and the complete purification.

original: brjod pa yang rig par bgyid do zhes 'an gcig brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: brjod pa yang rig par bgyid do zhes 'an gcig brjod par bya'o //
translated: I will announce the announcement.

original: dge 'dun gyis kyang de dang du blang bar bya ste /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyis kyang de dang du blang bar bya ste /
translated: The Saṅgha should also accept that.

original: des na 'dun pa phu lu bas ni dge 'dun gyi las mi mthun par mi 'gyur ba yongs su dag pa phul bas ni gang zag ma lhags pa bdag nyid snod du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na 'dun pa phu lu bas ni dge 'dun gyi las mi mthun par mi 'gyur ba yongs su dag pa phul bas ni gang zag ma lhags pa bdag nyid snod du 'gyur ro //
translated: By that, the assent is not in conflict with the Saṅgha's action. By offering the complete purification, the absent person becomes a suitable vessel.

original: len pa de dge 'dun gyi nang du ma phyin par shi'am khyim par dam bcas pa la sogs par gyur na ma blangs pa nyid yin pas yang blangs par bya'o //
analyzed: len pa de dge 'dun gyi nang du ma phyin par shi'am khyim par dam bcas pa la sogs par gyur na ma blangs pa nyid yin pas yang blangs par bya'o //
translated: If the receiver dies or becomes a layperson before entering the Saṅgha, it is not accepted, so it should be accepted again.

original: phyin na ma brjod kyang blangs pa nyid yin pas yang blang mi dgos so //
analyzed: phyin na ma brjod kyang blangs pa nyid yin pas yang blang mi dgos so //
translated: If one has gone, then even if one has not recited, one has taken it, so it is not necessary to take it again.

original: mi 'du ba dgag pa bshad zin to //
analyzed: mi 'du ba dgag pa bshad zin to //
translated: The prohibition against not gathering has been explained.

original: mchod cing @182b lung 'bogs pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: mchod cing @182b lung 'bogs pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: With regard to the authority of worship and recitation,

original: sh'akya seng ge dal ni //
analyzed: sh'akya seng ge dal ni //
translated: the Lion of the Shakyas

original: sen mo bcu yis thal sbyar te //
analyzed: sen mo bcu yis thal sbyar te //

original: so sor thar pa gdon par bya //
analyzed: so sor thar pa gdon par bya //
translated: should recite the Pratimoksha.

original: gdul ba'i don du nga las nyon //
analyzed: gdul ba'i don du nga las nyon //
translated: Listen to me for the sake of taming!

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Thus it is said.

original: sh'akya seng ge zhes bya ba ni gdung rgyud de /
analyzed: sh'akya seng ge zhes bya ba ni gdung rgyud de /
translated: The Lion of the Shakyas is the lineage.

original: des ni khyim pa'i phyogs kyi rigs rnam par dag pa bstan to //
analyzed: des ni khyim pa'i phyogs kyi rigs rnam par dag pa bstan to //
translated: By that, the purity of the lineage of the householder side is taught.

original: seng ge zhes bya ba ni yon tan te /
analyzed: seng ge zhes bya ba ni yon tan te /

original: des ni rab tu byung ba'i phyogs kyi mkhyen pa rnam par dag pa bstan to //
analyzed: des ni rab tu byung ba'i phyogs kyi mkhyen pa rnam par dag pa bstan to //
translated: By that, the purity of the knowledge of the ordained side is taught.

original: mi bsnyengs pa dag gis mu stegs can gyi ri dags skrag par mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi bsnyengs pa dag gis mu stegs can gyi ri dags skrag par mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he frightens the non-Buddhist deer with his fearlessness.

analyzed: sen mo bcu zhes bya ba ni sor mo bcu mtshon par byed do //

original: de dag gis mchod pa bstan to //
analyzed: de dag gis mchod pa bstan to //

analyzed: thal mo sbyar te ci zhig bya zhe na / so sor thar pa gdon par byas //
translated: What is done with palms joined?

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: The Prātimokṣa should be recited.

original: so sor thar pa'i mdo 'don pa rnam pa lnga po //
analyzed: so sor thar pa'i mdo 'don pa rnam pa lnga po //
translated: The five types of recitation of the Prātimokṣa Sūtra

original: gleng gzhi gdon pa dang / pham par 'gyur ba gdon pa dang / dge 'dun lhag ma gdon pa dang / ma nges pa gdon pa dang / ril gyis gdon pa dag gdon par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gleng gzhi gdon pa dang / pham par 'gyur ba gdon pa dang / dge 'dun lhag ma gdon pa dang / ma nges pa gdon pa dang / ril gyis gdon pa dag gdon par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: are the recitation of the nidāna, the recitation of the pārājikas, the recitation of the saṃghāvaśeṣas, the recitation of the undetermined matters, and the recitation of the entire text.

original: gdul ba'i don du nga las nyon //
analyzed: gdul ba'i don du nga las nyon //
translated: Listen to me for the sake of taming.

original: zhes bya ba ni slob ma rnams gdul ba'i don du ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni slob ma rnams gdul ba'i don du ste /
translated: This means for the sake of taming the disciples.

original: yang dag par sdud par byed pa ste /
analyzed: yang dag par sdud par byed pa ste /
translated: The one who collects properly,

analyzed: so sor thar pa gdon pa la nyon cig ces bya bar sbyar ro de dag gis lung 'bogs pa bstan to //
translated: saying Listen to the recitation of the Prātimokṣa, connects it. These explain the transmission of the scriptures.

original: mchod cing lung 'bogs pa bshad zin to //
analyzed: mchod cing lung 'bogs pa bshad zin to //
translated: The explanation of worship and transmission is complete.

analyzed: yang dag par sgrub tu gzhug pa'i dbang du mdzad nas / thos nas drang srong chen po yis //
translated: With the aim of correctly practicing,🔽he declared two verses:🔽Having heard, one should practice

analyzed: ji skad gsungs bzhin bsgrub bya zhing // kha na ma tho phra rnams la //
translated: just as the great Rishi taught.🔽One should be diligent and pure

analyzed: brtun cing byang ba nyid du gyis // zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gnyis gsungs te /

analyzed: thos nas zhes bya ba ni so sor thar pa'i mdo 'don pa rnam pa lnga po de dag gi lung 'bogs pa thos nas so //

analyzed: drang srong chen po zhes bya ba ni ston pa bcom ldan 'das te tshul khrims kyi dang tshul can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The great Rishi is the teacher, the Blessed One, because he is the one who has the nature of morality.

translated: Just as he taught means just as he said, without contradicting the Vinaya and without contradicting the world.

analyzed: bsgrub par bya zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba dang dngos dang mjug gi sgo nas nan tan du bya'o //

original: kha na ma tho zhes bya ba ni sdig pa ste /
analyzed: kha na ma tho zhes bya ba ni sdig pa ste /
translated: “Evil” means sinful,

analyzed: dam pa rnams kyis smad pa'i phyir ro // phra rnams la zhes bya ba ni bcas pa'i kha na ma @183a * //

analyzed: tho ba dang bcas pa phra mo rnams la'o // brtun cing byed pa nyid du gyis //

analyzed: zhes bya ba ni srung ba dag la sogs pa dag la 'bad pa dang lhur blang bar gyis shig ces bya ba'i tha tshig ste /

original: phra mo rnams la yang brtun cing byed pa nyid bya na /
analyzed: phra mo rnams la yang brtun cing byed pa nyid bya na /
translated: If one is diligent and does even the subtle ones,
