analyzed: rang bzhin gyi kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa chen po rnams la smos kyang ci dgos zhes gsungs par shes par bya'o // rtag tu 'bad pas bda' ba yi //
translated: what need is there to mention the gross natural evils?🔽The mind-horse is difficult to rein in,

original: sems rta kha glan dka' ba la //🔽mthun pa'i gzer rnon brgya pa yi //
analyzed: sems rta kha glan dka' ba la // mthun pa'i gzer rnon brgya pa yi //
translated: always running wild with effort.🔽This Pratimoksha is the bridle

original: srab ni so sor thar 'di yin //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: srab ni so sor thar 'di yin // zhes bya ba la /
translated: with a hundred sharp hooks.🔽The mind-horse is difficult to rein in,

original: rtag tu 'bad pas bda' ba yi //
analyzed: rtag tu 'bad pas bda' ba yi //
translated: always running wild with effort.

original: zhes bya ba ni sems rta dmu rgod dang 'dra ba 'di ni lam bde ba dang 'dra ba'i dge ba'i phyogs la zhugs pa'i dus na rtag tu srab bzhin du 'then zhing brtson 'grus kyi lcag gis bda' zhing bskyad dgos pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sems rta dmu rgod dang 'dra ba 'di ni lam bde ba dang 'dra ba'i dge ba'i phyogs la zhugs pa'i dus na rtag tu srab bzhin du 'then zhing brtson 'grus kyi lcag gis bda' zhing bskyad dgos pa'o //
translated: This verse says that the mind, which is like a wild horse, is always thin, as if emaciated, when it is engaged in the virtuous side, which is like a pleasant path. It must be whipped with the whip of effort and urged on.

original: sems rta zhes bya ba ni sems nyid rta dmu rgod dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: sems rta zhes bya ba ni sems nyid rta dmu rgod dang 'dra'o //
translated: The mind is called a horse, because the mind itself is like a wild horse.

original: kha glan dka' zhes bya ba ni lam gol ba dang 'dra ba'i mi dge ba'i phyogs la 'jug pa'i dus na rlung bzhin du 'phyo zhing chu lon gyi dgug srab kyis phyir kha glan zhing dgug dka' ba'o //
analyzed: kha glan dka' zhes bya ba ni lam gol ba dang 'dra ba'i mi dge ba'i phyogs la 'jug pa'i dus na rlung bzhin du 'phyo zhing chu lon gyi dgug srab kyis phyir kha glan zhing dgug dka' ba'o //
translated: It is difficult to turn around, because when it is engaged in the nonvirtuous side, which is like a bad path, it is hard to turn around and hold it back with the reins of mindfulness, as if it were blowing in the wind.

original: mthun pa zhes bya ba ni 'tsham zhing rkyen du bab pa ste /
analyzed: mthun pa zhes bya ba ni 'tsham zhing rkyen du bab pa ste /
translated: Favorable means suitable and opportune.

original: rta dmu rgod rtag tu lcag gis 'bad pas bda' zhing dgug srab kyi kha lcag gis glan dka' ba la ni gzer bu rnon po brgya ba'i srab kyis srab pa 'tsham zhing rkyen du 'bab la sems dmu rgod rtag tu brtson 'grus kyi 'bad pas bda' zhing tshul🔽khrims kyi chu lon gyis kha glan dka' ba la ni bslab pa'i gzhi gzer bu gdung ba rnon po brgya pa'i so sor thar pa 'di 'tsham zhing rkyen du 'bab pa'o //
analyzed: rta dmu rgod rtag tu lcag gis 'bad pas bda' zhing dgug srab kyi kha lcag gis glan dka' ba la ni gzer bu rnon po brgya ba'i srab kyis srab pa 'tsham zhing rkyen du 'bab la sems dmu rgod rtag tu brtson 'grus kyi 'bad pas bda' zhing tshul khrims kyi chu lon gyis kha glan dka' ba la ni bslab pa'i gzhi gzer bu gdung ba rnon po brgya pa'i so sor thar pa 'di 'tsham zhing rkyen du 'bab pa'o //
translated: A wild horse is always difficult to control with a bridle and reins, but it is suitable and appropriate to control it with a bridle of a hundred sharp nails.🔽Likewise, a wild mind is always difficult to control with the water of ethical discipline and the effort of diligence, but it is suitable and appropriate to control it with this pratimokṣa, which is like a hundred sharp nails of the bases of training.

original: gzer rnon brgya ba zhes bya ba ni dgug srab kyi kha lcags kyi gzer bu rnon po mang po dang ldan pa dang 'dra bar so sor thar pa 'di yang bslab pa'i gzhi gdung bar byed pa mang po dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: gzer rnon brgya ba zhes bya ba ni dgug srab kyi kha lcags kyi gzer bu rnon po mang po dang ldan pa dang 'dra bar so sor thar pa 'di yang bslab pa'i gzhi gdung bar byed pa mang po dang ldan pa ste /
translated: A hundred sharp nails means that just as a bridle has many sharp iron nails, so this pratimoksha has many nails that bind the bases of training.

original: brgya pa zhes bya ba ni mang po mtshon pa'i tshig yin gyi grangs brgya nges pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: brgya pa zhes bya ba ni mang po mtshon pa'i tshig yin gyi grangs brgya nges pa ni ma yin no //
translated: A hundred is a word that indicates many, but it is not definite that there are exactly one hundred.

original: srab ni so sor thar 'di yin //
analyzed: srab ni so sor thar 'di yin //
translated: This is the bridle of the Pratimoksha.

original: zhes bya ba ni srab dang 'dra ba yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽de dag gis drang srong chen pos ji skad gsungs pa bzhin bsgrub pa dang / kha na ma tho ba rnams la yang brtun cing 'bad par bya ba dang / sems gyi rta dmu rgod la so sor thar pa'i dgug srab kyis bslab dgos pa'i sgo nas /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni srab dang 'dra ba yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // de dag gis drang srong chen pos ji skad gsungs pa bzhin bsgrub pa dang / kha na ma tho ba rnams la yang brtun cing 'bad par bya ba dang / sems gyi rta dmu rgod la so sor thar pa'i dgug srab kyis bslab dgos pa'i sgo nas /
translated: This is the meaning of the verse: “It is like a bridle.”

original: so sor thar pa yang dag par sgrub tu gzhug pa bstan no //
analyzed: so sor thar pa yang dag par sgrub tu gzhug pa bstan no //
translated: Thus, the Buddha taught the practice of the Pratimoksha in order to tame the wild horse of the mind, to accomplish the words of the great sages, to be diligent and strive in the avoidance of evil, and to be restrained by the bridle of the Pratimoksha.

original: yang dag par @183b sgrub tu gzhug pa bshad zin to //
analyzed: yang dag par @183b sgrub tu gzhug pa bshad zin to //
translated: The explanation of the practice of the Pratimoksha is complete.🔽The benefits of the Pratimoksha

original: de'i phan yon bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: de'i phan yon bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: The benefits of the Pratimoksha are now explained.

original: che ba gang dag ngag tsam gyis //
analyzed: che ba gang dag ngag tsam gyis //
translated: Those who, just by hearing of it,

original: ldog cing mtshams las mi 'da' ba //
analyzed: ldog cing mtshams las mi 'da' ba //
translated: Turn back and do not transgress the boundaries,

original: de dag mi rta bzang po ste //🔽nyon mongs g-yul las nges rgyal 'gyur //
analyzed: de dag mi rta bzang po ste // nyon mongs g-yul las nges rgyal 'gyur //
translated: Are excellent horses

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Who will certainly conquer the battle against the afflictions.

original: che ba zhes bya ba ni che ba'i bdag nyid can te ;
analyzed: che ba zhes bya ba ni che ba'i bdag nyid can te ;
translated: Those who are great, who have great natures,

original: bslab pa 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bslab pa 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they desire the training.

original: dag tsam gyis zhes bya ba ni chad pa la sogs pa la rnam par bsal bas so //
analyzed: dag tsam gyis zhes bya ba ni chad pa la sogs pa la rnam par bsal bas so //
translated: By just the purity is meant that they are distinguished from the nihilistic and other extremes.

original: ldog cing zhes bya ba ni bya ba ma yin pa las so //
analyzed: ldog cing zhes bya ba ni bya ba ma yin pa las so //
translated: By they turn away is meant that they turn away from what should not be done.

original: mtshams las zhes bya ba ni bslab pa las so //
analyzed: mtshams las zhes bya ba ni bslab pa las so //
translated: By from the boundary is meant from the training.

original: mi 'da' ba zhes bya ba ni mi 'dral ba'o //🔽de dag mi rta bzang po ste //
analyzed: mi 'da' ba zhes bya ba ni mi 'dral ba'o // de dag mi rta bzang po ste //
translated: By they do not transgress is meant that they do not violate it.🔽They are good horses,

original: zhes bya ba ni de dag rta cang shes pa dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni de dag rta cang shes pa dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: By they are like good horses is meant that they are like thoroughbred horses.

original: nyon mongs g-yul las zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i ngo bo nyid ni bdag dang gzhan la gnod pa nyid kyis g-yul dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs g-yul las zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i ngo bo nyid ni bdag dang gzhan la gnod pa nyid kyis g-yul dang 'dra ste /
translated: By in the battle with the defilements is meant that the nature of the defilements is like a battle, because they harm both oneself and others.

original: de las so //
analyzed: de las so //
translated: From that battle,

original: nges rgyal 'gyur zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa mthar byed cing mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'bras bu thob par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: nges rgyal 'gyur zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa mthar byed cing mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'bras bu thob par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: they are victorious means that they put an end to the defilements and attain the fruit of nirvana.

original: de dag gis ni so sor thar pa yang dag par bsgrubs nas /
analyzed: de dag gis ni so sor thar pa yang dag par bsgrubs nas /
translated: Having thus accomplished the prātimokṣa,🔽they are not defiled by the defilements means that they are not defiled by the defilements.

original: nyon mongs pa'i g-yul las nges par rgyal bar 'gyur ba'i sgo nas yang dag par sgrub pa de'i phan yon bstan to //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i g-yul las nges par rgyal bar 'gyur ba'i sgo nas yang dag par sgrub pa de'i phan yon bstan to //
translated: The benefits of its practice are taught by way of the certain victory in the battle with the afflictions.

original: de'i phan yon bshad zin to //
analyzed: de'i phan yon bshad zin to //
translated: The benefits of its practice have been explained.

original: yang dag par mi sgrub pa'i nyes dmigs bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: yang dag par mi sgrub pa'i nyes dmigs bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: The disadvantages of its non-practice are taught in the verse:🔽For whom this bridle does not exist,

original: su la srab 'di med pa dang // nam du'ang 'dod par mi 'gyur ba //
analyzed: su la srab 'di med pa dang // nam du'ang 'dod par mi 'gyur ba //
translated: and who never desire it,

original: de dag nyon mongs g-yul gyis dkrugs //
analyzed: de dag nyon mongs g-yul gyis dkrugs //
translated: they are disturbed by the battle of the afflictions,

original: 'jog 'bral rnam par 'khyam par 'gyur //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: 'jog 'bral rnam par 'khyam par 'gyur // zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: and, separated from the placement, they wander.

original: su la srab 'di med pa dang // zhes bya ba ni mu stegs can dag la med pa ste /🔽yang dag par ma bslabs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: su la srab 'di med pa dang // zhes bya ba ni mu stegs can dag la med pa ste / yang dag par ma bslabs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For whom this bridle does not exist,

original: nam du'ang 'dod bar mi 'gyur ba //🔽zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa la longs spyod pa dag lan 'ga' 'dod mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: nam du'ang 'dod bar mi 'gyur ba // zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa la longs spyod pa dag lan 'ga' 'dod mi 'gyur te /
translated: and who never desire it,🔽they are disturbed by the battle of the afflictions,🔽and, separated from the placement, they wander.🔽For whom this bridle does not exist means for the tīrthikas, because they are not properly trained.

original: tshul khrims la mngon par mi phyogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshul khrims la mngon par mi phyogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And who never desire it means that those who enjoy desire will never desire it, because they are not inclined to morality.

original: dkrugs zhes bya ba ni pham par byas pa'o //
analyzed: dkrugs zhes bya ba ni pham par byas pa'o //
translated: Disturbed means defeated.

original: 'jog 'bral zhes bya ba ni lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyis 'dul bas lhag pa'i sems kyi zhi ba la 'jog par byed pas 'jog pa ni 'dul ba nyid de de dang 'bral ba'o //
analyzed: 'jog 'bral zhes bya ba ni lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyis 'dul bas lhag pa'i sems kyi zhi ba la 'jog par byed pas 'jog pa ni 'dul ba nyid de de dang 'bral ba'o //
translated: The phrase deprived of the foundation means that because of the training in superior morality, one is established in the peacefulness of superior thought.  Foundation is the training itself.

original: rnam par 'khyam par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni lan mi nyung bar ngan song la sogs pa'i 'khor bar 'khor bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par 'khyam par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni lan mi nyung bar ngan song la sogs pa'i 'khor bar 'khor bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: One wanders means that one circles in samsara, in the lower realms and so forth, not a few times.

original: de dag gis bslab pa med pa dang mi 'dod pas yang dag par mi sgrub pa dag 'dul ba nyid dang bral bas @184a * //
analyzed: de dag gis bslab pa med pa dang mi 'dod pas yang dag par mi sgrub pa dag 'dul ba nyid dang bral bas @184a * //
translated: They, who are deprived of the training, who do not practice properly because they do not want to, are deprived of the foundation.

original: zhi ba mi 'thob cing 'khor bar 'gyur ba'i sgo nas yang dag par mi sgrub pa'i nyes dmigs bstan to //
analyzed: zhi ba mi 'thob cing 'khor bar 'gyur ba'i sgo nas yang dag par mi sgrub pa'i nyes dmigs bstan to //
translated: They do not attain peace means that they do not attain nirvana.  They wander means that they wander in samsara. This explains the danger of not practicing properly.

original: yang dag par mi sgrub pa'i nyes dmigs bshad zin to //
analyzed: yang dag par mi sgrub pa'i nyes dmigs bshad zin to //
translated: The danger of not practicing properly has been explained.

original: de dag ni dus dang por bya ba ste cho ga'o //
analyzed: de dag ni dus dang por bya ba ste cho ga'o //
translated: These are the first things to be done, the ritual.

original: da ni mdo gdon pa'i las bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni mdo gdon pa'i las bshad par bya ste /
translated: Now the duties of the reciter will be explained.

original: de la gsol ba'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: de la gsol ba'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: In this regard, with regard to the request,

original: dge 'dun btsun pa rnams gsan du gsol /
analyzed: dge 'dun btsun pa rnams gsan du gsol /
translated: the venerable Saṅgha, please listen!

original: deng dge 'dun gyi gso sbyong bcu bzhi pa'am bco lnga pa ste /
analyzed: deng dge 'dun gyi gso sbyong bcu bzhi pa'am bco lnga pa ste /
translated: Today is the fourteenth or fifteenth day of the monks’ purification ceremony.

original: gal te dge 'dun gyi dus la bab cing bzod na dge 'dun gyis gnang bar mdzod cig dang / deng dge 'dun gso sbyong mdzad de /
analyzed: gal te dge 'dun gyi dus la bab cing bzod na dge 'dun gyis gnang bar mdzod cig dang / deng dge 'dun gso sbyong mdzad de /
translated: If it seems appropriate to the saṅgha and they accept, then let the saṅgha please agree to the saṅgha performing the purification ceremony today.

original: so sor thar pa'i mdo 'don pa gdon to //
analyzed: so sor thar pa'i mdo 'don pa gdon to //
translated: The recitation of the Sūtra of Individual Liberation will be recited.

original: 'di ni gsol ba'o zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di ni gsol ba'o zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: This is the announcement.

original: 'di ni mdo gdon pa'i gsol ba bstan to //
analyzed: 'di ni mdo gdon pa'i gsol ba bstan to //
translated: This shows the announcement for the recitation of the sūtra.

original: gsol ba ma ba rjod na ma bskos par byed pa nyid yin pas mi mthun pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir 'di ni so sor thar pa'i mdo gdon pa lnga po dag gdon pa'i mdun rol du gsol ba 'ba' zhig gis las byas pa'o //
analyzed: gsol ba ma ba rjod na ma bskos par byed pa nyid yin pas mi mthun pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir 'di ni so sor thar pa'i mdo gdon pa lnga po dag gdon pa'i mdun rol du gsol ba 'ba' zhig gis las byas pa'o //
translated: Since the announcement is not made before the recitation, it is done without being appointed. Since it is not in accord, this is the announcement alone that is done before the recitation of the five sūtras of the Sūtra of Individual Liberation.

original: 'don par byed pas so sor thar pa'i mdog don pa'i gsol ba ni 'di ltar bya ste /
analyzed: 'don par byed pas so sor thar pa'i mdog don pa'i gsol ba ni 'di ltar bya ste /
translated: The announcement for the recitation of the Sūtra of Individual Liberation is done like this.

original: mdo 'don pa seng ge'i khri la 'dug nas so sor thar pa'i mdo bstod ra dang / dus dang por byas pa'i tshig dag je ston nas de'i 'og tu gsol ba 'ba' zhig gis las 'di bya'o //
analyzed: mdo 'don pa seng ge'i khri la 'dug nas so sor thar pa'i mdo bstod ra dang / dus dang por byas pa'i tshig dag je ston nas de'i 'og tu gsol ba 'ba' zhig gis las 'di bya'o //
translated: After that, he says this is the only request and performs this action.

original: dge 'dun btsun pa rnams zhes bya ba ni mchod pa'i tshig gis bod pa ste /
analyzed: dge 'dun btsun pa rnams zhes bya ba ni mchod pa'i tshig gis bod pa ste /
translated: The phrase venerable monks is a respectful salutation.

original: btsun pa rnams kyi tshogs zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: btsun pa rnams kyi tshogs zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means the assembly of venerable ones.

original: gsan du gsol zhes bya ba ni gzhan la sems pa dag nyan pa la rna mi gtod pa dang gus par gyis shig ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gsan du gsol zhes bya ba ni gzhan la sems pa dag nyan pa la rna mi gtod pa dang gus par gyis shig ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The phrase please listen means pay attention and listen respectfully to others who are not paying attention.

original: deng dge 'dun gyi gso sbyong bcu bzhi pa'am bco lnga pa ste zhes bya ba la gso sbyong gi bslab pa gsum po dag gso zhing sbyong bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: deng dge 'dun gyi gso sbyong bcu bzhi pa'am bco lnga pa ste zhes bya ba la gso sbyong gi bslab pa gsum po dag gso zhing sbyong bar byed pa ste /
translated: Today is the fourteenth or fifteenth day of the Sangha's purification and renewal. The three trainings of purification and renewal are to be purified and renewed.

original: de yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Moreover, there are two types:

original: mthun pa'i gso sbyong dang / zhi gnas kyi gso sbyong ngo //
analyzed: mthun pa'i gso sbyong dang / zhi gnas kyi gso sbyong ngo //
translated: the purification and renewal of concordance, and the purification and renewal of tranquility.

original: mthun pa'i gso sbyong ni lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi dbang du byas te /
analyzed: mthun pa'i gso sbyong ni lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi dbang du byas te /
translated: The concordant purification is from the point of view of superior morality.

original: gnas dang / tshogs dang tshogs mthun par bya'o //
analyzed: gnas dang / tshogs dang tshogs mthun par bya'o //
translated: One should purify the place, the assembly, and the concordant assembly.

original: zhi gnas kyi gso sbyong ni lhag pa'i sems dang / lhag pa'i shes rab kyi dbang du byas te /
analyzed: zhi gnas kyi gso sbyong ni lhag pa'i sems dang / lhag pa'i shes rab kyi dbang du byas te /
translated: The purification of serenity is from the point of view of superior mind and superior wisdom.

original: spong ba'i yan lag sgom pa'o //
analyzed: spong ba'i yan lag sgom pa'o //
translated: It is the cultivation of the branches of abandonment.

original: de yang las phyi ma rnams ni mi bya ba'i chu lon gyis bsdams pa yin pas de ni mthun pa'i gso sbyong gis sbyong bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: de yang las phyi ma rnams ni mi bya ba'i chu lon gyis bsdams pa yin pas de ni mthun pa'i gso sbyong gis sbyong bar byed pa'o //
translated: Moreover, since the latter actions are restrained by the embankment of non-action, one purifies them by the concordant purification.

original: las snga ma rnams ni sgom pa'i rnam pas sbyong ba yin pas de ni zhi gnas @184b kyi gso sbyong gis sbyong bar byed de /
analyzed: las snga ma rnams ni sgom pa'i rnam pas sbyong ba yin pas de ni zhi gnas @184b kyi gso sbyong gis sbyong bar byed de /
translated: Since the former actions are purified by the aspect of cultivation, one purifies them by the purification of serenity.

original: des ni lhag pa'i tshul khrims la brten te lhag pa'i sems skye la lhag pa'i sems la brten te lhag pa'i shes rab skye bas bslab pa gsum po dag gso zhing sbyong ba ni mthun pa'i gso sbyong dang zhi gnas kyi gso sbyong yin par shes par bya'o
analyzed: des ni lhag pa'i tshul khrims la brten te lhag pa'i sems skye la lhag pa'i sems la brten te lhag pa'i shes rab skye bas bslab pa gsum po dag gso zhing sbyong ba ni mthun pa'i gso sbyong dang zhi gnas kyi gso sbyong yin par shes par bya'o
translated: This is the purification of concordance and the purification of serenity.

original: // skabs 'dir ni mthun pa'i gso sbyong gzung bar bya ste /
analyzed: // skabs 'dir ni mthun pa'i gso sbyong gzung bar bya ste /
translated: Here, one should take up the purification of concordance.

original: mthun pa'i gso sbyong ni rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: mthun pa'i gso sbyong ni rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: The purification of concordance is of five types:

original: bcu bzhi pa dang / bco lnga pa dang / bkra shis kyi gso sbyong dang / gnod pa byung ba'i gso sbyong dang / bsdum pa'i gso sbyong ngo //
analyzed: bcu bzhi pa dang / bco lnga pa dang / bkra shis kyi gso sbyong dang / gnod pa byung ba'i gso sbyong dang / bsdum pa'i gso sbyong ngo //
translated: the fourteenth, the fifteenth, the purification of auspiciousness, the purification of the arising of harm, and the purification of reconciliation.

original: de dag thams cad la yang gsol ba dang / gleng gzhi rnam par gzhag pa sngar byas te ;
analyzed: de dag thams cad la yang gsol ba dang / gleng gzhi rnam par gzhag pa sngar byas te ;
translated: In all of these, one should first set forth the proposal and the introduction,

original: so sor thar pa'i mdo gdon pa gdon dgos so //
analyzed: so sor thar pa'i mdo gdon pa gdon dgos so //
translated: and then recite the Pratimoksha Sutra.

original: mthun pa'i gso sbyong rnam pa lnga po /
analyzed: mthun pa'i gso sbyong rnam pa lnga po /
translated: The five types of purification of concordance are:

original: de dag las 'dir ni bcu bzhi pa dang / bco lnga pa'i skabs yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de dag las 'dir ni bcu bzhi pa dang / bco lnga pa'i skabs yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Here, the fourteenth and fifteenth are taught.

original: bcu bzhi pa'am bco lnga pa ste zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: bcu bzhi pa'am bco lnga pa ste zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: The fourteenth or fifteenth is stated.🔽The twenty four day poṣadha vows are two months each in the six seasons.

original: de la dus tshigs drug la zla ba gnyis gnyis yod pa dag gi nya shi gnyis gnyis yod pa gso sbyong nyi shu rtsa bzhi yod pa de dag tshes grangs kyi tshes grangs yang dag pa la ltos na ni thams cad gso sbyong bco lnga pa yin no
analyzed: de la dus tshigs drug la zla ba gnyis gnyis yod pa dag gi nya shi gnyis gnyis yod pa gso sbyong nyi shu rtsa bzhi yod pa de dag tshes grangs kyi tshes grangs yang dag pa la ltos na ni thams cad gso sbyong bco lnga pa yin no
translated: If one relies on the correct number of days, all are the fifteenth day poṣadha vow.

original: // 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad kyi dus la ltos na ni drug ni gso sbyong bcu bzhi pa yin te dus tshigs drug po de dag gi zla ba phyed phyed lus pa'i gso sbyong drug po dag go //
analyzed: // 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad kyi dus la ltos na ni drug ni gso sbyong bcu bzhi pa yin te dus tshigs drug po de dag gi zla ba phyed phyed lus pa'i gso sbyong drug po dag go //
translated: If one relies on worldly conventional time, six are the fourteenth day poṣadha vow, because the six poṣadha vows that remain in the last half of each of the six seasons are the fourteenth day poṣadha vow.

original: 'di skad bstan to //
analyzed: 'di skad bstan to //
translated: This is taught.

original: dbyar zla ba gsum dang / dgun zla ba gsum gyi ni ra ba dang tha chungs mar gyi ngo bco lnga mi thub pas /
analyzed: dbyar zla ba gsum dang / dgun zla ba gsum gyi ni ra ba dang tha chungs mar gyi ngo bco lnga mi thub pas /
translated: The three months of summer and the three months of winter are the fourteenth day poṣadha vow, because the fifteenth day of the waning phase of the last month of summer and the last month of winter cannot be observed.

original: ra ba dang tha chungs kyi gnam stong bzhi gso sbyong bcu bzhi pa yin no //
analyzed: ra ba dang tha chungs kyi gnam stong bzhi gso sbyong bcu bzhi pa yin no //
translated: The first, last and middle full moons of the three months of winter are the fourteenth poṣadha.

original: ston zla gsum dang / dpyid zla gsum gyi ni 'bring po mar gyi ngo'i bco lnga yang mi thub pas 'bring po gnam stong gnyis gso sbyong bcu bzhi pa yin no //
analyzed: ston zla gsum dang / dpyid zla gsum gyi ni 'bring po mar gyi ngo'i bco lnga yang mi thub pas 'bring po gnam stong gnyis gso sbyong bcu bzhi pa yin no //
translated: The first, last and middle full moons of the three months of spring are the fourteenth poṣadha.

original: lhag ma bco brgyad ni gso sbyong bco lnga pa yin no //
analyzed: lhag ma bco brgyad ni gso sbyong bco lnga pa yin no //
translated: The remaining eighteen are the fifteenth poṣadha.

original: bkra shis kyi gso sbyong dang gnod pa byung ba'i gso sbyong dang / bsdum pa'i gso sbyong dag byed na ni de'i tshe deng dge 'dun gyi bkra shis kyi gso sbyong ste zhe'am /
analyzed: bkra shis kyi gso sbyong dang gnod pa byung ba'i gso sbyong dang / bsdum pa'i gso sbyong dag byed na ni de'i tshe deng dge 'dun gyi bkra shis kyi gso sbyong ste zhe'am /
translated: If one performs the poṣadha of good fortune, the poṣadha of misfortune and the poṣadha of reconciliation, then at that time one should specify: Today is the Saṃgha’s poṣadha of good fortune,

original: deng dge 'dun gyi gnod pa byung ba'i gso sbyong ste zhe'am /
analyzed: deng dge 'dun gyi gnod pa byung ba'i gso sbyong ste zhe'am /
translated: Today is the Saṃgha’s poṣadha of misfortune,

original: deng dge 'dun gyi bsdum pa'i gso sbyong ste zhes dmigs kyis smos par bya ste /
analyzed: deng dge 'dun gyi bsdum pa'i gso sbyong ste zhes dmigs kyis smos par bya ste /
translated: Today is the Saṃgha’s poṣadha of reconciliation.

original: de dag ni gang gi tshe bya bar zad kyi dus nges pa ni med do //
analyzed: de dag ni gang gi tshe bya bar zad kyi dus nges pa ni med do //
translated: They are performed when necessary, but there is no fixed time.

original: bcu bzhi pa dang bco lnga pa ni dus nges pa yin pas de las snga phyir byar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: bcu bzhi pa dang bco lnga pa ni dus nges pa yin pas de las snga phyir byar mi rung ngo //
translated: The fourteenth and fifteenth days are fixed times, so it is not suitable to do it earlier or later.

original: gal te dge 'dun gyi dus la @185a * //
analyzed: gal te dge 'dun gyi dus la @185a * //
translated: If the Saṅgha is ready,🔽then if the time has come,

original: bab cing bzod na zhes bya ba la dus la bab pa zhes bya ba ni las bya ba'i dus la bab pa ste /
analyzed: bab cing bzod na zhes bya ba la dus la bab pa zhes bya ba ni las bya ba'i dus la bab pa ste /
translated: the time has come for doing the rite.

original: 'dir ni gso sbyong gi dus dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'dir ni gso sbyong gi dus dang sbyar ro //
translated: Here it is connected with the time of the poṣadha.

original: bzod na zhes bya ba ni las de gzhag par mi 'os shing bya bar bzod pa ste /
analyzed: bzod na zhes bya ba ni las de gzhag par mi 'os shing bya bar bzod pa ste /
translated: If the Saṅgha is ready, then if the rite is suitable to be done and the Saṅgha is ready to do it,

original: 'di yang gso sbyong gi las dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'di yang gso sbyong gi las dang sbyar ro //
translated: this is also connected with the poṣadha rite.🔽The Saṅgha should give its assent,

original: dge 'dun gyis gnang bar mdzod cig dang zhes bya ba ni cang mi smra bas so //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyis gnang bar mdzod cig dang zhes bya ba ni cang mi smra bas so //
translated: and it is by remaining silent.🔽Today the Saṅgha is doing the poṣadha,

original: deng dge 'dun gso sbyong mdzad de zhes bya ba ni las te gzhag par mi 'os pa yin pas bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: deng dge 'dun gso sbyong mdzad de zhes bya ba ni las te gzhag par mi 'os pa yin pas bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: and the rite is not suitable to be postponed, so it should be done—this is the meaning.

original: so sor thar pa'i mdo gdon pa gdon no zhes bya ba ni so sor thar pa'i mdo gdon pa rnam pa lnga po gleng gzhi gdon pa dang / pham par gyur pa gdon pa dang / dge 'dun lhag ma gdon pa dang / ma nges pa gdon pa dang /🔽ril gyis gdon pa dag go //🔽'di ni gsol pa'o zhes bya ba ni las brgya rtsa gcig ni las gsum gyis bsdus te /
analyzed: so sor thar pa'i mdo gdon pa gdon no zhes bya ba ni so sor thar pa'i mdo gdon pa rnam pa lnga po gleng gzhi gdon pa dang / pham par gyur pa gdon pa dang / dge 'dun lhag ma gdon pa dang / ma nges pa gdon pa dang / ril gyis gdon pa dag go // 'di ni gsol pa'o zhes bya ba ni las brgya rtsa gcig ni las gsum gyis bsdus te /
translated: The recitation of the Pratimoksa Sutra is the recitation of the five parts of the Pratimoksa Sutra: the recitation of the introduction, the recitation of the defeating offenses, the recitation of the partially defeating offenses, the recitation of the undetermined offenses, and the recitation of the remaining topics.🔽This is the request.

original: gsol ba'i las dang / gsol ba dang gnyis kyi las dang gsol ba dang bzhi'i las so //
analyzed: gsol ba'i las dang / gsol ba dang gnyis kyi las dang gsol ba dang bzhi'i las so //
translated: The one hundred and one karmas are included in three karmas: the karma of request, the karma of request and two, and the karma of request and four.

original: de la gsol ba'i las nyi shu rtsa bzhi'o //
analyzed: de la gsol ba'i las nyi shu rtsa bzhi'o //
translated: Among those, there are twenty-four karmas of request.

original: gsol ba dang gnyis kyi las ni gzhi bcu rtsa bdun no //
analyzed: gsol ba dang gnyis kyi las ni gzhi bcu rtsa bdun no //
translated: The karma of request and two is the basis of seventeen.

original: gsol ba bzhi'i las ni sum cu'o zhes gsungs pa la /
analyzed: gsol ba bzhi'i las ni sum cu'o zhes gsungs pa la /
translated: The karma of request and four is thirty.

original: 'di ni gsol ba'i las nyi shu rtsa bzhi bo dag gi nang nas gcig yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni gsol ba'i las nyi shu rtsa bzhi bo dag gi nang nas gcig yin no //
translated: This is one of the twenty-four karmas of request.

original: gsol ba bshad zin to //
analyzed: gsol ba bshad zin to //
translated: The request has been explained.

original: da ni gleng gzhi gdon pa bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni gleng gzhi gdon pa bshad par bya ste /
translated: Now the recitation of the introduction will be explained.

original: de la gleng gzhi rnam par gzhag pa'i dbang du mdzad nas tshe dang ldan pa dag bdag cag gso sbyong bya ste /
analyzed: de la gleng gzhi rnam par gzhag pa'i dbang du mdzad nas tshe dang ldan pa dag bdag cag gso sbyong bya ste /
translated: In this regard, the Buddha spoke the words, “Venerable ones, we should perform the poṣadha purification ceremony.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa dag gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa dag gsungs so //
translated: and so on.🔽🔽

original: gleng gzhi rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya ba ni de ltar so sor thar pa'i mdo gdon pa'i gsol ba byas nas so sor thar pa'i mdo gdon pa rnam pa 'di 'khor yongs su dag cing snod du rung bar bya ba'i phyir ltung ba yod na mthol du
analyzed: gleng gzhi rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya ba ni de ltar so sor thar pa'i mdo gdon pa'i gsol ba byas nas so sor thar pa'i mdo gdon pa rnam pa 'di 'khor yongs su dag cing snod du rung bar bya ba'i phyir ltung ba yod na mthol du
translated: The so-called “establishment of the basis” is as follows: Having made the request to recite the Prātimokṣa Sūtra, in order to purify the retinue and make them suitable vessels, if there are downfalls, they should be confessed

original: gzhug pa dang / med na cang mi smra bar bya ba dang / cang mi smra na yongs su dag pas reg par bya ba'i phyir cho ga gleng gzhi rnam par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: gzhug pa dang / med na cang mi smra bar bya ba dang / cang mi smra na yongs su dag pas reg par bya ba'i phyir cho ga gleng gzhi rnam par gzhag pa'o //
translated: and if there are none, one should remain silent. In order to touch the pure by remaining silent, the procedure of the establishment of the basis is as follows.

original: gleng gzhi rnam par gzhag pa 'di'i bsdus pa'i don ni rnam pa drug ste /
analyzed: gleng gzhi rnam par gzhag pa 'di'i bsdus pa'i don ni rnam pa drug ste /
translated: The condensed meaning of this establishment of the basis is sixfold.

original: gleng gzhi rnam par gzhag pa lung 'bogs pa dang gleng gzhi rnam par gzhag pa'i thabs dang / ma dag pa'i nyes dmigs dang / dag pa'i phan yon dang / 'don pa mjug sdud pa dang / gleng gzhi rnam par gzhag pa bsgrags pa'o //
analyzed: gleng gzhi rnam par gzhag pa lung 'bogs pa dang gleng gzhi rnam par gzhag pa'i thabs dang / ma dag pa'i nyes dmigs dang / dag pa'i phan yon dang / 'don pa mjug sdud pa dang / gleng gzhi rnam par gzhag pa bsgrags pa'o //
translated: The setting is taught by the recitation of the Prātimokṣa Sūtra and the method of setting forth the Prātimokṣa Sūtra, the disadvantages of impurity, the benefits of purity, the conclusion of the recitation, and the proclamation of the setting forth of the Prātimokṣa Sūtra.

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag bdag cag gso sbyong bya ste /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag bdag cag gso sbyong bya ste /
translated: Venerable ones, we will perform the poṣadha.🔽Those who have downfalls should confess them. Those who are pure should remain silent.

original: so sor thar pa'i @185b mdo gdon pa gdon gyis khyed cag su la ltung ba yod pa de mthol cig / ltung ba med na cang ma smra shig / cang mi smra na bdag gis tshe dang ldan pa dag yongs su dag par rig par bya'o zhes bya
analyzed: so sor thar pa'i @185b mdo gdon pa gdon gyis khyed cag su la ltung ba yod pa de mthol cig / ltung ba med na cang ma smra shig / cang mi smra na bdag gis tshe dang ldan pa dag yongs su dag par rig par bya'o zhes bya
translated: I will understand the complete purity of the venerable ones.

original: bas ni gleng gzhi rnam par gzhag pa'i lung dbog pa bstan to //
analyzed: bas ni gleng gzhi rnam par gzhag pa'i lung dbog pa bstan to //
translated: This teaches the recitation of the Prātimokṣa Sūtra and the method of setting forth the Prātimokṣa Sūtra.

original: ji ltar so sor dris nas dge slong gis lan btab pa de bzhin du dge slong gi 'di lta bur yang lan gsum gyi bar du bsgrags par bya ba yin no zhes bya ba ni gleng gzhi rnam par gzhag pa'i thabs bstan to //
analyzed: ji ltar so sor dris nas dge slong gis lan btab pa de bzhin du dge slong gi 'di lta bur yang lan gsum gyi bar du bsgrags par bya ba yin no zhes bya ba ni gleng gzhi rnam par gzhag pa'i thabs bstan to //
translated: Just as the monk answers the questions individually, so too should the monk proclaim in this way up to three times. This is the teaching on the method of establishing the basis.

original: yang dge slong gang dge slong gi 'khor 'di lta bur lan gsum gyi bar du bsgrags pa na ltung ba yod la dran bzhin du mi mthol na de shas bzhin du brdzun du smra ba yin no //
analyzed: yang dge slong gang dge slong gi 'khor 'di lta bur lan gsum gyi bar du bsgrags pa na ltung ba yod la dran bzhin du mi mthol na de shas bzhin du brdzun du smra ba yin no //
translated: Moreover, if a monk, when the proclamation is made up to three times in this way to the assembly of monks, does not confess his offense while remembering it, then he is a deliberate liar.

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag shes bzhin du brdzun du smra ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyis bar du gcod pa'i chos su gsungs so zhes bya ba ni ma dag pa'i nyes dmigs bstan to //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag shes bzhin du brdzun du smra ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyis bar du gcod pa'i chos su gsungs so zhes bya ba ni ma dag pa'i nyes dmigs bstan to //
translated: Venerable ones, the Blessed One has said that deliberate lying is an obstacle. This is the teaching on the danger of impurity.

original: de bas na dge slong ltung ba byung ba rnam par dag par 'dod pas ltung ba yod pa dran zhing mthong ba mthol bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na dge slong ltung ba byung ba rnam par dag par 'dod pas ltung ba yod pa dran zhing mthong ba mthol bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, a monk who has incurred an offense and wishes to be purified should confess the offense that he remembers and sees.

original: mthol na bde ba la reg par gnas par 'gyur ro zhes bya bas ni dag pa'i phan yon bstan to //
analyzed: mthol na bde ba la reg par gnas par 'gyur ro zhes bya bas ni dag pa'i phan yon bstan to //
translated: This teaches the benefit of purification.🔽Venerable ones, I have recited the introduction to the Sūtra on the Foundation of Mindfulness.

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag bdag gis so sor thar pa'i mdo gdon pa'i gleng gzhi ni bton zin to zhes bya bas ni 'don pa'i mjug bsdu ba bstan to //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag bdag gis so sor thar pa'i mdo gdon pa'i gleng gzhi ni bton zin to zhes bya bas ni 'don pa'i mjug bsdu ba bstan to //
translated: This teaches the conclusion of the recitation.

original: de la bdag gis tshe dang ldan pa dag la ci 'di la khyed yongs su dag gam zhes dri'o ;
analyzed: de la bdag gis tshe dang ldan pa dag la ci 'di la khyed yongs su dag gam zhes dri'o ;
translated: There I ask the venerable ones, “Are you pure in this matter?”

original: / ci 'di la khyed yongs su dag gam zhes lan gnyis lan gsum du dri'o //
analyzed: / ci 'di la khyed yongs su dag gam zhes lan gnyis lan gsum du dri'o //
translated: I ask the second and third time, “Are you pure in this matter?”🔽If the venerable ones are pure in this, since there are no objections, then I will hold this to be so.

original: 'di la tshe dang ldan pa dag yongs su dag na 'di ltar cang mi smra bas de de bzhin du 'dzin to zhes bya bas ni gleng gzhi rnam par gzhag pa bsgrags par bya ba bstan to //
analyzed: 'di la tshe dang ldan pa dag yongs su dag na 'di ltar cang mi smra bas de de bzhin du 'dzin to zhes bya bas ni gleng gzhi rnam par gzhag pa bsgrags par bya ba bstan to //
translated: This teaches the proclamation of the arrangement of the introduction.

original: de la re zhig gleng gzhi rnam par gzhag pa'i lung dbog pa'i yan lag gi don bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de la re zhig gleng gzhi rnam par gzhag pa'i lung dbog pa'i yan lag gi don bshad par bya ste /
translated: Now, first I will explain the meaning of the branches of the transmission of the arrangement of the introduction.

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag bdag cag gso sbyong bya ste zhes bya ba ni de'i gnas dang / tshogs dang / tshogs mthun par gso sbyong bya ste zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag bdag cag gso sbyong bya ste zhes bya ba ni de'i gnas dang / tshogs dang / tshogs mthun par gso sbyong bya ste zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The phrase Venerable Ones, we will perform the poṣadha indicates the place, the assembly, and the harmonious assembly for performing the poṣadha.

original: rnam pa gang gis gso sbyong bya zhe na /
analyzed: rnam pa gang gis gso sbyong bya zhe na /
translated: By what method should the poṣadha be performed?

original: de'i phyir so sor thar pa'i mdo gdon pa gdon gyis zhes bya ba gsungs sems drang bor bsgrub pa dang / 'gal ba bzlog pa la sogs pa rnam pa gzhan gyis kyang tshul khrims gso bar byed pa yod pas de dag bsal ba'i phyir so sor thar ba'i mdo gdon pa rnam pa lnga po dag gdon gyis zhes bya bas bstan to //
analyzed: de'i phyir so sor thar pa'i mdo gdon pa gdon gyis zhes bya ba gsungs sems drang bor bsgrub pa dang / 'gal ba bzlog pa la sogs pa rnam pa gzhan gyis kyang tshul khrims gso bar byed pa yod pas de dag bsal ba'i phyir so sor thar ba'i mdo gdon pa rnam pa lnga po dag gdon gyis zhes bya bas bstan to //
translated: Therefore, it is said by reciting the Prātimokṣa Sūtra. Since there are other methods for purifying morality, such as establishing a sincere mind and turning away from contradictions, in order to eliminate those, it is taught by by reciting the five types of Prātimokṣa Sūtras.

original: so sor thar pa gdon pa ni dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan gyi las yin no //🔽des @186a * //🔽mi nus pa nyid na gnyis pa'i las yin no //
analyzed: so sor thar pa gdon pa ni dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan gyi las yin no // des @186a * // mi nus pa nyid na gnyis pa'i las yin no //
translated: Reciting the Prātimokṣa is the duty of the saṅgha's elder.🔽If he is unable to do it, it is the duty of the second elder.

original: des kyang mi nus pa nyid na gsum pa'i las yin no //
analyzed: des kyang mi nus pa nyid na gsum pa'i las yin no //
translated: If he too is unable, it is the duty of the third elder.

original: des kyang mi nus pa nyid yin na thams cad kyis res kyis gdon par bya'o //
analyzed: des kyang mi nus pa nyid yin na thams cad kyis res kyis gdon par bya'o //
translated: If he is still unable to do so, then all of them should recite it by turns.

original: res bab pa'i tshe des 'don mi nus na gzhan la bcol bar bya'o //
analyzed: res bab pa'i tshe des 'don mi nus na gzhan la bcol bar bya'o //
translated: If the one who is supposed to recite it is unable to do so at the proper time, he should ask someone else to do it for him.

original: de ma btub na dge 'dun gyis de la bcol bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ma btub na dge 'dun gyis de la bcol bar bya'o //
translated: If that is not possible, the Saṅgha should ask someone to do it.

original: 'don pa de dag gis tshig phyed kyang ma 'khrul bar legs par thon pa nyid yin na gdon gyi gzhan du mi 'chags so //
analyzed: 'don pa de dag gis tshig phyed kyang ma 'khrul bar legs par thon pa nyid yin na gdon gyi gzhan du mi 'chags so //
translated: If those who are reciting it are able to recite it well without confusing even a half-verse, they should not change the recitation.

original: 'don pa rdugs na lhags ma gzhan gyis gdon par bya'o //
analyzed: 'don pa rdugs na lhags ma gzhan gyis gdon par bya'o //
translated: If the recitation is faulty, it should be recited by someone else who has arrived later.

original: dus bu 'dzin pa yin na ji snyed kyis gzhung bsngos pa de snyed kyis phag tu bcad de 'don par bya'o //
analyzed: dus bu 'dzin pa yin na ji snyed kyis gzhung bsngos pa de snyed kyis phag tu bcad de 'don par bya'o //
translated: If it is a regular recitation, then as many verses as have been dedicated should be recited in private.

original: 'don par byed pas so sor thar pa'i mdo gdon pa rnam pa lnga po gleng gzhi gdon pa dang / pham par 'gyur ba gdon pa dang / dge 'dun lhag ma gdon pa dang / ma nges pa gdon pa dang / ril gyis gdon pa dag las gleng gzhi gdon pa na rdzogs pa kho nar mi gdon du mi rung ngo //
analyzed: 'don par byed pas so sor thar pa'i mdo gdon pa rnam pa lnga po gleng gzhi gdon pa dang / pham par 'gyur ba gdon pa dang / dge 'dun lhag ma gdon pa dang / ma nges pa gdon pa dang / ril gyis gdon pa dag las gleng gzhi gdon pa na rdzogs pa kho nar mi gdon du mi rung ngo //
translated: From among these, when reciting the introduction, it is not suitable to recite it in a way that is not complete.

original: gleng gzhi bton nas lhag ma rnams ni thos pa bsgrags pas kyang 'grub tu rung ngo //
analyzed: gleng gzhi bton nas lhag ma rnams ni thos pa bsgrags pas kyang 'grub tu rung ngo //
translated: After reciting the introduction, the remaining parts can be accomplished by proclaiming what has been heard.

original: de yang gleng gzhi bton nas pham par 'gyur ba gdon pa brtsams na pham par 'gyur ba'i sde tshan rdzogs par gdon dgos so //
analyzed: de yang gleng gzhi bton nas pham par 'gyur ba gdon pa brtsams na pham par 'gyur ba'i sde tshan rdzogs par gdon dgos so //
translated: If, after reciting the introduction, one begins to recite the defeating offenses, one must recite the class of defeating offenses in its entirety.

original: pham par 'gyur ba bton nas dge 'dun lhag ma 'don pa brtsams na dge 'dun lhag ma'i sde tshan yang rdzogs par gdon dgos so //
analyzed: pham par 'gyur ba bton nas dge 'dun lhag ma 'don pa brtsams na dge 'dun lhag ma'i sde tshan yang rdzogs par gdon dgos so //
translated: If, after reciting the defeating offenses, one begins to recite the residual offenses, one must also recite the class of residual offenses in its entirety.

original: dge 'dun lhag ma bton nas ma nges pa 'don pa brtsams na /
analyzed: dge 'dun lhag ma bton nas ma nges pa 'don pa brtsams na /
translated: If, after reciting the residual offenses, one begins to recite the undetermined offenses,

original: ma nges pa'i sde tshan yang rdzogs par gdon dgos so //
analyzed: ma nges pa'i sde tshan yang rdzogs par gdon dgos so //
translated: Also, the class of undetermined offenses must be recited in full.

original: pham par 'gyur ba dang dge 'dun lhag ma dang / ma nges pa yan chad kyi sde tshan ni 'don par mgo brtsams pa de'i sde tshan de nyid rdzogs par bya dgos so //
analyzed: pham par 'gyur ba dang dge 'dun lhag ma dang / ma nges pa yan chad kyi sde tshan ni 'don par mgo brtsams pa de'i sde tshan de nyid rdzogs par bya dgos so //
translated: If one begins to recite the class of offenses entailing expulsion, the class of serious offenses, or the class of undetermined offenses, one must complete the recitation of that class.

original: spang ba'i ltung byed man chad kyi sde tshan ni gdon par mgo brtsams na /
analyzed: spang ba'i ltung byed man chad kyi sde tshan ni gdon par mgo brtsams na /
translated: If one begins to recite the class of offenses of wrong conduct,

original: lhag ma so sor thar pa'i gzhung thams cad rdzogs par gdon dgos so //
analyzed: lhag ma so sor thar pa'i gzhung thams cad rdzogs par gdon dgos so //
translated: one must complete the recitation of the entire text of the Prātimokṣa, except for the concluding section.

original: ril gyis gdon pa zhes bya ba yang de nyid yin no //
analyzed: ril gyis gdon pa zhes bya ba yang de nyid yin no //
translated: This is also called “reciting the entire text.”

original: mgo brtsams pa'i sde tshan de nyid yang rdzogs par bya dgos pa de dag ma rdzogs na mi 'chags so //
analyzed: mgo brtsams pa'i sde tshan de nyid yang rdzogs par bya dgos pa de dag ma rdzogs na mi 'chags so //
translated: If one does not complete the class of offenses that one began to recite, one’s recitation is not valid.

original: 'jigs pa dang bcas pa nyid du 'gron du 'gro na don mthun pa de dag sdod du mi btub na 'gro ba bzhin du gdon par bya ste /
analyzed: 'jigs pa dang bcas pa nyid du 'gron du 'gro na don mthun pa de dag sdod du mi btub na 'gro ba bzhin du gdon par bya ste /
translated: If one is traveling with a group of people and some of them are unable to continue, one should recite the Prātimokṣa as if one were traveling alone.

original: 'di'i las ni 'dug pa nyid kyis bya'o zhes gsungs pa dmigs kyis bsal ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di'i las ni 'dug pa nyid kyis bya'o zhes gsungs pa dmigs kyis bsal ba yin no //
translated: The action of this is to be done by sitting, as it is said.

original: sgra mi 'dod mdor bsdus te gdon no //
analyzed: sgra mi 'dod mdor bsdus te gdon no //
translated: If one does not wish to recite the Sūtra in full, one should recite it in brief.

original: de tsam yang mi 'dod na byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
analyzed: de tsam yang mi 'dod na byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
translated: If one does not wish to do even that much, one should consecrate oneself.

original: chos ma yin pas 'don na @186b mi 'chags te 'don par bya ba dang / de'i tshad dang dus dang / 'don par byed pa rnams de kho na bzhin nye bar ma bzung ba ni 'di ni chos ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: chos ma yin pas 'don na @186b mi 'chags te 'don par bya ba dang / de'i tshad dang dus dang / 'don par byed pa rnams de kho na bzhin nye bar ma bzung ba ni 'di ni chos ma yin pa'o //
translated: If one recites it in an un-dharmic way, it is not a recitation. The recitation is not done by not taking up the recitation, its measure, and the time for it in the same way.

original: gdon par bya ba de kho na bzhin nye bar ma bzung ba ni so sor thar pa'i mdo las gzhan pa phran tshegs la sogs pa gdon pa'o //
analyzed: gdon par bya ba de kho na bzhin nye bar ma bzung ba ni so sor thar pa'i mdo las gzhan pa phran tshegs la sogs pa gdon pa'o //
translated: The recitation is not done by not taking up the recitation in the same way as in the Prātimokṣa Sūtra, but by reciting the Kṣudraka and so on.

original: de'i tshad kho na bzhin nye bar ma bzung ba ni /
analyzed: de'i tshad kho na bzhin nye bar ma bzung ba ni /
translated: The measure of that is not taken up in the same way.

original: gleng gzhi mi gdon cing lhag ma rnams kyang thos pa bsgrags pas sgrub par mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: gleng gzhi mi gdon cing lhag ma rnams kyang thos pa bsgrags pas sgrub par mi byed pa'o //
translated: The nidāna is not recited, and the rest is not established by proclaiming the hearing.

original: de'i dus kho na bzhin nye bar ma bzung ba ni gso sbyong gi dus las gzhan pa'i dus su 'don pa'o //
analyzed: de'i dus kho na bzhin nye bar ma bzung ba ni gso sbyong gi dus las gzhan pa'i dus su 'don pa'o //
translated: Not taking it up at the proper time means reciting it at a time other than the poṣadha time.

original: 'don par byed pa de kho na bzhin nye bar ma bzung ba ni gang zag bsnyen par rdzogs pa dang / mtshan dang / lta ba dang / tshul khrims mthun pa dag las gzhan pas 'don pa'o //🔽dge slong gcig pu gnas na des gtsug lag khang chag chag gdab par bya /
analyzed: 'don par byed pa de kho na bzhin nye bar ma bzung ba ni gang zag bsnyen par rdzogs pa dang / mtshan dang / lta ba dang / tshul khrims mthun pa dag las gzhan pas 'don pa'o // dge slong gcig pu gnas na des gtsug lag khang chag chag gdab par bya /
translated: Not taking it up in the proper way means reciting it by someone other than the one who is fully ordained, who has the same view and moral discipline.

original: phyag dar bya'o //🔽ba lang gi lci ba sar pa'i byug pa bya /
analyzed: phyag dar bya'o // ba lang gi lci ba sar pa'i byug pa bya /
translated: If a monk is staying alone, he should sprinkle and sweep the temple.🔽He should anoint it with cow dung.

original: seng ge'i khri bsham par bya stan bsham par bya //
analyzed: seng ge'i khri bsham par bya stan bsham par bya //
translated: He should set up the lion throne and the seat.

original: mar me gzugs par bya'o //
analyzed: mar me gzugs par bya'o //
translated: He should light lamps.

original: chos nyan du gzhug pa dag bya'o //
analyzed: chos nyan du gzhug pa dag bya'o //
translated: He should prepare the listeners.

original: de'i 'og tu phyogs mtshams mthon por 'dug ste phyogs bzhir blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu phyogs mtshams mthon por 'dug ste phyogs bzhir blta bar bya'o //
translated: Then, sitting high in an elevated place, he should look in the four directions.

original: der dag slong yongs su dag pa lta ba mthun pa dag 'od na 'di skad ces tshe dang ldan pa dag myur ba myur bar shog shig / deng dge 'dun gyi gso sbyong bco lnga pa dag yin no zhes brjod par bya zhing /
analyzed: der dag slong yongs su dag pa lta ba mthun pa dag 'od na 'di skad ces tshe dang ldan pa dag myur ba myur bar shog shig / deng dge 'dun gyi gso sbyong bco lnga pa dag yin no zhes brjod par bya zhing /
translated: Today is the fifteenth, the day of the poṣadha of the saṅgha.’

original: de dag dang lhan cig 'dug ste gso sbyong bya'o //
analyzed: de dag dang lhan cig 'dug ste gso sbyong bya'o //
translated: They should sit together and perform the poṣadha.

original: gal te 'grub na de ltar na legs /
analyzed: gal te 'grub na de ltar na legs /
translated: If that is accomplished, it is good.

original: ci ste mi 'grub na dge slong des byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
analyzed: ci ste mi 'grub na dge slong des byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
translated: But if it is not accomplished, that bhikṣu should consecrate it.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: des rang gi stan la 'dug ste 'di ltar sems bskyed par bya zhing tshig tu yang brjod par bya'o //🔽deng dge 'dun gyi gso sbyong bco lnga pa yin la /
analyzed: des rang gi stan la 'dug ste 'di ltar sems bskyed par bya zhing tshig tu yang brjod par bya'o // deng dge 'dun gyi gso sbyong bco lnga pa yin la /
translated: He should sit on his own seat and generate this thought and speak these words:🔽‘Today is the fifteenth, the day of the poṣadha of the saṅgha.

original: bdag dge slong ming 'di zhes bya ba'i yang gso sbyong bco lnga pa lags te /
analyzed: bdag dge slong ming 'di zhes bya ba'i yang gso sbyong bco lnga pa lags te /
translated: Today is also the fifteenth, the day of my poṣadha.

original: bdag dge slong ming 'di zhes bya ba'i bar chad kyi chos rnams yongs su dag go zhes kyang bdag smras bdag yongs su dag par lha rnams kyis gzung du gsol /
analyzed: bdag dge slong ming 'di zhes bya ba'i bar chad kyi chos rnams yongs su dag go zhes kyang bdag smras bdag yongs su dag par lha rnams kyis gzung du gsol /
translated: I, the monk named so-and-so, am pure with regard to the conditions that are obstacles.

original: bdag dge slong ming 'di zhes bya bas tshul khrims kyi phung po yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir deng gso sbyong byin gyis brlab po //
analyzed: bdag dge slong ming 'di zhes bya bas tshul khrims kyi phung po yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir deng gso sbyong byin gyis brlab po //
translated: I, the monk named so-and-so, will bless the purification and restoration today in order to complete the aggregate of morality.

original: gang gi tshe dge 'dun tshogs pa rnyed pa de'i tshe dge 'dun dang lhan cig tu gso sbyong rgya cher nyams su myong bar bya zhing so sor thar pa'i mdo gdon par bya'o //🔽de bzhin du lan gnyis @187a * //
analyzed: gang gi tshe dge 'dun tshogs pa rnyed pa de'i tshe dge 'dun dang lhan cig tu gso sbyong rgya cher nyams su myong bar bya zhing so sor thar pa'i mdo gdon par bya'o // de bzhin du lan gnyis @187a * //
translated: When I find an assembly of the Saṅgha, at that time I will experience the purification and restoration in detail together with the Saṅgha and recite the Sūtra of Individual Liberation.

original: lan gsum du bzlas /
analyzed: lan gsum du bzlas /
translated: In the same way, repeat a second and a third time.

original: gang na dge slong gnyis 'khod pa der ni rim pa bzhin du bya zhing dus kyi bar du bsdad de ma grub na ni ma dun tsog tsog por 'dug ste /
analyzed: gang na dge slong gnyis 'khod pa der ni rim pa bzhin du bya zhing dus kyi bar du bsdad de ma grub na ni ma dun tsog tsog por 'dug ste /
translated: Where there are two monks, there one should act in order, and stay for a while. If it is not accomplished, then sitting cross-legged,

original: gcig la gcig 'di skad ces brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: gcig la gcig 'di skad ces brjod par bya'o //
translated: one should say to the other:

original: btsun pa'am tshe dang ldan pa dgongs su gsol /
analyzed: btsun pa'am tshe dang ldan pa dgongs su gsol /
translated: Venerable or long-lived one, please pay attention.

original: deng dge 'dun gyi gso sbyong bco lnga pa lags pa /
analyzed: deng dge 'dun gyi gso sbyong bco lnga pa lags pa /
translated: Today is the fifteenth day of the poṣadha of the saṃgha.

original: bdag dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba'i gso sbyong yang bco lnga pa lags te /
analyzed: bdag dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba'i gso sbyong yang bco lnga pa lags te /
translated: For me, the monk named so-and-so, it is also the fifteenth day of the poṣadha.

original: bdag dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba'i bar chad kyi chos rnams yongs su dag go zhes kyang bdag nyid mchi'o //
analyzed: bdag dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba'i bar chad kyi chos rnams yongs su dag go zhes kyang bdag nyid mchi'o //
translated: I will declare that I am pure with regard to the factors of obstruction.

original: bdag yongs su dag par btsun pa'am tshe dang ldan pas gzung du gsol /
analyzed: bdag yongs su dag par btsun pa'am tshe dang ldan pas gzung du gsol /
translated: Please accept me as pure, Venerable or Long-lived One.

original: bdag dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi bas tshul khrims kyi phung po yongs su rdzogs par bgyi ba'i slad du deng gso sbyong byin gyis brlab bo //
analyzed: bdag dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi bas tshul khrims kyi phung po yongs su rdzogs par bgyi ba'i slad du deng gso sbyong byin gyis brlab bo //
translated: For me, the monk named so-and-so, I will consecrate the poṣadha in order to complete the aggregate of morality.

original: gang gi tshe dge 'dun tshogs pa rnyed pa de'i tshe dge 'dun dang lhan cig tu gso sbyong rgya cher nyams su myong bar bgyi zhing so sor thar pa'i mdo gdon pa gdon par bgyi'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe dge 'dun tshogs pa rnyed pa de'i tshe dge 'dun dang lhan cig tu gso sbyong rgya cher nyams su myong bar bgyi zhing so sor thar pa'i mdo gdon pa gdon par bgyi'o //
translated: When I find an assembly of the saṃgha, at that time I will experience the poṣadha extensively together with the saṃgha and recite the Prātimokṣa Sūtra.

original: de bzhin du lan gnyis lan gsum du bzlas /
analyzed: de bzhin du lan gnyis lan gsum du bzlas /
translated: Likewise, he should repeat this a second and a third time.

original: gang na dge slong gsum yod pa der ni rim pa bzhin du byas shing dus kyi bar du bsdad de /
analyzed: gang na dge slong gsum yod pa der ni rim pa bzhin du byas shing dus kyi bar du bsdad de /
translated: In a place where there are three monks, they should do it in order, and they should wait for the time.

original: ma grub na rgan rims bzhin gral du 'khod de rim gyis byin gyis brlabs pa'i sngags kyang snga ma nyid brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: ma grub na rgan rims bzhin gral du 'khod de rim gyis byin gyis brlabs pa'i sngags kyang snga ma nyid brjod par bya'o //
translated: If it is not accomplished, they should sit in order of seniority and do it in order. They should recite the mantra of consecration as before.

original: gang na dge slong bzhi 'khod pa der ni de rnams kyis gsol ba byas te gso sbyong bya zhing der nad pa'i yongs su dag pa ni blang bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: gang na dge slong bzhi 'khod pa der ni de rnams kyis gsol ba byas te gso sbyong bya zhing der nad pa'i yongs su dag pa ni blang bar mi bya'o //
translated: In a place where there are four monks, they should request it and do the poṣadha. In that case, the purity of the sick person should not be taken.

original: gang na dge slong lnga'am lhag pa 'khod pa der ni de rnams kyis gsol ba byas te gso sbyong bya zhing der ni nad pa'i yongs su dag pa yang blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: gang na dge slong lnga'am lhag pa 'khod pa der ni de rnams kyis gsol ba byas te gso sbyong bya zhing der ni nad pa'i yongs su dag pa yang blang bar bya'o //
translated: In a place where there are five or more monks, they should request it and do the poṣadha. In that case, the purity of the sick person should be taken.

original: khyed cag su la ltung ba yod pa des mthol cig ces bya ba ni bshags par bya ba yod na yang bshags par bya /
analyzed: khyed cag su la ltung ba yod pa des mthol cig ces bya ba ni bshags par bya ba yod na yang bshags par bya /
translated: Whoever has a downfall should confess it.

original: bsdams par bya ba yod na yang bsdam par bya /
analyzed: bsdams par bya ba yod na yang bsdam par bya /
translated: If there is something to be restrained, then one should restrain it.

original: byin gyis brlabs pa yod na yang byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
analyzed: byin gyis brlabs pa yod na yang byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
translated: If there is something to be blessed, then one should bless it.

original: 'di la gleng gzhi rnam par gzhag pa'i tshul ji lta bu zhe na gso sbyong gi gnas su 'du ba'i mdun rol kho nar gso sbyong snga ma 'das pa'i mtha' tshun chad kyi zla ba phyed cing ltung ba las so sor brtag par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di la gleng gzhi rnam par gzhag pa'i tshul ji lta bu zhe na gso sbyong gi gnas su 'du ba'i mdun rol kho nar gso sbyong snga ma 'das pa'i mtha' tshun chad kyi zla ba phyed cing ltung ba las so sor brtag par bya ste /
translated: Here, what is the method of positing the nidāna? Before the assembly gathers at the site of the poṣadha, one should examine for downfalls in the previous half month up to the end of the previous poṣadha.

original: ltung ba shes pa bshags pa'am /
analyzed: ltung ba shes pa bshags pa'am /
translated: If one knows of a downfall, one should confess it

original: bsdams pa'am / byin gyis brlabs pas phyir bcos te las kyi gnas su 'du bar bya'o //
analyzed: bsdams pa'am / byin gyis brlabs pas phyir bcos te las kyi gnas su 'du bar bya'o //
translated: or restrain oneself or bless oneself and then go to the site of the rite.

original: de'i cho ga dang sngags ni 'di ltar bya ste /🔽ltung byed 'ba' zhig pa'am /🔽so sor bshags @187b par bya ba'am /
analyzed: de'i cho ga dang sngags ni 'di ltar bya ste / ltung byed 'ba' zhig pa'am / so sor bshags @187b par bya ba'am /
translated: The rite and mantra for that are as follows:🔽If one knows of a simple downfall,🔽a downfall that is to be individually confessed,

original: bshags par bya ba'i nyes byas gang yang rung ba zhig shes na /
analyzed: bshags par bya ba'i nyes byas gang yang rung ba zhig shes na /
translated: or any kind of downfall that is to be confessed,🔽one should confess it.

original: des mchil lhag ma gnyis phud nas dge slong bsnyen par rdzogs pa rang bzhin du gnas pa lta ba dang mtshan mthun pa mtshams kyi nang na 'dug pa ltung ba ming dang rigs las mi mthun pa gcig gi mdun du tsog pur 'dug ste ;
analyzed: des mchil lhag ma gnyis phud nas dge slong bsnyen par rdzogs pa rang bzhin du gnas pa lta ba dang mtshan mthun pa mtshams kyi nang na 'dug pa ltung ba ming dang rigs las mi mthun pa gcig gi mdun du tsog pur 'dug ste ;
translated: Having discarded the two remaining morsels of food, he should sit down in front of a fully ordained monk who is of the same view and in the same region, who is naturally abiding, and who is not in accord with the name and type of the downfall.

original: thal mo sbyar ba btud nas ltung ba de'i sde tshan gyi ming dang gang byung ba'i rigs smos te cig car mthol ba dang bshags pa byar rung ngo //
analyzed: thal mo sbyar ba btud nas ltung ba de'i sde tshan gyi ming dang gang byung ba'i rigs smos te cig car mthol ba dang bshags pa byar rung ngo //
translated: He should sit down with his palms together in front of his heart, bow down, and at once confess and reveal the name of the class of downfall and the type of downfall that has occurred.

original: de'i sngags ni 'di skad ces brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i sngags ni 'di skad ces brjod par bya'o //
translated: The mantra for that is recited as follows:

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag dgongs su gsol /🔽bdag dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba la ltung ba ming dang rigs 'di lta bu 'di byung ste /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag dgongs su gsol / bdag dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba la ltung ba ming dang rigs 'di lta bu 'di byung ste /
translated: “Venerable ones, please give heed.🔽I, the fully ordained monk named so-and-so, have incurred a downfall of such and such a name and type.

original: bdag dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi bas ltung ba de dag pa'i mtha' tshun chad nas bzung ste /
analyzed: bdag dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi bas ltung ba de dag pa'i mtha' tshun chad nas bzung ste /
translated: I, the fully ordained monk named so-and-so, from this day forward

original: tshe dang ldan pa'i mdun du mthol lo mi 'chab bo //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa'i mdun du mthol lo mi 'chab bo //
translated: will reveal and not conceal the end of that downfall in the presence of the venerable ones.”

original: mthol zhing bshags na bdag bde ba la reg par gnas par 'gyur gyi ma mthol ma bshags na ni mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mthol zhing bshags na bdag bde ba la reg par gnas par 'gyur gyi ma mthol ma bshags na ni mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If I confess it, I will be able to remain in a state of happiness, but if I do not confess it, I will not be able to remain in a state of happiness.

original: de bzhin du lan gnyis lan gsum du bzlas /🔽nyan pas ltung ba mthong ngam zhes dri zhing 'chags pas mthong ngo zhes brjod par bya /
analyzed: de bzhin du lan gnyis lan gsum du bzlas / nyan pas ltung ba mthong ngam zhes dri zhing 'chags pas mthong ngo zhes brjod par bya /
translated: ” In this way, repeat it a second and a third time.🔽The listener asks, “Do you see the downfall?” and the one confessing says, “I see it.”

original: nyan pas phyin chad sdom mam zhes smra zhing 'chags pas sdom mo zhes brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: nyan pas phyin chad sdom mam zhes smra zhing 'chags pas sdom mo zhes brjod par bya ste /
translated: The listener says, “Will you restrain yourself from now on?” and the one confessing says, “I will restrain myself.”

original: de bzhin du lan gnyis lan gsum du bzlas /
analyzed: de bzhin du lan gnyis lan gsum du bzlas /
translated: In this way, repeat it a second and a third time.

original: de'i rjes la nyan pas thabs yin no zhes bya zhing 'chags pas legs so zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i rjes la nyan pas thabs yin no zhes bya zhing 'chags pas legs so zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: After that, the listener says, “It is well,” and the one confessing says, “It is good.”

original: de'i dge slong ltung ba la dogs pa dang yid gnyis za bar gyur na dge slong des dge slong mdo sde 'dzin pa dang 'dul ba 'dzin pa dang ma mo 'dzin pa dag la dris te ltung ba la dogs pa dang yid gnyis bsal nas /
analyzed: de'i dge slong ltung ba la dogs pa dang yid gnyis za bar gyur na dge slong des dge slong mdo sde 'dzin pa dang 'dul ba 'dzin pa dang ma mo 'dzin pa dag la dris te ltung ba la dogs pa dang yid gnyis bsal nas /
translated: If the monk who is listening to the confession has doubts or uncertainty about the downfall, he should ask the monk who is confessing the downfall, and if necessary, he should consult the Vinaya experts, the experts on the scriptures, and the experts on the Mātṛkā.

original: dge slong gi mdun du chos bzhin du phyir bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong gi mdun du chos bzhin du phyir bya'o //
translated: He should confess it in the presence of a monk in accordance with the Dharma.

original: bsdams par bya ba'i nyes pa gang yang rung ba zhig shes na /
analyzed: bsdams par bya ba'i nyes pa gang yang rung ba zhig shes na /
translated: If he knows of any offense that is to be restrained,

original: rang gi sems kyis bsdams par bya'o //
analyzed: rang gi sems kyis bsdams par bya'o //
translated: he should restrain himself mentally.

original: dge 'dun lhag ma dang / nyes pa sbom po dang / spang ba'i ltung byed kyi ltung ba gang yang rung ba zhig shes na byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun lhag ma dang / nyes pa sbom po dang / spang ba'i ltung byed kyi ltung ba gang yang rung ba zhig shes na byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
translated: If he knows of any offense that is a serious transgression, a downfall that requires relinquishment, or a downfall that is a mistake, he should be consecrated.

original: 'di ltar bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar bya ste /
translated: This is how it is done.

original: des mchil lham gnyis phud nas /
analyzed: des mchil lham gnyis phud nas /
translated: He should take off his two sandals

original: dge slong bsnyen par rdzogs pa rang bzhin du gnas pa /
analyzed: dge slong bsnyen par rdzogs pa rang bzhin du gnas pa /
translated: in the presence of a fully ordained monk who is natural,

original: lta ba dang mtshan mthun pa /🔽mtshams kyi nang na 'dug pa ltung ba ming dang rigs las mi mthun pa gcig gi mdun du tsog pur 'dug ste /
