analyzed: bdag cag dge 'dun thams cad ni ltung ba la dogs pa dang yid gnyis dang bcas par gyur na /
translated: Since all of us in the saṃgha have doubt and uncertainty about an offense,

original: gang gi mdun du bdag cag ltung ba de chos bzhin du slar bgyi ba bdag cag las dge slong gnas gzhan du mchis la /
analyzed: gang gi mdun du bdag cag ltung ba de chos bzhin du slar bgyi ba bdag cag las dge slong gnas gzhan du mchis la /
translated: in whose presence should we, according to the Dharma, restore that offense? Since one monk in our saṃgha has gone to another place,

original: dge slong mdo sde 'dzin pa dang / 'dul ba 'dzin pa dang / ma mo 'dzin pa rnams la dris te /
analyzed: dge slong mdo sde 'dzin pa dang / 'dul ba 'dzin pa dang / ma mo 'dzin pa rnams la dris te /
translated: He should ask the monks who are experts on the discourses, experts on the monastic code, and experts on the scriptures.

original: dogs pa dang yid gnyis bsal ba nas ltung ba de chos bzhin du slar bgyid par spro ba su yang ma mchis na /
analyzed: dogs pa dang yid gnyis bsal ba nas ltung ba de chos bzhin du slar bgyid par spro ba su yang ma mchis na /
translated: If no one is willing to clear up his doubts and uncertainties and to restore that downfall in accordance with the Teaching,

original: gal te dge 'dun gyi dus la bab cing bzod na /
analyzed: gal te dge 'dun gyi dus la bab cing bzod na /
translated: then if the time is right and the saṅgha accepts it,

original: dge 'dun gyis gnang bar mdzod cig dang / dge 'dun gyis deng ltung ba de byin gyi brlabs te /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyis gnang bar mdzod cig dang / dge 'dun gyis deng ltung ba de byin gyi brlabs te /
translated: the saṅgha should consecrate that downfall.

original: gso sbyong mdzad la /
analyzed: gso sbyong mdzad la /
translated: It should then do the purification ceremony.

original: slad kyis dge slong mdo sde 'dzin pa dang / 'dul ba 'dzin pa dang / ma mo 'dzin pa rnams la dris te dogs pa dang yid gnyis bsal la ltung ba de chos bzhin du slar mdzad do //
analyzed: slad kyis dge slong mdo sde 'dzin pa dang / 'dul ba 'dzin pa dang / ma mo 'dzin pa rnams la dris te dogs pa dang yid gnyis bsal la ltung ba de chos bzhin du slar mdzad do //
translated: Later, it should ask the monks who are experts on the discourses, experts on the monastic code, and experts on the scriptures to clear up its doubts and uncertainties and to restore that downfall in accordance with the Teaching.

original: 'di ni gsol ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni gsol ba'o //
translated: This is the motion.

original: gso sbyong bco lnga pa de nyid la dge 'dun thams cad ltung ba dang bcas pa'i phyir rtsod par gyur na /
analyzed: gso sbyong bco lnga pa de nyid la dge 'dun thams cad ltung ba dang bcas pa'i phyir rtsod par gyur na /
translated: If on that fifteenth day of the fortnight the entire saṅgha has downfalls, and there is a dispute,

original: gsol ba 'ba' zhig gi las kyis byin gyis brlabs te gso sbyong bya'o //
analyzed: gsol ba 'ba' zhig gi las kyis byin gyis brlabs te gso sbyong bya'o //
translated: He should then perform the poṣadha rite by means of the rite of one motion alone.

original: 'di ltar bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar bya ste /
translated: This is how it is done.

original: gso sbyong bco lnga pa de nyid la dge slong gnyug mar gnas pa gcig pu ma gtogs pa dge 'dun thams cad ltung ba dang bcas par gyur na /
analyzed: gso sbyong bco lnga pa de nyid la dge slong gnyug mar gnas pa gcig pu ma gtogs pa dge 'dun thams cad ltung ba dang bcas par gyur na /
translated: On that very fifteenth day of the fortnight, if all the members of the saṅgha except for one resident monk have fallen,

original: dge slong de dge slong gtam 'dres pa dang / phebs par smra ba dang / smos 'drin dang / 'grogs pa shes gang yin pa'i drung du song ste /
analyzed: dge slong de dge slong gtam 'dres pa dang / phebs par smra ba dang / smos 'drin dang / 'grogs pa shes gang yin pa'i drung du song ste /
translated: that monk should approach a monk with whom he can converse, who is frank, who is a friend, and who is familiar,

original: ci nas kyang dge slong gzhan dag dang ltung ba 'chags par 'gyur ba de ltar bya'o //
analyzed: ci nas kyang dge slong gzhan dag dang ltung ba 'chags par 'gyur ba de ltar bya'o //
translated: and he should act in such a way that the other monk confesses his downfall.

original: gleng ba dang dran par bya'o //
analyzed: gleng ba dang dran par bya'o //
translated: He should remind him.

original: gal te grub na de lta na legs /
analyzed: gal te grub na de lta na legs /
translated: If that is successful, all is well.

original: ci ste ma grub cing dge 'dun thams cad ltung ba'i phyir rtsod par gyur na /
analyzed: ci ste ma grub cing dge 'dun thams cad ltung ba'i phyir rtsod par gyur na /
translated: But if that is not successful and the entire saṅgha is in dispute over the downfall,

original: dge slong gcig gis gsol ba 'ba' zhig gis las kyis byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong gcig gis gsol ba 'ba' zhig gis las kyis byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
translated: then a single monk should perform the rite of consecration by means of the rite of one motion alone.

original: 'di ltar bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar bya ste /
translated: This is how it is done.

original: 'dug la 'di skad ces brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dug la 'di skad ces brjod par bya'o //
translated: He should say this to them:

original: dge 'dun btsun pa rnams gsan du gsol /
analyzed: dge 'dun btsun pa rnams gsan du gsol /
translated: “Venerable Saṅgha, please listen!

original: deng dge 'dun gyi gso sbyong bco lnga pa lags la /
analyzed: deng dge 'dun gyi gso sbyong bco lnga pa lags la /
translated: Today is the fifteenth day of the Poṣadha of the Saṅgha,

original: bdag cag dge 'dun thams cad ni ltung ba'i slad du rtsod par gyur na /
analyzed: bdag cag dge 'dun thams cad ni ltung ba'i slad du rtsod par gyur na /
translated: and we all of the Saṅgha are in dispute over a downfall.

original: gal te dge 'dun gyi dus la bab cing bzod na /
analyzed: gal te dge 'dun gyi dus la bab cing bzod na /
translated: If it seems appropriate to the Saṅgha,

original: dge 'dun gyis gnang bar mdzod @190a * //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyis gnang bar mdzod @190a * //
translated: the Saṅgha should agree.

original: cig dang / dge 'dun gyis deng ltung ba'i slad du rtsod pa de byin gyis brlabs te gso sbyong mdzad la /
analyzed: cig dang / dge 'dun gyis deng ltung ba'i slad du rtsod pa de byin gyis brlabs te gso sbyong mdzad la /
translated: The Saṅgha will consecrate the dispute over the downfall today and do the Poṣadha.

original: slad kyis dge slong mdo sde 'dzin pa dang / 'dul ba 'dzin pa dang / ma mo 'dzin pa rnams la dris te /
analyzed: slad kyis dge slong mdo sde 'dzin pa dang / 'dul ba 'dzin pa dang / ma mo 'dzin pa rnams la dris te /
translated: Later, we will ask the bhikṣus who hold the sūtras, who hold the vinaya, and who hold the mātṛkās.

original: rtsod pa zhi bar bgyis la ltung ba de chos bzhin du slar mdzad do ;
analyzed: rtsod pa zhi bar bgyis la ltung ba de chos bzhin du slar mdzad do ;
translated: We will settle the dispute and make amends for the downfall in accordance with the Dharma.”

original: /'di ni gsol ba'o //
analyzed: /'di ni gsol ba'o //
translated: This is the motion.

original: gso sbyong bco lnga pa de nyid la /
analyzed: gso sbyong bco lnga pa de nyid la /
translated: On that very fifteenth day of the Poṣadha,

original: dge 'dun thams cad ltung ba la nges pa nyid ma yin par gyur na /
analyzed: dge 'dun thams cad ltung ba la nges pa nyid ma yin par gyur na /
translated: if it is not certain that all of the Saṅgha have a downfall,

original: gsol ba 'ba' zhig gi las kyis byin gyis brlabs te gso sbyong bya'o //
analyzed: gsol ba 'ba' zhig gi las kyis byin gyis brlabs te gso sbyong bya'o //
translated: He should then perform the poṣadha rite, having been consecrated by the work of supplicating alone.

original: 'di ltar bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar bya ste /
translated: This is how it is done.

original: gso sbyong bco lnga pa de nyid la /
analyzed: gso sbyong bco lnga pa de nyid la /
translated: On that very fifteenth poṣadha day,

original: dge slong glo bur du 'ongs pa gcig pu ma gtogs pa dge 'dun thams cad ltung ba dang bcas par gyur na /
analyzed: dge slong glo bur du 'ongs pa gcig pu ma gtogs pa dge 'dun thams cad ltung ba dang bcas par gyur na /
translated: if all the saṅgha members except for a single newly arrived bhikṣu have transgressed,

original: dge slong des dge slong gtam 'dres pa dang / phebs par smra ba dang / smos 'drin dang 'grogs bshes gang yin pa de'i drung du song ste /
analyzed: dge slong des dge slong gtam 'dres pa dang / phebs par smra ba dang / smos 'drin dang 'grogs bshes gang yin pa de'i drung du song ste /
translated: that bhikṣu should approach a bhikṣu with whom he is familiar, who is frank, who is a friend, and who is an acquaintance,

original: ji nas kyang dge slong gzhan dag kyang 'chags par 'gyur ba de ltar gleng ba dang dran par bya'o //
analyzed: ji nas kyang dge slong gzhan dag kyang 'chags par 'gyur ba de ltar gleng ba dang dran par bya'o //
translated: and he should speak and remind him in such a way that other bhikṣus will also confess.

original: gal te grub na de lta na legs /
analyzed: gal te grub na de lta na legs /
translated: If that is accomplished, it is good.

original: ci ste mi 'grub cing dge 'dun thams cad ltung ba de ni gang yin ltung ba de las ji ltar ldang bar 'gyur zhes nges pa nyid ma yin par gyur na /
analyzed: ci ste mi 'grub cing dge 'dun thams cad ltung ba de ni gang yin ltung ba de las ji ltar ldang bar 'gyur zhes nges pa nyid ma yin par gyur na /
translated: But if it is not accomplished and it is not certain which one is the transgression and how to rise up from that transgression,

original: dge slong gcig gis gsol ba 'ba' zhig gi las kyis byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong gcig gis gsol ba 'ba' zhig gi las kyis byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
translated: One monk should consecrate it with a single proclamation.

original: 'di ltar bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar bya ste /
translated: It is done like this.

original: 'dug la 'di skad ces brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dug la 'di skad ces brjod par bya'o //
translated: Sitting down, he should say this:

original: dge 'dun btsun pa rnams gsan du gsol //
analyzed: dge 'dun btsun pa rnams gsan du gsol //
translated: “Honored Sangha, please listen!

original: deng dge 'dun gyi gso sbyong bco lnga pa lags la /🔽bdag cag dge 'dun thams cad ni ltung ba la nges pa nyid ma yin par gyur na gal te dge 'dun gyi dus la bab cing bzod na dge 'dun gyis gnang bar mdzod cig dang / dge 'dun gyis deng ltung ba la nges pa nyid ma lags pa de byin gyis brlabs te gso sbyong mdzad la slad kyis dge slong mdo sde 'dzin pa dang /
analyzed: deng dge 'dun gyi gso sbyong bco lnga pa lags la / bdag cag dge 'dun thams cad ni ltung ba la nges pa nyid ma yin par gyur na gal te dge 'dun gyi dus la bab cing bzod na dge 'dun gyis gnang bar mdzod cig dang / dge 'dun gyis deng ltung ba la nges pa nyid ma lags pa de byin gyis brlabs te gso sbyong mdzad la slad kyis dge slong mdo sde 'dzin pa dang /
translated: Today is the fifteenth day of the poṣadha of the Sangha.🔽If the time of the Sangha has come and it is acceptable to the Sangha, then let the Sangha agree to the Sangha consecrating today the uncertainty about the downfalls.

original: 'dul ba 'dzin pa dang / ma mo 'dzin pa rnams la dris te nges pa nyid ma lags pa bsal la ltung ba de chos bzhin du slar mdzad do //
analyzed: 'dul ba 'dzin pa dang / ma mo 'dzin pa rnams la dris te nges pa nyid ma lags pa bsal la ltung ba de chos bzhin du slar mdzad do //
translated: Later, the monks who are holders of the sūtra, holders of the Vinaya, and holders of the mātṛkā will ask them and clear up the uncertainty. They will make amends for the downfalls in accordance with the Dharma.

original: 'di ni gsol ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni gsol ba'o //
translated: This is the motion.

original: ltung ba med na cang ma smra shig ces bya ba ni bshags par bya ba dang / bsdams par bya ba dang / byin gyis brlab par bya ba'i ltung ba med na de dag phyir bcos pa'i bya ba med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ltung ba med na cang ma smra shig ces bya ba ni bshags par bya ba dang / bsdams par bya ba dang / byin gyis brlab par bya ba'i ltung ba med na de dag phyir bcos pa'i bya ba med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means that if there are no downfalls to be confessed, to be restrained from, or to be blessed, then there is no need to perform the ritual for restoring them.🔽If you do not say anything, I will understand that you are pure.

original: cang mi smra na bdag gis tshe dang ldan pa dag yongs su dag @190b par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni de ltar na 'khor rnam par dag pa yin pas bdag gis khyed cag gso sbyong gi snod du gyur par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha
analyzed: cang mi smra na bdag gis tshe dang ldan pa dag yongs su dag @190b par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni de ltar na 'khor rnam par dag pa yin pas bdag gis khyed cag gso sbyong gi snod du gyur par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha
translated: This means that since the assembly is thus pure, I will understand that you are vessels for the purification and restoration.🔽In this way, the basis is established.

original: tshig go // de ltar gleng gzhi rnam par gzhag pa'i rgyu lung 'bogs pa ji skad bstan pa de las tshe dang ldan pa dag bdag cag gso sbyong bya ste /
analyzed: tshig go // de ltar gleng gzhi rnam par gzhag pa'i rgyu lung 'bogs pa ji skad bstan pa de las tshe dang ldan pa dag bdag cag gso sbyong bya ste /
translated: The reason is taught: Venerable ones, let us perform the purification and restoration.

original: so sor thar pa'i mdo gdon pa gdon gyis khyed cag su la ltung ba yod pa des mthol cig ces bya ba'i lung dbog pa 'di'i gleng gzhi rnam par gzhag pa bsgrags par bya ba ni 'og nas de la bdag gis tshe dang ldan pa dag ci 'di
analyzed: so sor thar pa'i mdo gdon pa gdon gyis khyed cag su la ltung ba yod pa des mthol cig ces bya ba'i lung dbog pa 'di'i gleng gzhi rnam par gzhag pa bsgrags par bya ba ni 'og nas de la bdag gis tshe dang ldan pa dag ci 'di
translated: This is the basis of the proclamation.🔽The Vinaya says:🔽I ask the venerable ones, are you pure in this?🔽I ask a second time, are you pure in this?

original: la khyod yongs su dag gam zhes lan gnyis lan gsum du dri'o zhes 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: la khyod yongs su dag gam zhes lan gnyis lan gsum du dri'o zhes 'byung ba yin no //
translated: I ask a third time, are you pure in this?🔽Those who have no fault should remain silent.🔽This is the basis of the proclamation.🔽The Vinaya says:

original: ltung ba med na cang ma smra shig ces bya ba ni lung dbog pa di'i gleng gzhi rnam par gzhag par bsgrags par bya ba ni 'og nas 'di ltar tshe dang ldan pa dag pa yongs su dag na zhes 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: ltung ba med na cang ma smra shig ces bya ba ni lung dbog pa di'i gleng gzhi rnam par gzhag par bsgrags par bya ba ni 'og nas 'di ltar tshe dang ldan pa dag pa yongs su dag na zhes 'byung ba yin no //
translated: If the venerable ones are pure in this, remain silent.

original: cang mi smra na bdag gis tshe dang ldan pa dag yongs su dag par rig par bya'o zhes lung dbog pa 'di'i gleng gzhi rnam par gzhag pa bsgrag pa ni 'og nas 'di ltar cang mi smra bas de de bzhin du 'dzin to zhes 'byung ba yin par
analyzed: cang mi smra na bdag gis tshe dang ldan pa dag yongs su dag par rig par bya'o zhes lung dbog pa 'di'i gleng gzhi rnam par gzhag pa bsgrag pa ni 'og nas 'di ltar cang mi smra bas de de bzhin du 'dzin to zhes 'byung ba yin par
translated: The proclamation of the rules of purity is stated below:

original: rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rig par bya'o //
translated: “Since they remain silent, it is understood that they are pure.”

original: de'i 'og tu gleng gzhi rnam par gzhag pa'i thabs bstan pa'i yan lag gi don bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu gleng gzhi rnam par gzhag pa'i thabs bstan pa'i yan lag gi don bshad par bya ste /
translated: Next, the meaning of the branch that teaches the method of proclaiming the rules of purity should be explained.

original: ji ltar so sor dris nas dge slong gis lan btab pa zhes bya ba ni gleng gzhi rnam par gzhag pa'i thabs bstan pa'i dpe ste /
analyzed: ji ltar so sor dris nas dge slong gis lan btab pa zhes bya ba ni gleng gzhi rnam par gzhag pa'i thabs bstan pa'i dpe ste /
translated: “Just as a monk responds to individual questions” is an example of the method of proclaiming the rules of purity.

original: dper na gso sbyong gi tshe dge slong gso sbyong gi gnas su 'du ba'i mdun rol kho nar gso sbyong snga ma 'das pa'i mtha' tshun chad kyi zla ba phyed kyi ltung ba la so sor brtag par byed cing ltung ba shes shing mthong na dge slong gcig
analyzed: dper na gso sbyong gi tshe dge slong gso sbyong gi gnas su 'du ba'i mdun rol kho nar gso sbyong snga ma 'das pa'i mtha' tshun chad kyi zla ba phyed kyi ltung ba la so sor brtag par byed cing ltung ba shes shing mthong na dge slong gcig
translated: For example, during the poṣadha purification ceremony, before the monks gather in the place of purification, they should individually examine the downfalls of the previous half month that has passed. If they know and see a downfall, a monk should confess it to another monk.

original: gi mdun du skabs dbye bar gsol to //
analyzed: gi mdun du skabs dbye bar gsol to //
translated: The monk who is to give the purification should say, I request permission to speak in the presence of the community.

original: ltung ba dbye ba ni dag pa sbyin pa'i dge slong des ltung ba mthong ngam zhes dris pa mthong ngo zhes lan gdab pa dang phyin chad sdom mam zhes dris pa na sdom mo zhes lan gdab pa dang / lan gsum dris na dge slong gis kyang lan gsum gdab pa'o //
analyzed: ltung ba dbye ba ni dag pa sbyin pa'i dge slong des ltung ba mthong ngam zhes dris pa mthong ngo zhes lan gdab pa dang phyin chad sdom mam zhes dris pa na sdom mo zhes lan gdab pa dang / lan gsum dris na dge slong gis kyang lan gsum gdab pa'o //
translated: The announcement of the offense is the monk who is to give the purification being asked, Have you seen the offense? and answering, I have seen it. He is asked, Will you restrain yourself from now on? and answers, I will restrain myself. When asked three times, the monk also answers three times.

original: de bzhin du dge slong gi 'khor 'di lta bur yang lan gsum gyi bar du bsgrub par bya ba yin no zhes bya ba ni gleng gzhi rnam par gzhag pa'i thabs bstan pa'i don yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du dge slong gi 'khor 'di lta bur yang lan gsum gyi bar du bsgrub par bya ba yin no zhes bya ba ni gleng gzhi rnam par gzhag pa'i thabs bstan pa'i don yin no //
translated: Similarly, it should be accomplished up to three times in this community of monks. This is the explanation of the method for presenting the nidāna.

original: dge slong gi 'khor 'di lta bur yang zhes bya ba ni so sor thar pa'i mdo gdon pa'i 'khor 'dir yang ngo //
analyzed: dge slong gi 'khor 'di lta bur yang zhes bya ba ni so sor thar pa'i mdo gdon pa'i 'khor 'dir yang ngo //
translated: In this community of monks means in this community that is reciting the Sūtra of Individual Liberation.

original: lan gsum gyi bar du bsgrags par bya ba yin no zhes bya ba @191a * //
analyzed: lan gsum gyi bar du bsgrags par bya ba yin no zhes bya ba @191a * //
translated: It should be announced up to three times means that it should be announced up to three times.

original: ni gleng gzhi rnam par gzhag pa bsgrags par bya ba'i tshig 'di skad ces bya ba de la bdag gis tshe dang ldan pa dag ci 'di la khyed yongs su dag gam zhes lan gnyis lan gsum dri'o //
analyzed: ni gleng gzhi rnam par gzhag pa bsgrags par bya ba'i tshig 'di skad ces bya ba de la bdag gis tshe dang ldan pa dag ci 'di la khyed yongs su dag gam zhes lan gnyis lan gsum dri'o //
translated: I ask the venerable ones, “Is the community pure in this matter?” I ask a second time, “Is the community pure in this matter?” I ask a third time, “Is the community pure in this matter?”🔽Since the venerable ones are silent, then the community is pure in this matter.

original: 'di la tshe dang ldan pa dag yongs su dag na 'di ltar cang mi smra bas de de bzhin du 'dzin to zhes 'byung ba de nyid so sor thar pa'i gzhung las ji skad 'byung ba bzhin du go rims dang tshig ma 'khrul bar lan gcig 'don par🔽bya ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di la tshe dang ldan pa dag yongs su dag na 'di ltar cang mi smra bas de de bzhin du 'dzin to zhes 'byung ba de nyid so sor thar pa'i gzhung las ji skad 'byung ba bzhin du go rims dang tshig ma 'khrul bar lan gcig 'don par bya ba yin te /
translated: This is to be recited once, in the same order and without confusing the words, just as it appears in the text of the Prātimokṣa.

original: da lan gcig ston pa nyid na dri'o zhes bya ba dang / lan gnyis lan gsum du dri'o zhes smos pa de nyid kyis lan gsum du bsgrags pa yin no //
analyzed: da lan gcig ston pa nyid na dri'o zhes bya ba dang / lan gnyis lan gsum du dri'o zhes smos pa de nyid kyis lan gsum du bsgrags pa yin no //
translated: Since it is said, “I ask the community once,” and “I ask a second time, I ask a third time,” this itself is the proclamation three times.

original: tshig de skabs 'dir gong du spar te bsgrags pa yang ma yin la sngar gleng gzhi rnam par gzhag pa'i lung dbog pa'i tshig ji skad bstan pa des skabs 'dir lan gsum bsgrags par bya ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: tshig de skabs 'dir gong du spar te bsgrags pa yang ma yin la sngar gleng gzhi rnam par gzhag pa'i lung dbog pa'i tshig ji skad bstan pa des skabs 'dir lan gsum bsgrags par bya ba yang ma yin no //
translated: The words are not proclaimed here as they were above, nor are they proclaimed three times here as they were in the proclamation of the introduction.

original: de'i 'og tu ma dag pa'i nyes dmigs kyi yan lag gi don bshad par bya ste /🔽yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni byung ba'i dbang gis bcas pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu ma dag pa'i nyes dmigs kyi yan lag gi don bshad par bya ste / yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni byung ba'i dbang gis bcas pa ma yin gyi /
translated: After that, the meaning of the branch of the disadvantages of impurity should be explained.

original: gang yang rung ba spyir bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gang yang rung ba spyir bstan pa'o //
translated: The one who is a bhikṣu is not established by the power of arising, but is a general indication of any.

original: dge slong gi 'khor 'di lta bur lan gsum gyi bar du bsgrags par byas pa na zhes bya ba ni so sor thar pa'i mdo gdon pa'i nang du gleng gzhi rnam par gzhag pa bsgrags par bya ba'i tshig 'og nas 'byung ba lan gcig bton pa na ste
analyzed: dge slong gi 'khor 'di lta bur lan gsum gyi bar du bsgrags par byas pa na zhes bya ba ni so sor thar pa'i mdo gdon pa'i nang du gleng gzhi rnam par gzhag pa bsgrags par bya ba'i tshig 'og nas 'byung ba lan gcig bton pa na ste
translated: When this kind of assembly of bhikṣus is proclaimed up to three times, it is when the words of proclamation that establish the introduction are recited once in the middle of reciting the Prātimokṣa Sūtra.

original: de lan gcig bton pa na dri'o //
analyzed: de lan gcig bton pa na dri'o //
translated: When that is recited once, it is asked.

original: lan gnyis lan gsum du dri'o zhes smos pa nyid lan gsum bsgrags pa yin gyi /
analyzed: lan gnyis lan gsum du dri'o zhes smos pa nyid lan gsum bsgrags pa yin gyi /
translated: This is the announcement of the second and third part of the rule.

original: gleng gzhi rnam par gzhag pa bsgrags pa'i tshig de lan gsum bzlas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: gleng gzhi rnam par gzhag pa bsgrags pa'i tshig de lan gsum bzlas par mi bya'o //
translated: But the words of the announcement of the rule are not repeated three times.

original: ltung ba yod la zhes bya ba ni sngar chos bzhin du phyir ma bcos pa'o //
analyzed: ltung ba yod la zhes bya ba ni sngar chos bzhin du phyir ma bcos pa'o //
translated: “There is an offense” means that the offense has not been previously corrected in accordance with the Teaching.

original: dran bzhin du mi mthun na zhes bya ba ni 'dir 'du shes gtso cher byed pa po yin pas mi dran pa la ltung ba med kyi dran bzhin du mi mthol na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dran bzhin du mi mthun na zhes bya ba ni 'dir 'du shes gtso cher byed pa po yin pas mi dran pa la ltung ba med kyi dran bzhin du mi mthol na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: “If, while remembering, one does not agree” means that here the perception is the main factor. Therefore, there is no offense if one does not remember. But if one remembers and does not confess, there is an offense.

original: yid gnyis ni 'du shes dang 'dra bas yid gnyis za ba byin gyis mi rlob na yang ltung ba 'dir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yid gnyis ni 'du shes dang 'dra bas yid gnyis za ba byin gyis mi rlob na yang ltung ba 'dir 'gyur ro //
translated: “Doubt” is similar to perception. Therefore, if one does not bless because one has doubts, there is also this offense.

original: de shes bzhin du brdzun du smra ba yin no zhes bya ba ni brdzun la rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: de shes bzhin du brdzun du smra ba yin no zhes bya ba ni brdzun la rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: “One is lying while knowing” means that there are five kinds of lies:

original: pham par 'gyur ba dang / dge 'dun lhag mar 'gyur ba dang / nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ba dang / ltung byed du 'gyur ba dang / nyes byas su 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: pham par 'gyur ba dang / dge 'dun lhag mar 'gyur ba dang / nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ba dang / ltung byed du 'gyur ba dang / nyes byas su 'gyur ba'o //
translated: and lies that are an offense of wrong conduct.

original: de la pham par 'gyur ba'i brdzun ni 'du shes bsgyur te mi'i chos bla @191b ma smra ba'o //
analyzed: de la pham par 'gyur ba'i brdzun ni 'du shes bsgyur te mi'i chos bla @191b ma smra ba'o //
translated: A lie that is a root downfall is to speak of superhuman qualities with a distorted mind.

original: dge 'dun lhag mar 'gyur ba'i brdzun ni 'du shes bsgyur te /
analyzed: dge 'dun lhag mar 'gyur ba'i brdzun ni 'du shes bsgyur te /
translated: A lie that is a partial defeat is to distort one’s perception and

original: gzhi med pa dang bag tsam gyis skur ba 'debs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhi med pa dang bag tsam gyis skur ba 'debs pa'o //
translated: to falsely accuse another of a serious offense.

original: nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ba'i brdzun ni dge 'dun byed pa'i tshe dge 'dun 'dus pa la shes bzhin du chos ma yin pa chos su ston pa dang / chos chos ma yin par ston pa ste /
analyzed: nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ba'i brdzun ni dge 'dun byed pa'i tshe dge 'dun 'dus pa la shes bzhin du chos ma yin pa chos su ston pa dang / chos chos ma yin par ston pa ste /
translated: A lie that is a serious violation is to knowingly teach what is contrary to the Dharma as the Dharma and what is the Dharma as contrary to the Dharma to a gathering of the community when the community is in the process of making a decision.

original: brdzun du smra ba'i pham par 'gyur ba'i skabs kyi nyes pa sbom po'o //
analyzed: brdzun du smra ba'i pham par 'gyur ba'i skabs kyi nyes pa sbom po'o //
translated: This is a serious violation in the context of the root downfall of lying.

original: ltung byed du 'gyur pa'i brdzun ni snga ma gsum dang / nyes byas su 'gyur ba'i brdzun dang / bzhi las gzhan pa'i brdzun du smra ba'i don shes pa'i yul las 'du shes gzhan du bsgyur ba'o //
analyzed: ltung byed du 'gyur pa'i brdzun ni snga ma gsum dang / nyes byas su 'gyur ba'i brdzun dang / bzhi las gzhan pa'i brdzun du smra ba'i don shes pa'i yul las 'du shes gzhan du bsgyur ba'o //
translated: Lying that is a serious offense is the first three, lying that is an offense of wrong conduct and lying that is other than those four.

original: brdzun smra ba ni 'du shes kyi dbang gis rnam par gzhag gi dngos po yod pa dang med pa'i dbang gis ni ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brdzun smra ba ni 'du shes kyi dbang gis rnam par gzhag gi dngos po yod pa dang med pa'i dbang gis ni ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Lying is posited by the power of the conception of the object, but not by the power of the existence or nonexistence of the thing.

original: nyes byas su 'gyur ba'i brdzun ni skabs 'di nyid kyis bstan te //
analyzed: nyes byas su 'gyur ba'i brdzun ni skabs 'di nyid kyis bstan te //
translated: Lying that is an offense of wrong conduct is indicated by this passage:

original: gso sbyong la ci 'di la khyod yongs su dag gam zhes lan gsum gyi bar du dris pa las ma dag par shes bzhin du cang mi smra bar 'da' bar byed na nyes byas so zhes gsungs la'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gso sbyong la ci 'di la khyod yongs su dag gam zhes lan gsum gyi bar du dris pa las ma dag par shes bzhin du cang mi smra bar 'da' bar byed na nyes byas so zhes gsungs la'i phyir ro //
translated: If, knowing that someone is impure, one does not speak up during the three announcements of the purification ceremony, one commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: des kyang nyes byas yongs su rdzogs pa yin gyi /
analyzed: des kyang nyes byas yongs su rdzogs pa yin gyi /
translated: This is a complete offense of wrong conduct.

original: yid kyi ni ma yin te kha rnam par 'gyur ba la sogs pa'i rnam par rig byed de la yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yid kyi ni ma yin te kha rnam par 'gyur ba la sogs pa'i rnam par rig byed de la yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But it is not mental, because it exists in the form of verbal expressions such as speech and gestures.

original: de ltar shes bzhin du brdzun du smra ba de ni ma dag pa yin la /
analyzed: de ltar shes bzhin du brdzun du smra ba de ni ma dag pa yin la /
translated: Thus, lying is impure.

original: ma dag pa'i nyes dmigs gang zhe na /
analyzed: ma dag pa'i nyes dmigs gang zhe na /
translated: What is the danger of impurity?

original: de'i phyir tshe dang ldan pa dag shes bzhin du brdzun du smra ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyis bar du gcod pa'i chos su gsungs so zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir tshe dang ldan pa dag shes bzhin du brdzun du smra ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyis bar du gcod pa'i chos su gsungs so zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “Venerables, the Blessed One has said that lying is an obstacle.”

original: brdzun du smra ba ni rang bzhin gyi kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa yin pas bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa dang / nyams pa dang / mtshams med pa lnga byas pa dang / sdig pa'i lta ba can dang / sa gzhan na gnas pa dang /
analyzed: brdzun du smra ba ni rang bzhin gyi kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa yin pas bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa dang / nyams pa dang / mtshams med pa lnga byas pa dang / sdig pa'i lta ba can dang / sa gzhan na gnas pa dang /
translated: Lying is naturally reprehensible, so it is not permissible for those who have not completed the prerequisites, those who have lapsed, those who have committed one of the five heinous acts, those who hold wrong views, those who are of a different philosophical school, those who are not human, those who are not monastics, those who are not of the same philosophical school, those who do not understand the meaning, those who do not understand the words, those who understand neither, those who are not asked, those who are asked in jest, those who are asked by one who is not fully attentive, those who are asked by one who is insane, and those who are asked by one who is speaking figuratively.

original: tha dad du gnas pa rnams kyis smras na sang mngon par mtho ba dang nges par legs pa'i bar du gcod pa yin pas dge slong rang bzhin du gnas pas smras pa ni rang bzhin gyi kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa'i kha na ma tho ba
analyzed: tha dad du gnas pa rnams kyis smras na sang mngon par mtho ba dang nges par legs pa'i bar du gcod pa yin pas dge slong rang bzhin du gnas pas smras pa ni rang bzhin gyi kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa'i kha na ma tho ba
translated: If those who are not natural monks speak, it is an obstruction to higher rebirth and definite goodness.🔽If natural monks speak, it is a natural offense.

original: dang gnyi ga lhag par spyad pa yin pas lhag par yang mngon par mtho ba dang nges par legs pa'i bar du gcod pa yin par gsungs so //
analyzed: dang gnyi ga lhag par spyad pa yin pas lhag par yang mngon par mtho ba dang nges par legs pa'i bar du gcod pa yin par gsungs so //
translated: If both natural and non-natural monks engage in that act, it is said to be an obstruction to higher rebirth and definite goodness.

original: skabs 'dir ni cho ga las 'das na las mi 'chags so zhes gsungs te /🔽las ni gsol ba dang brjod pa dang so sor @192a * //
analyzed: skabs 'dir ni cho ga las 'das na las mi 'chags so zhes gsungs te / las ni gsol ba dang brjod pa dang so sor @192a * //
translated: In this context, it is said that if one transgresses the rite, the karma is not confessed.🔽Karma is included in the one hundred one karmas of proposal, proclamation,

original: thar ba 'don pa dang / dgag dbye'i las te las brgya rtsa gcig gis bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: thar ba 'don pa dang / dgag dbye'i las te las brgya rtsa gcig gis bsdus pa'o //
translated: reciting the pratimoksha, and the karma of the lifting of restrictions.

original: cho ga ni dge 'dun tshang ba dang / las brjod pa dang / las byed pa nyid kyis chos ma yin pas mi bya ba dang mi mthun pa dag gis mi bya ba dang / tshogs kyis mi bya ba yin pas 'dir so sor thar pa'i mdo gdon pa ni gso sbyong gi las yin la de chos ma yin pas mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'khrul pa dang bcas pa dag gis las mi bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: cho ga ni dge 'dun tshang ba dang / las brjod pa dang / las byed pa nyid kyis chos ma yin pas mi bya ba dang mi mthun pa dag gis mi bya ba dang / tshogs kyis mi bya ba yin pas 'dir so sor thar pa'i mdo gdon pa ni gso sbyong gi las yin la de chos ma yin pas mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'khrul pa dang bcas pa dag gis las mi bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
translated: Here, reciting the Pratimokṣa Sūtra is the act of purification, and that is not performed by those who are not Dharma. This means that those who are confused should not perform the act, and so on.

original: 'dir ltung ba yod pa ni 'khrul pa dang bcas pa yin la /
analyzed: 'dir ltung ba yod pa ni 'khrul pa dang bcas pa yin la /
translated: Here, those who have downfalls are confused.

original: de dran bzhin du mi mthol na shes bzhin du brdzun du smra ba yang rang bzhin las nyams pa yin pas de ma bshags sam byin gyis ma brlabs pa dag gis gso sbyong gi las byas na las de mi 'chags pa'i nyes dmigs gzhan yang yod do //
analyzed: de dran bzhin du mi mthol na shes bzhin du brdzun du smra ba yang rang bzhin las nyams pa yin pas de ma bshags sam byin gyis ma brlabs pa dag gis gso sbyong gi las byas na las de mi 'chags pa'i nyes dmigs gzhan yang yod do //
translated: If they do not confess that while remembering it, they also lie knowingly. Since they degenerate from their nature, if they perform the act of purification without confessing that or blessing it, there is another disadvantage of not confessing that act.

original: de'i 'og tu 'dug pa'i phan yon gyi yan lag gi don bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu 'dug pa'i phan yon gyi yan lag gi don bshad par bya ste /
translated: After that, I will explain the meaning of the branch of the benefits of sitting there.

original: de bas na dge slong ltung ba byung ba rnam par dag par 'dod pas zhes bya ba ni shes bzhin du brdzun du smra ba'i nyes byas tsam yang rnam par dag par 'dod pas so //
analyzed: de bas na dge slong ltung ba byung ba rnam par dag par 'dod pas zhes bya ba ni shes bzhin du brdzun du smra ba'i nyes byas tsam yang rnam par dag par 'dod pas so //
translated: Therefore, “a monk who has incurred a downfall and who wishes to be purified” means who wishes to be purified of even a mere offense of lying with full awareness.

original: ltung ba yod la dran zhing mthong ba mthol bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni bshags pa dang / bsdam pa dang / byin gyis brlab pa gang bya bar 'os pa de bya'o //
analyzed: ltung ba yod la dran zhing mthong ba mthol bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni bshags pa dang / bsdam pa dang / byin gyis brlab pa gang bya bar 'os pa de bya'o //
translated: “He should confess the downfall that he remembers and sees” means that he should do whatever is appropriate: confessing, restraining himself, or blessing himself.

original: de ltar mthol ba de ni dag pa yin la /
analyzed: de ltar mthol ba de ni dag pa yin la /
translated: In this way, his confession is pure.

original: dag pa'i phan yon gang zhe na /
analyzed: dag pa'i phan yon gang zhe na /
translated: What are the benefits of purity?

original: de'i phyir mthol na bde ba la reg par gnas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir mthol na bde ba la reg par gnas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “If he confesses, he will dwell in comfort.”

original: mthol na tshul khrims kyi phan yon bcu 'thob cing mngon par mtho ba dang nges par legs pa'i bde ba la reg par gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mthol na tshul khrims kyi phan yon bcu 'thob cing mngon par mtho ba dang nges par legs pa'i bde ba la reg par gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: If he confesses, he will obtain the ten benefits of moral discipline and will dwell in comfort in the happiness of high status and the auspicious state of peace.

original: tshul khrims kyi phan yon bcu ni 'gyod pa med pa'i rim gyis mchog tu dga' ba sngon du 'gro ba'i chos 'thob par 'gyur ba la sogs pa sngar bstan pa dag go //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi phan yon bcu ni 'gyod pa med pa'i rim gyis mchog tu dga' ba sngon du 'gro ba'i chos 'thob par 'gyur ba la sogs pa sngar bstan pa dag go //
translated: The ten benefits of morality are as previously explained: one obtains the Dharma preceded by supreme joy through the stages of being without regret, and so on.

original: mngon par mtho ba ni mtho ris so //
analyzed: mngon par mtho ba ni mtho ris so //
translated: The higher realms are the heavens.

original: nges par legs pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: nges par legs pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: The definite goodness is nirvana.

original: skabs 'dir 'phral du cho ga las ma 'das pas las 'chags pa'i phan yon gzhan yang yod do //
analyzed: skabs 'dir 'phral du cho ga las ma 'das pas las 'chags pa'i phan yon gzhan yang yod do //
translated: In this context, there are other benefits of confessing karma by not transgressing the ritual at the present time.

original: ma mthol ma bshags na ni mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni rjes su 'gro ba sngar bstan pa de nyid ldog pa'i sgo nas bstan to //
analyzed: ma mthol ma bshags na ni mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni rjes su 'gro ba sngar bstan pa de nyid ldog pa'i sgo nas bstan to //
translated: If one does not confess, it will not be so. This is the teaching through reversal of the previously explained concomitance.

original: 'di 'og tu 'don pa'i mjug bsdu ba'i yan lag gi don bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di 'og tu 'don pa'i mjug bsdu ba'i yan lag gi don bshad par bya ste /
translated: The meaning of the concluding limb that is recited below should be explained.

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag bdag gis so sor thar pa'i mdo @192b gdon pa'i gleng gzhi bton zin to zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag bdag gis so sor thar pa'i mdo @192b gdon pa'i gleng gzhi bton zin to zhes bya ba la /
translated: Venerable ones, I have recited the nidāna of the Prātimokṣa Sūtra.

original: gleng gzhi zhes bya ba ni mdo gdon pa 'byung ba'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: gleng gzhi zhes bya ba ni mdo gdon pa 'byung ba'i rgyu'o //
translated: Here, nidāna is the cause for the recitation of the sūtra.🔽 🔽I have recited means I have recited it.

original: bton zin to zhes bya ba ni dam bcas pa'i don gyis mjug bsdu ba'i phyir dang / nyan pa po rnams spro bar bya ba'i phyir smos so //
analyzed: bton zin to zhes bya ba ni dam bcas pa'i don gyis mjug bsdu ba'i phyir dang / nyan pa po rnams spro bar bya ba'i phyir smos so //
translated: The phrase it has been recited is stated in order to conclude the meaning of the vow and in order to inspire the listeners.

original: de'i 'og tu gleng gzhi rnam par bsgrags par bya ba'i yan lag gi don bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu gleng gzhi rnam par bsgrags par bya ba'i yan lag gi don bshad par bya ste /
translated: After that, the meaning of the branch that proclaims the introduction should be explained.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni gleng gzhi bton pa de la'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni gleng gzhi bton pa de la'o //
translated: In that, in that refers to the recitation of the introduction.

original: ci zhes bya ba ni yongs su dri ba'o //
analyzed: ci zhes bya ba ni yongs su dri ba'o //
translated: What? is the inquiry.

original: 'di la zhes bya ba ni gso sbyong la'o //
analyzed: 'di la zhes bya ba ni gso sbyong la'o //
translated: Here refers to the purification.

original: khyed ces bya ba ni khyed cag go //
analyzed: khyed ces bya ba ni khyed cag go //
translated: You refers to you all.

original: yongs su dag gam zhes bya ba ni ltung ba ma byung ngam zhes bya'o zhes zhes bya ba ni dri ba spyi la snyegs so //
analyzed: yongs su dag gam zhes bya ba ni ltung ba ma byung ngam zhes bya'o zhes zhes bya ba ni dri ba spyi la snyegs so //
translated: Are you pure? means have you not had a downfall? Thus refers to the general inquiry.

original: dri'o zhes bya ba ni dri ba dang po'o //
analyzed: dri'o zhes bya ba ni dri ba dang po'o //
translated: Ask is the first inquiry.

original: lan gnyis lan gsum dri'o zhes bya ba ni lan gsum kho nar dri bar bya dgos pas lan gnyis lan gsum du zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: lan gnyis lan gsum dri'o zhes bya ba ni lan gsum kho nar dri bar bya dgos pas lan gnyis lan gsum du zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Ask twice and ask three times means that it is necessary to ask only three times, so twice and three times is stated.

original: nyung na yang la las mi thos la /
analyzed: nyung na yang la las mi thos la /
translated: If it is less than that, some will not hear it.

original: mang na yang dus yol ba la sogs pa'i nyes dmigs yod pas de'i phyir lan gsum ni ran par dgongs te bshags pa dang byin gyis brlab pa gnyis kyis ltung ba ma bcabs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mang na yang dus yol ba la sogs pa'i nyes dmigs yod pas de'i phyir lan gsum ni ran par dgongs te bshags pa dang byin gyis brlab pa gnyis kyis ltung ba ma bcabs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: If there were more, there would be the disadvantage of delay, and so on. Therefore, the three times are considered to be the right amount. The two, confession and consecration, are the same as not concealing downfalls.

original: cang mi smra bas brda byas pas gleng gzhi rnam par gzhag pa bsgrags pa'i mjug bsdu ba bstan pa'i phyir 'di la tshe dang ldan pa dag yongs su dag na 'di ltar cang mi smra bas de de bzhin du 'dzin to zhes bya ba gsungs te /🔽bshags pa dang byin gyis brlab pa gnyis te /
analyzed: cang mi smra bas brda byas pas gleng gzhi rnam par gzhag pa bsgrags pa'i mjug bsdu ba bstan pa'i phyir 'di la tshe dang ldan pa dag yongs su dag na 'di ltar cang mi smra bas de de bzhin du 'dzin to zhes bya ba gsungs te / bshags pa dang byin gyis brlab pa gnyis te /
translated: In order to teach the conclusion of the proclamation of the arrangement of the nidāna, the verse, “Here, O Venerables, if there is complete purity, then it is thus held by silence,” is stated.

original: ltung ba ma bcabs pa sha stag tshogs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ltung ba ma bcabs pa sha stag tshogs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The two, confession and consecration, are the same as not concealing downfalls.

original: gleng gzhi gdon pa bshad zin to //
analyzed: gleng gzhi gdon pa bshad zin to //
translated: This is the explanation of the recitation of the nidāna.

original: mdo gdon pa'i bsdus pa'i don rnam pa drug las gsol ba dang gleng gzhi gdon pa ni gzhung gzhan las mi 'byung bas skabs 'dir rgya cher bshad do //
analyzed: mdo gdon pa'i bsdus pa'i don rnam pa drug las gsol ba dang gleng gzhi gdon pa ni gzhung gzhan las mi 'byung bas skabs 'dir rgya cher bshad do //
translated: The six topics of the recitation of the sutra are explained extensively here because the recitation of the request and the recitation of the introduction do not occur in other texts.

original: pham par 'gyur ba gdon pa dang / dge 'dun lhag ma gdon pa dang / ma nges pa gdon pa dang / ril gyis gdon pa rnams kyi mtshan nyid ni /
analyzed: pham par 'gyur ba gdon pa dang / dge 'dun lhag ma gdon pa dang / ma nges pa gdon pa dang / ril gyis gdon pa rnams kyi mtshan nyid ni /
translated: The characteristics of the recitation of the defeating offenses, the recitation of the residual offenses, the recitation of the undetermined offenses and the recitation of the complete are as follows.🔽The summary is:

original: sdom la / mi tshangs spyod dang rku ba dang // mi la gsad par mi bya ba //
analyzed: sdom la / mi tshangs spyod dang rku ba dang // mi la gsad par mi bya ba //
translated: Sexual misconduct, stealing, and killing a human,

original: brdzun du smra dang bcas pa yi //
analyzed: brdzun du smra dang bcas pa yi //
translated: and lying.

original: chos bzhin 'dir ni gsungs pa yin //
analyzed: chos bzhin 'dir ni gsungs pa yin //
translated: These are taught here in accordance with the Dharma.

original: zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Up to:

original: gang gzhan nas 'byung ba'i chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos de la khyed rnams 'dul ba dang mthun pa dang dga' ba dang mi rtsod par sems kun du bsrung ba dang bag yod pas rnal 'byor du bya'o zhes gsungs pa'i bar dang go rims bzhin du sbyar🔽@193a * // ro ;

analyzed: de la yang dag par sbyor ba ni yang dag par rnal 'byor du bya ba ste /

original: 'dis ni lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa dang / lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa bstan par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dis ni lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa dang / lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa bstan par shes par bya'o //
translated: By this, one should understand the teaching of the training in the higher thought and the training in the higher wisdom.

original: 'di ni sangs rgyas bstan pa yin //
analyzed: 'di ni sangs rgyas bstan pa yin //
translated: This is the teaching of the Buddha.

original: zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pas mdor bstan pa de ni tshogs dang bcas pa'i lam bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pas mdor bstan pa de ni tshogs dang bcas pa'i lam bstan pa yin te /
translated: This is the brief teaching of the Tathāgata, which is the teaching of the path together with its accumulations.

original: de nyid sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni tha tshig go //
analyzed: de nyid sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni tha tshig go //
translated: That itself is the teaching of the Buddha.

original: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad skyob kyi slob ma rnams kyang nyes pa chung bar gyur te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad skyob kyi slob ma rnams kyang nyes pa chung bar gyur te /
translated: The disciples of the Bhagavān Viśvabhū had few faults,

original: 'di ltar khyim pa'i skye bo dang 'grogs par gyur pa tsam zhig yod pas de dag gi nyes pa de yongs su spang bar bya ba'i phyir bcom ldan 'das des so sor thar pa'i mdo 'di ltar mdor bsdus te zla ba phyed phyed cing bton par gyur te🔽/ ji ltar bung ba me tog las //
analyzed: 'di ltar khyim pa'i skye bo dang 'grogs par gyur pa tsam zhig yod pas de dag gi nyes pa de yongs su spang bar bya ba'i phyir bcom ldan 'das des so sor thar pa'i mdo 'di ltar mdor bsdus te zla ba phyed phyed cing bton par gyur te / ji ltar bung ba me tog las //
translated: but they had the fault of associating with householders. In order to eliminate that fault, that Bhagavān recited this Sūtra on Individual Liberation in brief every half month:🔽Just as bees do not harm

original: kha dog dri la mi gnod par //
analyzed: kha dog dri la mi gnod par //
translated: the color or scent of flowers,

original: khu ba gzhibs nas 'phur ba ltar //🔽de bzhin thub pa grong du rgyu //
analyzed: khu ba gzhibs nas 'phur ba ltar // de bzhin thub pa grong du rgyu //
translated: but collect their nectar and fly away,

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: so the Sage moves through the village.

original: de la ji ltar srog chags bung ba me tog las kha dog dang dri la mi gnod par khu ba gzhibs te 'phur ba de bzhin du thub pa rab tu byung ba bsod snyoms kyi phyir grong du rgyu bas kyang grong nas kha dog dang dri lta bu'i
analyzed: de la ji ltar srog chags bung ba me tog las kha dog dang dri la mi gnod par khu ba gzhibs te 'phur ba de bzhin du thub pa rab tu byung ba bsod snyoms kyi phyir grong du rgyu bas kyang grong nas kha dog dang dri lta bu'i
translated: Just as bees fly from flower to flower without harming their color or scent,

original: sems dang tshul khrims la mi gnod par khu ba lta bu'i kha zas blangs te 'gro bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sems dang tshul khrims la mi gnod par khu ba lta bu'i kha zas blangs te 'gro bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: in the same way, the Sage who has gone forth should go from house to house for alms without harming the mind or morality of the householder, like their color and scent.

original: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa 'khor ba 'jig gi slob ma rnams nyes pa chung bar gyur te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa 'khor ba 'jig gi slob ma rnams nyes pa chung bar gyur te /
translated: The disciples of the Blessed One, the Tathagata Krakucchanda, had few faults.

original: gzhan gyi rkyen dang yon tan la rtog pa tsam zhig yod pas de dag gi nyes pa yongs su spang bar bya ba'i phyir bcom ldan 'das des so sor thar pa'i mdo 'di ltar mdor bsdus te zla ba phyed phyed cing ston par gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi rkyen dang yon tan la rtog pa tsam zhig yod pas de dag gi nyes pa yongs su spang bar bya ba'i phyir bcom ldan 'das des so sor thar pa'i mdo 'di ltar mdor bsdus te zla ba phyed phyed cing ston par gyur te /
translated: Because they had only the fault of considering the conditions and qualities of others, in order to completely abandon those faults, that Blessed One taught this Sutra of Individual Liberation in brief every half month.

original: bdag gis rigs dang mi rigs dang // brtag par bya ste gzhan rnams kyi //
analyzed: bdag gis rigs dang mi rigs dang // brtag par bya ste gzhan rnams kyi //
translated: not for others.

original: mi mthun pa dag gzhan dag gis //🔽byas dang ma byas rnams la min //
analyzed: mi mthun pa dag gzhan dag gis // byas dang ma byas rnams la min //
translated: Not for others’ faults,

original: zhes bya ba'o //🔽de la / bdag gis rigs dang mi rigs la //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o // de la / bdag gis rigs dang mi rigs la //
translated: not for what is done or not done.

original: brtag par bya ste zhes bya ba ni bdag gis bdag nyid kyi rigs pa dang mi rigs pa so sor brtag pa par bya'o //🔽gzhan rnams kyi /
analyzed: brtag par bya ste zhes bya ba ni bdag gis bdag nyid kyi rigs pa dang mi rigs pa so sor brtag pa par bya'o // gzhan rnams kyi /
translated: Here, “I should examine what is right and wrong for myself” means that I should examine for myself what is right and wrong.

original: mi mthun pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan rnams kyi mi rigs so //🔽gzhan dag gis /🔽byas dang ma byas rnams la min //🔽zhes bya ba ni @195a * //
analyzed: mi mthun pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan rnams kyi mi rigs so // gzhan dag gis / byas dang ma byas rnams la min // zhes bya ba ni @195a * //
translated: “Not for others” means not for the faults of others.

original: gzhan dag gis rdzogs pa dang ma rdzogs pa rnams la brtag par mi bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag gis rdzogs pa dang ma rdzogs pa rnams la brtag par mi bya'o //
translated: “Not for what is done or not done” means not for what is completed or not completed by others.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is what is being taught:

original: gzhan dag gi yon tan dang skyon la rtog pa la ni rjes su chags pa dang / khong khro ba 'byung ba sa de'i phyir gzhan la rtog pa spangs te /
analyzed: gzhan dag gi yon tan dang skyon la rtog pa la ni rjes su chags pa dang / khong khro ba 'byung ba sa de'i phyir gzhan la rtog pa spangs te /
translated: Since attachment and hostility arise from examining the good qualities and faults of others, therefore one should abandon examining others.

original: bdag nyid la brtag cing bdag nyid sems pa 'dod par byas na /
analyzed: bdag nyid la brtag cing bdag nyid sems pa 'dod par byas na /
translated: If you want to examine and reflect on yourself,

original: phyis gzhan la brtag pa'i skabs yod par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: phyis gzhan la brtag pa'i skabs yod par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: then later you will have the opportunity to examine others.

original: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa gser thub kyi slob ma rnams kyang nyes pa chung bar gyur te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa gser thub kyi slob ma rnams kyang nyes pa chung bar gyur te /
translated: The disciples of the Transcendent Lord Kanakamuni had few faults.

original: sred pa dang bcas pas bsam gtan skyed par byed pa tsam yod pas /
analyzed: sred pa dang bcas pas bsam gtan skyed par byed pa tsam yod pas /
translated: They generated meditative concentration with craving.

original: de dag gi nyes pa de yongs su spong bar bya ba'i phyir bcom ldan 'das des so sor thar pa'i mdo 'di ltar mdor bsdus te zla ba phyed phyed cing bton par gyur te /
analyzed: de dag gi nyes pa de yongs su spong bar bya ba'i phyir bcom ldan 'das des so sor thar pa'i mdo 'di ltar mdor bsdus te zla ba phyed phyed cing bton par gyur te /
translated: In order to eliminate that fault, the Transcendent Lord taught this Sutra of Individual Liberation in brief, to be recited every half month:

original: lhag pa'i sems la bag bya ste //
analyzed: lhag pa'i sems la bag bya ste //
translated: “Be careful with your mind.

original: thub pa'i thub gzhi rnams la bslab //🔽nyer zhi rtag tu dran ldan pa'i //
analyzed: thub pa'i thub gzhi rnams la bslab // nyer zhi rtag tu dran ldan pa'i //
translated: Train in the bases of the able one.🔽The protector is free from sorrow,

original: skyob pa mya ngan med pa yin //🔽zhes bya ba'o ;
analyzed: skyob pa mya ngan med pa yin // zhes bya ba'o ;
translated: always mindful of complete peace.

original: / de la lhag pa'i sems zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan bzhi po dag go //
analyzed: / de la lhag pa'i sems zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan bzhi po dag go //
translated: Here, “mind” means the four meditative concentrations.

original: de la bag bya ste zhes bya ba ni sred pa dang nga rgyal dang lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa spang zhing bag gyis shig ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: de la bag bya ste zhes bya ba ni sred pa dang nga rgyal dang lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa spang zhing bag gyis shig ces bya ba'o //
translated: One should be careful about that means one should abandon craving, pride, and the holding of views as paramount, and be careful.

original: spang ba bstan nas bslab pa bstan pa'i phyir //🔽thub pa'i thub gzhi rnams la bslab //
analyzed: spang ba bstan nas bslab pa bstan pa'i phyir // thub pa'i thub gzhi rnams la bslab //
translated: Having taught the abandonment, in order to teach the training,

original: ces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: ces bya ba gsungs te /
translated: he says, Train in the bases of the Muni's training.

original: thub pa zhes bya ba ni mkhyen pa dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: thub pa zhes bya ba ni mkhyen pa dang ldan pa ste /
translated: Muni means one who possesses knowledge.

original: yang dang yang du mdzad pa'i phyir thub ste /
analyzed: yang dang yang du mdzad pa'i phyir thub ste /
translated: Again and again, he is a Muni,

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das so //
translated: the Buddha Bhagavan.

original: thub pa de'i thub gzhi ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po dag ste /
analyzed: thub pa de'i thub gzhi ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po dag ste /
translated: The bases of the Muni's training are the four noble truths,

original: gang dag gis thub pa skyed pa'o //
analyzed: gang dag gis thub pa skyed pa'o //
translated: by which the Muni is produced.

original: de la bslab pa ni mchog tu bslab cing nan tan gyis shig ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de la bslab pa ni mchog tu bslab cing nan tan gyis shig ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Training in that is the highest training, one should practice earnestly, is the meaning.

original: de la bslab pa ni cir zhe na /
analyzed: de la bslab pa ni cir zhe na /
translated: What is the training in that?

original: 'bras bu bstan pa'i phyir /🔽nyer zhi rtag tu dran ldan pa'o //🔽skyob pa mya ngan med pa yin /
analyzed: 'bras bu bstan pa'i phyir / nyer zhi rtag tu dran ldan pa'o // skyob pa mya ngan med pa yin /
translated: In order to teach the result,🔽he says, Always mindful, one is completely pacified.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: The protector is without sorrow.

original: nye bar zhi ba dang rtag tu dran pa dang ldan pa nyid kyis skyob pa nyid du bstan par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: nye bar zhi ba dang rtag tu dran pa dang ldan pa nyid kyis skyob pa nyid du bstan par shes par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that he is a protector because of his peacefulness and his constant mindfulness.

original: de nye bar zhi ba zhes bya ba ni mnyam par gzhag pa ste /
analyzed: de nye bar zhi ba zhes bya ba ni mnyam par gzhag pa ste /
translated: His peacefulness is his meditative equipoise.

original: lus dang ngag gnyis kyis bsdams pa'o //
analyzed: lus dang ngag gnyis kyis bsdams pa'o //
translated: He is restrained in body and speech.

original: rtag tu dran ldan pa'i zhes bya ba ni rtag tu dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: rtag tu dran ldan pa'i zhes bya ba ni rtag tu dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'o //
translated: He is always mindful, always maintaining mindfulness.

original: skyob pa zhes bya ba ni rang gi sems rjes su bsrung ba'o //
analyzed: skyob pa zhes bya ba ni rang gi sems rjes su bsrung ba'o //
translated: He is a protector, guarding his own mind.

original: mya ngan med pa yin zhes bya ba 'dis ni skye ba zad pa bstan te /
analyzed: mya ngan med pa yin zhes bya ba 'dis ni skye ba zad pa bstan te /
translated: He is without sorrow, which shows that he has ended rebirth.

original: mya @195b ngan las 'das pa yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: mya @195b ngan las 'das pa yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: He is to be known as one who has attained nirvana.

original: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa 'od srungs kyi slob ma rnams kyang nyes pa chung bar gyur te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa 'od srungs kyi slob ma rnams kyang nyes pa chung bar gyur te /
translated: The disciples of the Tathagata Kasyapa also had few faults.

original: sbyin pa la ma gus pa dang / dgra mang par lta ba tsam zhig yod pas de dag gi nyes pa yongs su spang bar bya ba'i phyir bcom ldan 'das des mthar thug pa'i chos bstan pas so sor thar pa'i mdo 'di ltar mdor bsdus te zla ba phyed phyed cing bton par gyur te /
analyzed: sbyin pa la ma gus pa dang / dgra mang par lta ba tsam zhig yod pas de dag gi nyes pa yongs su spang bar bya ba'i phyir bcom ldan 'das des mthar thug pa'i chos bstan pas so sor thar pa'i mdo 'di ltar mdor bsdus te zla ba phyed phyed cing bton par gyur te /
translated: Because of their disrespect for generosity and their view that they have many enemies, the Blessed One taught this Sūtra on Individual Emancipation in order to completely eliminate their faults.

original: sbyin pas bsod nams rab tu 'phel //
analyzed: sbyin pas bsod nams rab tu 'phel //
translated: Merit increases through generosity.

original: legs bsdams dgra sogs mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: legs bsdams dgra sogs mi 'gyur ro //
translated: One who is well restrained does not have enemies and so forth.

original: dge dang ldan pas sdig pa spong //🔽nyon mongs zad pas mya ngan 'da' //
analyzed: dge dang ldan pas sdig pa spong // nyon mongs zad pas mya ngan 'da' //
translated: The virtuous one abandons evil.

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Through the exhaustion of afflictions, one attains nirvāṇa.

original: de la sbyin pa zhes bya ba ni sbyin par byed pa'i ming ste /
analyzed: de la sbyin pa zhes bya ba ni sbyin par byed pa'i ming ste /
translated: Here, generosity is the name of the giver.

original: des ni longs spyod kyi 'bras bu can gyi bsod nams kyi las rab tu 'phal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des ni longs spyod kyi 'bras bu can gyi bsod nams kyi las rab tu 'phal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By that, the meritorious action that has the result of wealth increases.

original: tshul khrims legs par bsdams pas ni dgra sogs mi 'gyur te tshul khrims dgra'i rgyu gsod pa dang rku ba dag bud med la chags pa la sogs pa mi skyed pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: tshul khrims legs par bsdams pas ni dgra sogs mi 'gyur te tshul khrims dgra'i rgyu gsod pa dang rku ba dag bud med la chags pa la sogs pa mi skyed pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: By properly restraining morality, one does not become an enemy, etc., because morality does not generate the causes of enemies, such as killing and stealing, attachment to women, etc.

original: / dge dang ldan pas zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan bzhi thob pas so / des ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sdig pa khong khro ba la sogs pa rnam par smin pa mi 'dod par 'gyur ba dag yongs su spong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: / dge dang ldan pas zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan bzhi thob pas so / des ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sdig pa khong khro ba la sogs pa rnam par smin pa mi 'dod par 'gyur ba dag yongs su spong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By being endowed with virtue, one obtains the four meditations. By that, one abandons the unwholesome, such as anger, etc., that are experienced in the desire realm and have undesirable karmic maturation.

original: 'phags pa'i lam gyis nyon mongs pa thams cad yongs su zad pas ni phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa dang lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam gyis nyon mongs pa thams cad yongs su zad pas ni phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa dang lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: By the noble path, one obtains nirvāṇa with and without remainder, through completely exhausting all afflictions.

original: de lta bas na sbyin pa ni 'khor ba'i 'bras bu can yin pas de la gdung bar mi bya zhing dgra mang ba ni sdom brtson dang mi mthun pa yin pas de mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa sh'akya thub pa'i bstan pa la chu bur ma byung ba'i tshe na de'i slob ma rnams kyang nyes pa chung bar gyur pas bcom ldan 'das kyis de dag la so sor thar pa'i mdo 'di ltar mdor bsdus te tshigs su bcad
analyzed: de lta bas na sbyin pa ni 'khor ba'i 'bras bu can yin pas de la gdung bar mi bya zhing dgra mang ba ni sdom brtson dang mi mthun pa yin pas de mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa sh'akya thub pa'i bstan pa la chu bur ma byung ba'i tshe na de'i slob ma rnams kyang nyes pa chung bar gyur pas bcom ldan 'das kyis de dag la so sor thar pa'i mdo 'di ltar mdor bsdus te tshigs su bcad
translated: Thus, since generosity is the fruit of cyclic existence, one should not be attached to it. Since having many enemies is not conducive to being diligent in vows, one should not do that.

original: pa gsum gyis bton par gyur te /
analyzed: pa gsum gyis bton par gyur te /
translated: When the doctrine of the Bhagavat Shakyamuni was free of blisters, his disciples had few faults. The Bhagavat extracted the Vinaya Sutra in this way in three verses:

original: sdig pa thams cad mi bya ste //
analyzed: sdig pa thams cad mi bya ste //
translated: Do not commit any nonvirtue.

original: dge ba phun sum tshogs par bya //
analyzed: dge ba phun sum tshogs par bya //
translated: Cultivate virtue completely.

original: rang gi sems ni yongs su gdul //
analyzed: rang gi sems ni yongs su gdul //
translated: Fully control your own mind.

original: 'di ni sangs rgyas bstan pa yin //
analyzed: 'di ni sangs rgyas bstan pa yin //
translated: This is the teaching of the Buddha.

original: lus kyi sdom pa legs pa ste //
analyzed: lus kyi sdom pa legs pa ste //
translated: Physical restraint is excellent.

original: ngag gi sdom pa'ang legs pa yin //
analyzed: ngag gi sdom pa'ang legs pa yin //
translated: Verbal restraint is excellent.

original: yid kyi sdom pa legs pa ste //
analyzed: yid kyi sdom pa legs pa ste //
translated: Mental restraint is excellent.

original: thams cad du ni sdom pa legs //
analyzed: thams cad du ni sdom pa legs //
translated: Everywhere, restraint is good.

original: kun du bsdams pa'i dge slong ni //
analyzed: kun du bsdams pa'i dge slong ni //
translated: The monk who is restrained everywhere

original: sdug bsngal kun las rab tu grol //🔽ngag rnams @196a * //
analyzed: sdug bsngal kun las rab tu grol // ngag rnams @196a * //
translated: is freed from all suffering.

original: srung zhing yid kyis rab bsdams te //
analyzed: srung zhing yid kyis rab bsdams te //
translated: Protecting speech, well-restrained in mind,

original: lus kyis mi dge ba dag mi byed cing //
analyzed: lus kyis mi dge ba dag mi byed cing //
translated: not doing any evil with the body,

original: las lam gsum po 'di dag rab bsdams na //
analyzed: las lam gsum po 'di dag rab bsdams na //
translated: restrained in these three paths of action,

original: drang srong gsungs pa'i lam ni thob par 'gyur //🔽zhes bya ba'o //🔽de la / sdig pa thams cad mi bya ste //
analyzed: drang srong gsungs pa'i lam ni thob par 'gyur // zhes bya ba'o // de la / sdig pa thams cad mi bya ste //
translated: he attains the path taught by the sages.

original: zhes bya ba 'dis ni lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa bstan to //🔽dge ba phun sum tshogs par bya //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'dis ni lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa bstan to // dge ba phun sum tshogs par bya //
translated: Here, the line “Do not commit any evil” teaches the training in superior morality.

original: zhes bya ba 'dis ni lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa bstan te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'dis ni lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa bstan te /
translated: The line “Be abundant in what is wholesome” teaches the training in superior wisdom,

original: nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pa ni don dam par dge ba'i phyir ro //🔽rang gi sems ni yongs su gdul //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pa ni don dam par dge ba'i phyir ro // rang gi sems ni yongs su gdul //
translated: because the abandonment of all afflictions is the ultimate wholesome state.

original: zhes bya ba 'dis ni lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'dis ni lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa bstan to //
translated: The line “Fully control your own mind” teaches the training in superior mind.

original: lus kyi sdom pa legs pa ste //
analyzed: lus kyi sdom pa legs pa ste //
translated: The line “Restraint of the body is good”

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa sdom pa rnam pa bzhis ni tshul khrims phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa sdom pa rnam pa bzhis ni tshul khrims phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
translated: Thus, by the four kinds of restraint, the perfection of morality is taught.

original: sdug bsngal kun las rab tu grol //
analyzed: sdug bsngal kun las rab tu grol //
translated: He is completely liberated from all suffering.

original: zhes bya ba 'dis ni tshul khrims kyi skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu thag mi ring ba bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'dis ni tshul khrims kyi skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu thag mi ring ba bstan to //
translated: By this, the proximate human action result of morality is taught.

original: de ltar tshul khrims kyis sdug bsngal kun las rab tu grol bar 'gyur zhe na /🔽de'i phyir / dag rnams srung zhing yid kyis rab bsdams te //
analyzed: de ltar tshul khrims kyis sdug bsngal kun las rab tu grol bar 'gyur zhe na / de'i phyir / dag rnams srung zhing yid kyis rab bsdams te //
translated: If one asks, “How does one become completely liberated from all suffering through morality?”🔽Therefore, it is said:

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The pure ones guard it and are restrained in mind.

original: gang gi phyir tshul khrims phun sum tshogs pa ngan song gi sgo sbyong zhing 'phags pa'i lam thob pa de sdug bsngal thams cad las grol ba de'i phyir 'di ni tshul khrims kyi skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu thag ring pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir tshul khrims phun sum tshogs pa ngan song gi sgo sbyong zhing 'phags pa'i lam thob pa de sdug bsngal thams cad las grol ba de'i phyir 'di ni tshul khrims kyi skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu thag ring pa yin no //
translated: Because the one who is perfect in morality purifies the door to the lower realms and attains the noble path, he is liberated from all suffering. Therefore, this is the distant human action result of morality.

original: de ltar mdor bsdus pa dang rgyas par bshad pa dag gis sangs rgyas bdun gyi so sor thar pa gdon pa bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar mdor bsdus pa dang rgyas par bshad pa dag gis sangs rgyas bdun gyi so sor thar pa gdon pa bstan nas /

analyzed: da ni mjug bsdu ba'i sgo nas nan tan du bya ba bstan pa'i phyir /

analyzed: 'khor ba 'jig dar gser thub 'od srungs dang / sh'akya thub pa goo tam lha yi lha //

original: mi 'dul kha lo sgyur ba bla na med //
analyzed: mi 'dul kha lo sgyur ba bla na med //
translated: the unsurpassed trainer and charioteer of men,🔽the protector of the world, the supreme refuge,

analyzed: 'jig rten mgon po skyob pa mchog / sangs rgyas dpa' bo bdun po dag / grags ldan na rnams kyi so sor thar //
translated: these seven heroic Buddhas,🔽the renowned ones, have proclaimed this Pratimokṣa.

original: 'di ni rab tu rgyas par bton //🔽'di la sangs rgyas rnams kyang gus //
analyzed: 'di ni rab tu rgyas par bton // 'di la sangs rgyas rnams kyang gus //
translated: This is taught in detail.🔽Herein, the Buddhas are also revered.

original: sangs rgyas nyan thos rnams kyang gus //
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyan thos rnams kyang gus //
translated: Herein, the Buddha's disciples are also revered.

original: 'di la gus dang bcas gyur pas //
analyzed: 'di la gus dang bcas gyur pas //

original: 'dus ma byas pa thob par gyis //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas pa thob par gyis //

analyzed: zhes bya ba tshigs su bcad pa gsum yang dag par sdud par byed pas smras so //

original: @196b de la ;🔽sangs rgyas rnam gzigs gtsug tor thams cad skyob //
analyzed: @196b de la ; sangs rgyas rnam gzigs gtsug tor thams cad skyob //
translated: The seven buddhas are:

analyzed: 'khor ba 'jig dang gser thub 'od srungs dang // sh'akya thub pa zhes bya ba rnams ni sangs rgyas bdun gyi mchan te /

original: go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: go rims bzhin no //
translated: They are in that order.

original: goo ta ma lha yi lha //
analyzed: goo ta ma lha yi lha //
translated: The one of the Gautama family, the god of gods,

original: mi 'dul kha lo sgyur ba bla na med //
analyzed: mi 'dul kha lo sgyur ba bla na med //
translated: the unsurpassed tamer of men, the charioteer.

original: ces bya ba dag ni bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa'i gdung dang yon tan goo ta ma zhes bya ba ni gdung ste drang srong goo ta ma'i rgyud yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ces bya ba dag ni bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa'i gdung dang yon tan goo ta ma zhes bya ba ni gdung ste drang srong goo ta ma'i rgyud yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The one of the Gautama family is the Bhagavān Śākyamuni. Gautama is the family name, because he is of the lineage of the ṛṣi Gautama.

original: lha'i lha zhes bya ba ni chos nyid kyis grags pa'i sgo nas ni snyigs ma lnga shas che ba'i 'dus na sems can la phan pa rdzogs par mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lha'i lha zhes bya ba ni chos nyid kyis grags pa'i sgo nas ni snyigs ma lnga shas che ba'i 'dus na sems can la phan pa rdzogs par mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The god of gods is the god of gods, because he is renowned by nature, since he completely benefits sentient beings in the degenerate age.

original: 'jig rten gyi grags pa'i sgo nas ni lha rnams kyis kyang zhabs la btud de phyag byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi grags pa'i sgo nas ni lha rnams kyis kyang zhabs la btud de phyag byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He is renowned in the world because the gods bow their heads to his feet.

original: mi 'dul kha lo sgyur ba bla na med //
analyzed: mi 'dul kha lo sgyur ba bla na med //
translated: He is the unsurpassed trainer, the charioteer of men to be tamed.

original: ces bya ba ni 'jam pa dang / rtsub pa dang / gnyi ga'i rang bzhin gyi 'dul ba rnam gsum gyis 'dul ba skyes bu dam pa dag phyin ci ma log par 'dul bar mdzad pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: ces bya ba ni 'jam pa dang / rtsub pa dang / gnyi ga'i rang bzhin gyi 'dul ba rnam gsum gyis 'dul ba skyes bu dam pa dag phyin ci ma log par 'dul bar mdzad pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: He is the unsurpassed trainer, the charioteer of men to be tamed, because he correctly trains the holy beings by means of the three trainings: the training in the mild path, the training in the rough path, and the training in the path that is both mild and rough.

original: /'jig rten mgon po zhes bya ba ni khams gsum pa'i mgon po ste /
analyzed: /'jig rten mgon po zhes bya ba ni khams gsum pa'i mgon po ste /

analyzed: than pa dpag tu med pa mdzad pas yongs su skyob par mdzad pa'i phyir ro //

original: skyob pa zhes bya ba ni mnga' dbang gis chos thams cad la dbang phyug brnyes pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: skyob pa zhes bya ba ni mnga' dbang gis chos thams cad la dbang phyug brnyes pa'i phyir ram /

original: 'dul ba'i skye bo dus mi g-yo bar skyob par mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dul ba'i skye bo dus mi g-yo bar skyob par mdzad pa'i phyir ro //

original: mchog ces bya ba ni gtso bo ste bla na med pa'i mkhyen pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ram //
analyzed: mchog ces bya ba ni gtso bo ste bla na med pa'i mkhyen pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ram //

original: rjes su mthun pa'i phan pa mdzad pa yongs su mkhyen pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes su mthun pa'i phan pa mdzad pa yongs su mkhyen pa'i phyir ro //
translated: or because he knows how to bring about the benefit that is appropriate.

original: sangs rgyas dpa' bo zhes bya ba ni ye shes la sogs pa dag gis 'gro ba thams cad pas dpa' ba'i sangs rgyas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dpa' bo zhes bya ba ni ye shes la sogs pa dag gis 'gro ba thams cad pas dpa' ba'i sangs rgyas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The Buddha, the Hero, is the Buddha who is a hero in all the worlds by means of his knowledge, etc.

original: grags ldan zhes bya ba ni snyan pa dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: grags ldan zhes bya ba ni snyan pa dang ldan pa ste /
translated: The Glorious One is the one who is endowed with glory.

original: 'jig rten gsum las shin tu 'das pa'i snyan pa'i tshogs dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum las shin tu 'das pa'i snyan pa'i tshogs dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: He is the one who is endowed with the glory that transcends the three worlds.

original: rgyas par bton zhes bya ba ni dus dang por bya ba dang / gsol ba byas nas gdon pa lnga po dag bton pa'o //🔽'di la sangs rgyas rnams dang gang //
analyzed: rgyas par bton zhes bya ba ni dus dang por bya ba dang / gsol ba byas nas gdon pa lnga po dag bton pa'o // 'di la sangs rgyas rnams dang gang //
translated: The one who has recited it in full is the one who has recited the five recitations in the first period of time.🔽The Buddhas and the disciples of the Buddha

original: sangs rgyas nyan thos rnams kyang gus //
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyan thos rnams kyang gus //
translated: have respect for this.

original: zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni chos 'dul ba la gtso bor mdzad do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni chos 'dul ba la gtso bor mdzad do //
translated: The Blessed Buddhas have respect for the Dharma-Vinaya as the most important thing.

original: sangs rgyas nyan thos rnams kyang 'dul ba la gus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyan thos rnams kyang 'dul ba la gus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And the disciples of the Buddha have respect for the Vinaya.

original: 'di la gus dang bcas gyur pas //
analyzed: 'di la gus dang bcas gyur pas //
translated: One who has respect for this

original: 'dus ma byas pa thob par gyis //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas pa thob par gyis //
translated: attains the unconditioned.

original: @197a * // zhes bya ba ni so sor thar pa 'di la gus pa dang bcas pas mya ngan las 'das pa 'dus ma byas thob par gyis shig ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: @197a * // zhes bya ba ni so sor thar pa 'di la gus pa dang bcas pas mya ngan las 'das pa 'dus ma byas thob par gyis shig ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means that you should attain the unconditioned nirvana through respect for this pratimoksha.

original: ji ltar 'di la gus pa dang bcas pas 'dus ma byas pa thob par bya zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar 'di la gus pa dang bcas pas 'dus ma byas pa thob par bya zhe na /
translated: How should you attain the unconditioned through respect for this?🔽Therefore it is said:

original: de'i phyir // brtsam par bya zhing 'byung bar bya //
analyzed: de'i phyir // brtsam par bya zhing 'byung bar bya //
translated: You should undertake and emerge,

original: sangs rgyas bstan la 'jug par bya //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bstan la 'jug par bya //
translated: enter the teaching of the Buddha,

original: 'dam bu'i khyim la glang chen bzhin //
analyzed: 'dam bu'i khyim la glang chen bzhin //
translated: like an elephant in a house of reeds,

original: 'chi bdag sde ni gzhom par bya //🔽gang zhig rab tu bag yod pas //
analyzed: 'chi bdag sde ni gzhom par bya // gang zhig rab tu bag yod pas //
translated: destroy the army of the Lord of Death.🔽Whoever practices this Dharma-Vinaya

original: chos 'dul 'di la spyod gyur pa //
analyzed: chos 'dul 'di la spyod gyur pa //
translated: with utmost heedfulness,

original: skye ba'i 'khor ba rab spangs nas //
analyzed: skye ba'i 'khor ba rab spangs nas //
translated: having abandoned the cycle of birth,

original: sdug bsngal tha mar byed par 'gyur //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te ;
analyzed: sdug bsngal tha mar byed par 'gyur // zhes bya ba gsungs te ;
translated: will make an end to suffering.

analyzed: brtsam par bya zhing zhes bya ba ni brtsam par gyis shig pa'o //
translated: Undertake means you should undertake.

analyzed: 'byung bar bya zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba las nges par 'byung ba'i phyir dgon pa la sogs pa dben par song shig ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase you should go forth means that you should go to a secluded place such as a forest in order to go forth from cyclic existence.

original: sangs rgyas bstan la zhes bya ba ni bden pa bzhi bstan pa la'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bstan la zhes bya ba ni bden pa bzhi bstan pa la'o //
translated: The phrase in the Buddha's teaching refers to the teaching of the four noble truths.

original: 'jug par bya zhes bya ba ni mgo dang gos la me 'bar ba ltar mngon par brtson par gyis shig pa'o //
analyzed: 'jug par bya zhes bya ba ni mgo dang gos la me 'bar ba ltar mngon par brtson par gyis shig pa'o //
translated: The phrase you should enter it means that you should strive to enter it as if your head or clothing were on fire.

original: 'dam bu khyim la glang chen bzhin //
analyzed: 'dam bu khyim la glang chen bzhin //
translated: Like an elephant destroying a house of reeds,

original: zhes bya ba ni 'chi bdag sde chen gzhom par bya ba'i dpe yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'chi bdag sde chen gzhom par bya ba'i dpe yin te /
