original: 'dam bu'i khyim glang po ches 'joms pa bzhin du'o //
analyzed: 'dam bu'i khyim glang po ches 'joms pa bzhin du'o //
translated: Like an elephant destroying a house of reeds.

original: 'chi bdag zhes bya ba ni 'chi ba'o ;
analyzed: 'chi bdag zhes bya ba ni 'chi ba'o ;
translated: The phrase the Lord of Death refers to death.

original: / sde zhes bya ba ni sred pa la sogs pa 'khor ro //
analyzed: / sde zhes bya ba ni sred pa la sogs pa 'khor ro //
translated: The phrase great army refers to the retinue of craving and so on.

original: gzhom par bya zhes bya ba ni gzhig par gyis shig ces bya ba'o //🔽phan yon bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: gzhom par bya zhes bya ba ni gzhig par gyis shig ces bya ba'o // phan yon bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: The phrase you should destroy it means that you should annihilate it.🔽In order to demonstrate the benefits of heedfulness,

original: gang zhig rab tu bag yod pas //
analyzed: gang zhig rab tu bag yod pas //
translated: the text says:

original: chos 'dul 'di la spyod gyur pa //
analyzed: chos 'dul 'di la spyod gyur pa //
translated: Those who practice this Dharma and Vinaya🔽with the utmost heedfulness,

original: skye ba'i 'khor ba rab spangs nas //
analyzed: skye ba'i 'khor ba rab spangs nas //
translated: Having completely abandoned birth in cyclic existence,

original: sdug bsngal tha ma byed par 'gyur //
analyzed: sdug bsngal tha ma byed par 'gyur //
translated: he makes an end of suffering.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Thus it is said.

original: rab tu bag yod par zhes bya ba ni rab tu bag med pa spangs pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu bag yod par zhes bya ba ni rab tu bag med pa spangs pa'o //
translated: “Being very heedful” means having abandoned heedlessness.

original: chos zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: chos zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'o //
translated: “The Dharma” is the eightfold noble path.

analyzed: 'dul ba zhes bya ba ni yang dag par bsgrub pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: “The Vinaya” is the characteristic of correct practice.

original: spyod 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni rjes su bsgrub par gyur ba'o //
analyzed: spyod 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni rjes su bsgrub par gyur ba'o //
translated: “One practices” means one practices in accordance with it.

original: 'khor ba zhes bya ba ni skye ba'i 'khor ba'i gtso bo yin pas skye ba'i 'khor ba ste 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal gyi rtsa ba ni skye ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khor ba zhes bya ba ni skye ba'i 'khor ba'i gtso bo yin pas skye ba'i 'khor ba ste 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal gyi rtsa ba ni skye ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Cyclic existence” is the cyclic existence of birth, because birth is the root of the suffering of cyclic existence.🔽Thus, if there were birth, there would be aging and death,

original: de ltar 'di don med phyir skye ba yod na rga shi dang // nad dang sdug bsngal bas dang bcing la sogs pa'i dgra dag yod //
analyzed: de ltar 'di don med phyir skye ba yod na rga shi dang // nad dang sdug bsngal bas dang bcing la sogs pa'i dgra dag yod //
translated: sickness, suffering, and the enemies such as bondage, and so on.🔽If there were no birth, there would be no suffering,

original: gal te @197b 'jigs mang skye ba med na don med de mi 'byung //
analyzed: gal te @197b 'jigs mang skye ba med na don med de mi 'byung //
translated: and the many fears of cyclic existence would not exist.

analyzed: shing skyes med na nags me rlung gis bsgyel bar mi 'gyur bzhin // zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If the tree does not exist, the forest fire will not topple it.

original: yang na skye ba'i 'khor ba zhes bya ba ni skye ba dag tu 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang na skye ba'i 'khor ba zhes bya ba ni skye ba dag tu 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Or, the term “cyclic existence of birth” means that birth is repeated.

original: rab spangs nas zhes bya ba ni nan tan du spangs nas so //
analyzed: rab spangs nas zhes bya ba ni nan tan du spangs nas so //
translated: “Having completely abandoned” means having abandoned through practice.

original: sdug bsngal zhes bya ba ni skye ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal zhes bya ba ni skye ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: “Suffering” refers to birth and so on.

original: tha mar byed par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni rgyun chad par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: tha mar byed par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni rgyun chad par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: “Will come to an end” means the continuum will be severed.

original: da ni so sor thar pa'i mdo ga don pa'i mjug bsdu ba'i yang dag par sdud par byed pas /
analyzed: da ni so sor thar pa'i mdo ga don pa'i mjug bsdu ba'i yang dag par sdud par byed pas /
translated: Now, the compiler, who is summarizing the meaning of the Pratimokṣa Sūtra, says:

original: phan tshun tshul khrims bsrung ba dang // bstan pa 'phel bar bya ba'i phyir //
analyzed: phan tshun tshul khrims bsrung ba dang // bstan pa 'phel bar bya ba'i phyir //
translated: In order to mutually protect morality and increase the teachings,

original: so sor thar pa 'di bton pas//
analyzed: so sor thar pa 'di bton pas//
translated: this Pratimokṣa was recited.

original: dge 'dun gyis ni gso sbyong byas //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyis ni gso sbyong byas //
translated: The Saṅgha has performed the poṣadha.

original: zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: He says this.

original: de la phan tshun tshul khrims bsrung ba zhes bya ba ni gcig la gcig 'doms shing rjes su bstan pa dang / gcig la gcig ltung ba las bslang ba'o //
analyzed: de la phan tshun tshul khrims bsrung ba zhes bya ba ni gcig la gcig 'doms shing rjes su bstan pa dang / gcig la gcig ltung ba las bslang ba'o //
translated: The phrase they will observe morality in relation to one another means that they will instruct and teach one another and that they will help one another to rise up from transgressions.

original: bstan pa 'phel bar bya ba'i phyir //
analyzed: bstan pa 'phel bar bya ba'i phyir //
translated: In order to increase the teaching.

original: zhes bya ba ni phan tshun tshul khrims bsrung ba nyid do ;
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni phan tshun tshul khrims bsrung ba nyid do ;
translated: The phrase they will observe morality in relation to one another means that they will observe morality in relation to one another.

original: / de lta bus bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa de'i 'khor 'di 'phel bar 'gyur ba'i rim gyis ston pa'i bstan pa 'phel zhing yun ring du gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: / de lta bus bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa de'i 'khor 'di 'phel bar 'gyur ba'i rim gyis ston pa'i bstan pa 'phel zhing yun ring du gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The Blessed One has taught that the retinue of that Tathāgata will increase in this way, and that the teaching of the Master will increase and endure for a long time.

original: so sor thar pa 'di bton pas //
analyzed: so sor thar pa 'di bton pas //
translated: By reciting this Prātimokṣa.

original: zhes bya ba ni sems drang por bsgrub pa dang / 'gal ba bzlog pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa gzhan gyis kyang gso sbyong bya ba yod mod kyi skabs 'dir ni so sor thar pa'i mdo gdon pa rnam pa lnga po gleng gzhi gdon pa dang /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sems drang por bsgrub pa dang / 'gal ba bzlog pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa gzhan gyis kyang gso sbyong bya ba yod mod kyi skabs 'dir ni so sor thar pa'i mdo gdon pa rnam pa lnga po gleng gzhi gdon pa dang /
translated: Although the purification of one's attitude and the avoidance of conflict and so on are also forms of purification of the precepts, in this context the recitation of the Prātimokṣa Sūtra is the five-part recitation of the introduction, the basic precepts, the conclusion, the benefits of observing the precepts, and the benefits of restoration of the precepts.

original: pham par 'gyur ba gdon pa dang / dge 'dun lhag ma gdon pa dang / ma nges pa gdon pa dang / ril gyis gdon pa dag gis gso sbyong bya dgos pas so sor thar pa 'di bton pas zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: pham par 'gyur ba gdon pa dang / dge 'dun lhag ma gdon pa dang / ma nges pa gdon pa dang / ril gyis gdon pa dag gis gso sbyong bya dgos pas so sor thar pa 'di bton pas zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: because the purification and restoration of the individual is necessary through the restoration of the defeated, the restoration of the remaining in the order, the restoration of the undetermined, and the restoration of the whole.

original: dge 'dun gyis ni gso sbyong byas //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyis ni gso sbyong byas //
translated: The purification and restoration of the order

original: zhes bya ba ni zhi gnas kyi gso sbyong dang / mthun pa'i gso sbyong las 'dir ni mthun pa'i gso sbyong sbyar ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni zhi gnas kyi gso sbyong dang / mthun pa'i gso sbyong las 'dir ni mthun pa'i gso sbyong sbyar ro //
translated: is the purification and restoration of serenity and the purification and restoration of harmony. Here, the purification and restoration of harmony is applied.

original: mthun pa'i gso sbyong rnam pa lnga po bcu bzhi pa dang / bco lnga pa dang / bkra shis kyi gso sbyong dang / gnod pa byung ba'i gso sbyong dang / bsdum pa'i gso sbyong dag las 'dir ci rigs par sbyar te /
analyzed: mthun pa'i gso sbyong rnam pa lnga po bcu bzhi pa dang / bco lnga pa dang / bkra shis kyi gso sbyong dang / gnod pa byung ba'i gso sbyong dang / bsdum pa'i gso sbyong dag las 'dir ci rigs par sbyar te /
translated: The purification and restoration of harmony is of five types: the fourteenth, the fifteenth, the purification and restoration of auspiciousness, the purification and restoration of harm, and the purification and restoration of reconciliation. Here, it is applied as appropriate.

original: gtso cher ni bcu bzhi pa'am bco lnga pa dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: gtso cher ni bcu bzhi pa'am bco lnga pa dang sbyar ro //
translated: Primarily, it is applied to the fourteenth or the fifteenth.

original: dngos gzhi dang mjug dag gi sgo nas bag yod par bsrung bar gyis shig ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dngos gzhi dang mjug dag gi sgo nas bag yod par bsrung bar gyis shig ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is: “You should protect yourself with heedfulness through the main part and the conclusion.”

original: g-yag rnga'i rtse mo ji bzhin no //
analyzed: g-yag rnga'i rtse mo ji bzhin no //
translated: Like the tip of a yak’s tail.

original: zhes bya ba ni bag yod par bsrung bar bya ba'i dpe ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bag yod par bsrung bar bya ba'i dpe ste /
translated: This is an example of how to protect yourself with heedfulness.

original: ji ltar bsil rung gangs khrod na gnas pa'i g-yag rnga la bag yod pas bsrung ba rnga ma'i rtse mo lta bur gzar te /
analyzed: ji ltar bsil rung gangs khrod na gnas pa'i g-yag rnga la bag yod pas bsrung ba rnga ma'i rtse mo lta bur gzar te /
translated: Just as a yak living in the snow mountains protects itself with heedfulness by keeping its tail hair erect,

original: 'gro ba de bzhin du tshul khrims 'di yang bag yod pas bsrung bar gyis shig ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'gro ba de bzhin du tshul khrims 'di yang bag yod pas bsrung bar gyis shig ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: so you should protect this morality with heedfulness. This is the meaning.

original: da ni yang dag par sdud par byed pas 'dul ba'i sde snod yang dag par bsdu ba mthar phyin nas dge ba'i rtsa ba bsngo ba'i phyir //🔽so sor thar pa ston pa yi //
analyzed: da ni yang dag par sdud par byed pas 'dul ba'i sde snod yang dag par bsdu ba mthar phyin nas dge ba'i rtsa ba bsngo ba'i phyir // so sor thar pa ston pa yi //
translated: Now, the compiler, having completed the correct compilation of the Vinaya Piṭaka, in order to dedicate the roots of virtue,

original: bsod nams grub pa gang yod pa //
analyzed: bsod nams grub pa gang yod pa //
translated: Whatever merit has been accomplished🔽By teaching the Prātimokṣa,

original: des ni 'jig rten ma lus pa ;
analyzed: des ni 'jig rten ma lus pa ;
translated: By that, may all worlds

original: / thub dbang go 'phang thob par shog / ces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: / thub dbang go 'phang thob par shog / ces bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Attain the stage of the Lord of Sages.

original: thub pa ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: thub pa ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas so //
translated: The “Sage” is the Śrāvaka and the Pratyekabuddha.

original: de'i dbang po ni de bzhin gshegs pa ste /
analyzed: de'i dbang po ni de bzhin gshegs pa ste /
translated: The “Lord of the Sages” is the Tathāgata.

original: so sor thar pa 'di ston pa'i bsod nams grub pa gang yod pa des //
analyzed: so sor thar pa 'di ston pa'i bsod nams grub pa gang yod pa des //
translated: The merit that is accomplished by teaching this Prātimokṣa,

original: 'jig rten ma lus pa thams cad thub pa'i dbang po sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi go 'phang thob par shog ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'jig rten ma lus pa thams cad thub pa'i dbang po sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi go 'phang thob par shog ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: by that may all the worlds attain the state of the Blessed Buddha, the Lord of the Sages. This is the meaning.

original: de ltar yang dag par sdud par byed pas so sor thar pa'i mdo yang dag par bsdu ba 'di yang rgyud chags gsum pa'i tshul du brtsams pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar yang dag par sdud par byed pas so sor thar pa'i mdo yang dag par bsdu ba 'di yang rgyud chags gsum pa'i tshul du brtsams pa yin te /
translated: Thus, this Prātimokṣa Sūtra, which is compiled in this way, is composed in the manner of three connected parts.🔽First, it is said:

original: dang por / snyan pa'i ba dan 'jig rten gsum du grags //
analyzed: dang por / snyan pa'i ba dan 'jig rten gsum du grags //
translated: The banner of fame resounds in the three worlds,

original: dam pa'i chos sgra seng ge'i sgra bsgrags pa //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos sgra seng ge'i sgra bsgrags pa //
translated: The lion’s roar of the true Dharma resounds,

original: thams cad mkhyen pa dkon mchog mdzod brnyes pa //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa dkon mchog mdzod brnyes pa //
translated: The omniscient one, the treasure of the Three Jewels,

original: zhabs la tshangs dbang gtsug gi nor bus gtugs //
analyzed: zhabs la tshangs dbang gtsug gi nor bus gtugs //
translated: Is touched on the head by the crown jewels of Brahmā and Indra.

original: sdug bsngal rgya mtsho gting mtha' med brgal ba //
analyzed: sdug bsngal rgya mtsho gting mtha' med brgal ba //
translated: Having crossed the boundless ocean of suffering,

original: 'gro ba'i gtso la spyi bos phyag 'tshal te //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i gtso la spyi bos phyag 'tshal te //
translated: Bowing one's head to the chief of beings,

original: zhes smos pas de ni phyag 'tshal ba'i rgyud bstan @198b to ;
analyzed: zhes smos pas de ni phyag 'tshal ba'i rgyud bstan @198b to ;
translated: This is the explanation of the lineage of homage.

original: / de'i 'og tu /
analyzed: / de'i 'og tu /
translated: Then,

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i bslab gzhi dkon mchog snod //🔽'phags pa'i tshogs kyi dbus su dbye bar bya //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i bslab gzhi dkon mchog snod // 'phags pa'i tshogs kyi dbus su dbye bar bya //
translated: The basis of training of the Omniscient One, the vessel of the Three Jewels,

original: zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Should be distinguished in the midst of the assembly of the Noble Ones.

original: tshul khrims 'di ni bsrung bya ste /
analyzed: tshul khrims 'di ni bsrung bya ste /
translated: This morality should be guarded,

original: g-yag rnga'i rtse mo ji bzhin no //
analyzed: g-yag rnga'i rtse mo ji bzhin no //
translated: Just like the tip of a yak's horn.

original: zhes gsungs pa'i bar gyis ni mdo gdon pa'i rgyud bstan to //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa'i bar gyis ni mdo gdon pa'i rgyud bstan to //
translated: This is the explanation of the lineage of the recitation of the sutras.

original: mjug tu ; so sor thar pa ston pa yi //
analyzed: mjug tu ; so sor thar pa ston pa yi //
translated: In conclusion,

original: bsod nams grub pa gang yod pa //
analyzed: bsod nams grub pa gang yod pa //
translated: Whatever merit is accomplished🔽By teaching the Pratimoksha,

original: des ni 'jig rten ma lus pa //
analyzed: des ni 'jig rten ma lus pa //
translated: By that, may the entire world🔽Attain the state of the Lord of Sages.

original: thub dbang go 'phang thob par shog / ces gsungs pas ni bsngo ba'i rgyud bstan to //
analyzed: thub dbang go 'phang thob par shog / ces gsungs pas ni bsngo ba'i rgyud bstan to //
translated: This is the explanation of the lineage of dedication.

original: bsdu ba'i mtshan nyid bshad zin to //
analyzed: bsdu ba'i mtshan nyid bshad zin to //
translated: The characteristics of the compilation have been explained.

original: so sor thar pa'i tshig gi brjed byang rdzogs so /
analyzed: so sor thar pa'i tshig gi brjed byang rdzogs so /
translated: The summary of the words of the Pratimoksha is complete.

original: // / dbang phyug dam pa'i mnga' bdag dpal lha btsan po'i bka' lung gis 'phags pa gzhi thams cad yod par smra ba'i 'dul ba 'dzin pa kha che bye brag tu smra ba'i slob dpon dzi na mi tra dang / zhu chen gyi lo ts'a ba bande klu'i rgyal mtshan gyis zhus te gtan la bab pa'o /
analyzed: // / dbang phyug dam pa'i mnga' bdag dpal lha btsan po'i bka' lung gis 'phags pa gzhi thams cad yod par smra ba'i 'dul ba 'dzin pa kha che bye brag tu smra ba'i slob dpon dzi na mi tra dang / zhu chen gyi lo ts'a ba bande klu'i rgyal mtshan gyis zhus te gtan la bab pa'o /
translated: By the order of the sovereign lord, the glorious divine king, the master of the Kashmir Vaibhāṣika Vinaya, the noble Jinamitra, and the great editor, the translator Bandé Lui Gyaltsen, translated and finalized this text.
